loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 35 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maricel has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell charcoal business for 10 years and also earns an income from fish vending and pig fattening.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buying and selling rice business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice business.

Marilyn has been in this business for three years. Marilyn earns more income from buying and selling bamboo and pig fattening.

Marilyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 42 years old and has four children. Marlene is married and has one child who is in school.

She is in the agricultural business of farming rice in the Philippines. Marlene requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

Marlene has been farming rice for eight years and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
Maximina is 65 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, fattening pigs in the Philippines. Maximina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maximina has been pig fattening for seven years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maximina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Melody

texts.en:
Melody is 38 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Melody has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from food vending.

She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries

loans.name: Ashoki B Group

texts.en:
Piala is a mother of two schooling kids and is in her 30s. She is married and together they manage a shop selling shoes, an activity she has been doing since 1994. Piala started this business for the sake of supporting her family and parents rather than looking to her husband for all their needs. She is a different mother, working hard and she desires to improve her shop and build a nice house. Piala opens her business from 6:30 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good profit.
 
From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her fourth loan request. She will invest the loan to buy more fashionable footwear. Next month is the month of sales, according to Piala, so she needs to buy more shoes to make her shop attractive to more people. She used the previous credits, which she paid back successfully, to improve her shop with more shoes. With a good job, she earned a profit, which she used to buy a plot of land and covered school fees and part of the household expenses.
 
She will share this loan with her group ASHOKI B, which totals three members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more fashionable footwear.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 43 years old and married with eight children.  With four children in school, Elsie works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a buy-and-sell nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of nipa roofing to sell. She has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Elsie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of nipa (palm thatch) roofing to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy two head of cattle.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has one child who is in school.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Fe has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Necita

texts.en:
Necita is 37 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice, corn and vegetables in the Philippines. Necita is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Necita has been farming rice, corn and vegetables for three years and earns additional income from fishing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Mpunga Group

texts.en:
Omary, who is in his early 50s, is married with six children.  Five of the kids are still at school and one is grown-up.  He has been selling fruits in season.  In Dar es Salaam, fruits come according to the season. November to March is the season for mangoes and pineapples and June and July is for oranges and melons.  Omary is selling plenty of mangoes at both wholesale and retail. He has been in this business for five years now.  He works from 8 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Omary has taken several loans from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy fruits according to the season. He has successfully paid back all his loans and is doing great with the loan.  He appreciates Kiva for supporting their group.  He used the profit to build his house, pay school fees and cover household expenses.  He will use this loan to buy oranges to sell at retail and at wholesale. He dreams of renovating his house to be up to standard and to get a good rent from it.

Omary will share this loan with his loan group MPUNGA, which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy oranges to sell at retail and wholesale prices

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business making hollow blocks in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy bags of cement, sand and gravel for making hollow blocks.

Norma has been in this business for 15 years. She earns more income from direct selling Avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy bags of cement, sand and gravel for making hollow blocks

loans.name: Rose Marline

texts.en:
Rose Marline is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling vinegar in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of vinegar to sell. 

Rose Marline has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of vinegar to sell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a married woman with three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past three years, she has operated a shop kiosk business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase sugar, maize flour, paraffin, and wheat flour for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, paraffin, and wheat flour for resale.

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
María, es jefa de su hogar, sola responde a las necesidades de su familia, vive junto a sus dos hijos, está soltera; como una forma de generar ingresos se dedica vender granos básicos y diferentes productos de primera necesidad, ella aprendió el oficio de su hermana, ya cuenta con 14 años de experiencia, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde, sus hijos le colaboran en el negocio.
El financiamiento le ayudara a comparar mercadería para fortalecer su negocio como arroz, frijoles, aceite, bebidas, maicillo, golosinas, pan, jabón, lejía, etc. Espera mejorar el inventario de la tienda, aumentar ventas y ganancias, con las que cancelara su deuda.
Su sueño es mejorar su situación económica para cambiar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Mary is head of her household: she single-handedly has to meet the needs of her family. She is single and lives with her two children. As a way to generate revenue, she sells grains and several different staples - a trade she learned  from her sister. Enjoying 14 years of experience, she works from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon. Her kids pitch in with the business.


The loan will help her buy merchandise such as rice, beans, oil, drinks, sorghum, candy, bread, soap, bleach, etc., to strengthen her sales. She hopes to upgrade the store's inventory and increase both sales and earnings, from which she will repay her loan.


Her dream is to improve her economic situation to change her family's lifestyle.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, oil, drinks, sorghum, candy, bread, soap, bleach, etc..

loans.name: Sitora

texts.en: Sitora is a wonderful woman. She is 28 years old. Since childhood, Sitora has always dreamed of being a sewer. Now, she is a sewer and her dream has been realized. Sitora has been busy with sewing for more than three years. She sews national women’s dresses. Sitora sews mainly dresses for fiancées. She has her regular clients. Sitora is a careful mother of two children. She and her husband always try to offer comfortable living conditions for their children. Sitora is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials to repair her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair her house

loans.name: Ashoki A Group

texts.en:
Hapiness is a businesswoman in her 40s, living with her family (husband and four schooling children). She has been managing a shop selling shoes and slippers, an activity she has been doing since 2008. She operates her business from 6 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

She is requesting her 11th loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. Hapiness used the previous loans, all of which she paid back successfully, to restock her shop with modern and fashionable shoes. She took this month as a month of making profit since most of the Muslims are preparing for their ceremony (Id-Mubarak). She need to replenish her shop with the most demanded shoes to sell more. Hapiness received a profit, which she used to maintain her family with food and school fees. She bought a plot of land where she expects to build a house. She is so thankful with everyone who supports her group and took the time to go through her business story. Her desire is to finish building her family house so that she can eliminate renting problems. 

She will share this loan with her loan group “ASHOKI A”, which consists of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the most popular footwear to resell.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is married with three school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanatumu has operated a fish selling business at the market for the past three years, selling to her town dwellers and neighbors.

Mwanatumu is requesting a loan to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood. She decided to join Yehu to access loans at lower cost to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of fish, cooking oil and firewood.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. Besides the grocery store, Mwanamisi operates a clothes selling business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bales of clothes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Ndeye Ndieme's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 28 membres, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été crée le 22 octobre 2012. Il regroupe des femmes qui se connaissent bien et qui font de l’embouche et du commerce.
Coumba debout sur la photo et levant la main, est âgée de 44 ans. Elle mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont une fille.
Elle envisage de faire de l’embouche ovine. Elle va acheter 2 moutons à 15000 l’unité. Elle les engraisse pendant 4 mois pour les revendre à 50000f chacun. Pour les besoins de nourriture du bétail elle achète du foin pour une valeur de 10000f.
Son mari étant vieux, c’est elle qui l’épaule pour pendre en charge les besoins de la famille tant en nourriture, en habillement que pour la santé. Sadio2
texts.en:
This group of 28 members is part of the "banc villageois" loan association that was created October 22, 2012. It includes women who know each other well and who are involved in fattening livestock and retail commerce.

44-year-old Coumba is standing in the photo and raising her hand. She is married and has five children, including a daughter. 

She intends to fatten sheep. She will buy two sheep at 15,000 each. She fattens them for four months for resale at 50,000 francs each. For the livestock's food requirements, she buys 10,000 francs worth of hay.

Her husband being elderly, she supports him in taking care of the family's food, clothing and health requirements.

loans.use: buy two sheep

loans.name: Ashoki C Group

texts.en:
Bertha, who is the mother of one child in school, is in her late thirties and married. She supports her family by running an enterprise selling footwear of different types, a business she has been with for three years. She starts working from 6 am to 6 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This is her third loan request via Kiva partner’s Tujijenge Tanzania. Bertha used the previous loans to purchase more fashionable shoes. She managed to resell them and earned an extra income which she used to buy a plot of land where she wishes to build a house. She covered part of the school fees and home food expenses. Bertha paid back all her loans successfully. She is requesting a new credit to invest in her footwear shop. In the coming years, Bertha would like to build a house and improve her shop more.

She will share this loan with her loan group “Ashoki C“ which consists of four members. The members of this group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to invest in her footwear shop.

loans.name: Sibel

texts.en:
Sibel is married and is the mother of three children ranging in age from five to eleven. She started out selling clothes out of her home. Eventually, she began her real profession, working as a seamstress. She took in material in bulk from various businesses, sewed the pieces, and then delivered the finished product. As she got more work, eventually she was able to rent a shop, where she now works. With the loan from Maya, she intends to buy another sewing machine, which will enable her to work more quickly. Her dream is to open a larger shop, to have more sewing machines, and to provide work to other women. With the money she earns, she wants to provide a good future for her children and to send them to university.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

Sibel hanım evli. En büyüğü onbir en küçüğü beş yaşında üç çocuk annesi. İlk başlarda evde çamaşır satarak işe başlamış. Daha sonraları mesleği olan terzilik işine başlıyor. Çeşitli işyerlerinden toplu mal alıp dikişini dikip teslim ediyor. İşleri büyüyünce kendine bir dükkan tuttu ve işlerini burada yapıyor. Aldığı kredi ile bir tane daha dikiş makinası alacak. Böylece işleri çabuklaşacak. Hayali daha da büyük bir yer açmak. Makinalarını çoğaltmak ve başka kadınlara iş imkanı sağlamak. Kazancı ile çocuklarına iyi bir gelecek sağlayıp ,üniversitede okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth no es casada pero tiene tres hijos ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento donde paga un alquiler Ruth es comerciante de arroz, aceite, harina, azucar y fideo y necesita un prestamo para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos para su negocio (arroz, aceite, harina, azucar, fideo) para poder incrementar sus ganancias Ruth es la unica fuente de ingresos en su hogar y necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Ruth is not married but she has three children.  She lives in La Paz in a brick and cement house which she rents.  As a merchant she sells rice, oil, flour, sugar and noodles.  She needs a loan to buy more of these supplies for her business to increase her profit.

Ruth is the only source of income for her houshold and she needs your help.

loans.use: To buy more supplies (rice, oil, flour, sugar, noodles) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy maize and bundles of firewood to produce fermented maize pulp

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy materials such as wood and nails to renovate her home.

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: María de 45 años de edad vive con sus tres hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la agricultura de granos básicos siembra maíz y frijol, con sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar,  Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para seguir con sus cultivos, y así poder tener junto con sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria, 45, lives with her three children in her own home.  She works in agriculture growing basic grains such as corn and beans.  With the income from sales she is able to cover household expenses.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy farm supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, composts, etc. and improve the land shown in the photograph.  This is so she can continue with her cultivation activity and enjoy a better quality of life with her children.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, composts, etc. to improve her land.

loans.name: Marziya

texts.en: Marziya was born in 1973. She is married and bringing up two children. She has been busy selling fabrics for more than five years. She sells seasonal fabrics in a local market. Marziya manages the business alone and she is the main breadwinner of her family because her husband is a migrant in Russia. Marziya lives with her children in a house that is in bad condition. She is going to repair her house. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to buy building materials such as cement, wood, paints, etc. for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, wood and paint to repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy various products (canned goods, liqueurs, peanut oil, etc.)

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
This is Halima. She previously accessed a loan that she used to stock her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, biscuits, rice and beans for resale. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, biscuits, rice and beans for resale

loans.name: Xiomara Lissethe

texts.es:
Xiomara, vive en una casa familiar junto a su madre, ella está soltera y aporta para los gastos de su hogar; se dedica a atender su negocio de venta de comida, el cual esta funcionando desde hace 10 años, le colabora su familia, abre sus puertas al público desde las siete de la mañana hasta las seis de la tarde.
Solicita capital para mejorar la atención a sus clientes y elaborar la venta de comida, comprara verduras, carnes, aderezos, bebidas, condimentos, gas propano, platos, tenedores y servilletas. Espera incrementar las ventas y los ingresos para cancelar su deuda.
Su sueño es tener un restaurante para tener mejor economía y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Xiomara lives with her mother in the family home.  She is single and contributes to the household expenses.  She has been running a food stall for ten years with the help of her family.  She is open to the public from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m.

She is requesting a loan to improve customer service and increase sales.  She will buy vegetables, meats, seasonings, beverages, condiments, propane gas, plates, forks and napkins.  She hopes to incease her income and pay off debt.

Her dream is to have a restaurant one day to improve her economy and cover family needs.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meats, seasonings, condiments, beverages, propane gas, dishes, forks and napkins.

loans.name: Semy

texts.en:
Semy works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business making dried fish in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell.

Semy has been in this business for 18 years now.

In the future, Semy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. 

Susan has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of repairing and renovating her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Danath

texts.en:
Danath is a 22-year-old married woman from the Srei Santhor District of Kampong Cham province. She lives in a simple house with her husband and two unmarried children. Danath is a tailor in a small shop located in front of her house. Her husband is a farmer who is working very hard to support the whole family's expenses. The daily income that this couple can make is USD 7.

She wants to promote her family life conveniently by having a hygienic latrine but she can’t afford it. She has requested a loan from Kiva, which she will use to build a latrine. This loan will help her family members become healthier and will benefit the surrounding environment by keeping it clean and free of disease. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for supporting her loan.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Teresita works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of rice grains business in the Philippines and earns additional income from food vending. Teresita is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell. 

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en:
Virgie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Virgie has been in this business for three years. Virgie earns more income from dried fish vending.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a married woman who has been blessed with three school-going children. She lives at her own house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasha has been operating a business selling charcoal, fruits and vegetable from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy firewood and food supplies

loans.name: Ana Del Carmen

texts.es: Ana de 44 años de edad posee un negocio de artículos desechables como vasos, platos, cucharas, tenedores, servilletas, etc. su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años posee clientela establecida por los buenos precios y la calidad de los productos,  Ana vive en casa propia con su dos hijos, su hermana y su sobrina, ella solicita un crédito para la compra de productos para su negocio por mayor, para tener  un mejor nivel de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, has a disposable products business, selling cups, plates, spoons, forks, napkins, etc.  She works from home and has been in business several years.  She has a fixed clientele because of the low prices and quality of her products.

Ana lives in her own home with her two children, a sister and a niece.  She is requesting a loan to buy wholesale products for her business in order to enjoy a better lifestyle with her family.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cups, plates, spoons, forks, napkins, etc.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.es: Fermín de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, el se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz, con sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Fermín solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía, para lograr que su familia y el  tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Fermín, 49, lives in his own home with his family.  He is a very hard-working, responsible person who is dedicated to agriculture, growing corn.  With the income from sales he is able to cover household expenses.

Fermín is requesting a loan to buy farm supplies such as composts, fertilizers, seeds, etc. and improve the land shown in the photograph.  This is so his family can have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy composts, fertilizers, seeds, etc. and improve his land.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo de 48 años de edad, es un hombre  trabajador y responsable, se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar conformado por seis personas sus hijos, su esposa y el, Wilfredo solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como fertilizantes, semillas, controles de plagas, abonos, etc.  y mejorar el terreno para seguir con sus cultivos que es el que muestra la fotografía y así poder darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
48-year-old Wilfredo is a hard-working and responsible man. He has worked for many years growing maize and sorghum. With his earnings from his sales, he manages to pay his household expenses. He lives in his own home with his six-person family, consisting of his children, his spouse and himself. 

Wilfredo is requesting a loan in order to purchase agricultural inputs such as fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, manure, etc., and to improve his land in order to continue growing his crops. You see his land in the photograph. This loan will help him to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, seeds, insecticides, manure etc and to improve his land.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: Buy various items (pasta, canned food and fabrics)

loans.name: Eulalio

texts.es: Eulalio de 60 años de edad, es muy trabajador y dedicado al cultivo de maíz y frijol desde hace 50 años con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas de las necesidades que tiene su hogar, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, Don Eulalio solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Eulalio is 60 years old and is very hard-working. Eulalio has been growing corn and beans for 50 years. With the income from his sales he is able to cover some necessary household costs. Eulalio owns the house where he lives with his family. Eulalio is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more to improve the land shown in the photograph. With this loan, Eulalio can enjoy a higher quality of life alongside his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more to improve the land.

loans.name: Luis Humberto

texts.es: Luis de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, el es muy responsable y trabajador, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz, frijol, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra satisfacer las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, luis solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Luis is 49 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and children. Luis is very responsible and hard-working. He makes a living selling corn and beans and, with the income from his sales, is able to pay for necessities for his household. Luis is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, weed-killers, anti-disease treatments and more. This will help him to offer his family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, weed-killers, anti-disease treatments and more.

loans.name: David Edgardo

texts.es: David de 53 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el es un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica a la mecánica de obra de banco (elaboración de estructuras metálicas: puertas, balcones, portones, techos) desde hace varios años, David solicita a INTEGRAL  un crédito para comprar más materiales como hierro, laminas, metal, electrodos, etc.  ya que tiene mucha demanda porque hace un buen trabajo y con las ganancias que obtiene ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia y solventar los gastos que se le presentan en el hogar.
texts.en: David is 53 years old and lives in the house that he owns with his family. Daivd is very responsible and hard-working. He has been working with metal for a number of years, building structures such as doors, balconies, gates and roofs.  David is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to buy more materials such as iron, metal sheeting, metals, electrodes and more. David has a lot of demand from customers as he does a good job. David uses his profits in order to help his family to prosper and to cover household costs.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal sheeting, metals, electrodes and more.

loans.name: Laureen

texts.en: Laureen appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She is requesting a loan to purchase bales of clothes for resale. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy nylon and cotton thread and pay for manual labour.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María de 47 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijas quienes trabajan y ayudan en los gastos del hogar, ella trabaja como empleada domestica en una casa, con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y con la ayuda de sus hijas, logran solventar los gastos que se les presentan en su hogar, Maria quiere mejorar su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo  por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de hierro, cerámica, cemento, laminas, polines, y pago de mano de obra para poder terminar de construir su casa y así ellas y sus hijas puedan vivir mas cómodas y seguras.
texts.en: María is 47 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her three daughters who work and help with household costs. María works as a domestic servant. With the income from her work, and with the help of her daughters, she is able to cover household expenses. María wants to improve her home but does not have the necessary money to do the work. As a result she is applying for a loan in order to buy iron, ceramics, cement, metal sheeting and purlins, and to pay labourers. With this loan she can finish building her home and María and her daughters can live in a more comfortable and safe environment.

loans.use: to buy iron, ceramics, cement, metal sheeting and purlins, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente  24 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos: maíz y frijol  desde hace 10 años,  comercializa sus productos en los alrededores y mercados de donde el reside, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas solventa los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, el cliente está solicitando a INTEGRAL un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower is 24 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his wife and three children. The borrower has been making a living growing basic grains (corn and beans) for ten years. He sells his products in the local markets and surrounding areas. The income from sales allows him to cover household costs. The borrower is applying for a loan from "Apoyo Integral" in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and more, and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. With this loan, the borrower can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments, weed-killers and more, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Paz Yolanda

texts.es: Paz de 42 años de edad vive con su esposo y sus hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y joyería, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar las necesidades que se les presentan en su hogar, Paz quiere mejorar su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para hacerlo  por eso solicita un crédito para la compra de hierro, cerámica, cemento, laminas, polines, y pago de mano de obra para poder terminar de construir su casa colocando puertas en los cuartos y en la sala y también el piso ya que es de tierra el que esta actualmente y así ellas y su familia puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en: Paz is 42 years old and lives with her husband and children. Paz makes a living selling cosmetics and jewellery. With the money that she earns from sales - and with the help of her husband - she is able to cover household costs. Paz wants to make improvements to her home but does not have enough money to do it. As a result she is applying for a loan in order to buy iron, ceramic, cement, metal sheeting, and purlins, and to pay labourers. With this loan Paz can finish building her home, installing doors on the bedrooms and living room, and laying the floor, which is currently made of earth. With this work done, Paz and her family can live in a comfortable and secure environment.

loans.use: to buy iron, ceramic, cement, metal sheeting, and purlins, and to pay labourers.

loans.name: Herlinda Esperanza

texts.es: Herlinda de 47 años de edad  se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, vive en casa propia con sus hijos, Herlinda solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas como sulfatos, formula, insecticidas, abonos, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía y asi poder tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Herlinda is 47 years old and has been making a living growing corn and sorghum for ten years. With money from sales, Herlinda is able to cover household costs. Herlinda owns the house where she lives with her children. Herlinda is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies such as sulphates, fertilisers, anti-insect chemicals and more, and to improve her land (shown in the photograph). This loan will allow Herlinda and her family to enjoy a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy sulphates, fertilisers, anti-insect chemicals and more, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Erika Aurelia

texts.es: Erika de 30 años de edad, ella se dedica al cultivo de granos básicos desde hace 13 años, vive con el esposo y tres hijos vive en casa propia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades del hogar, Erika solicita un crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz y maicillo, como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia lo que necesitan sin limitación alguna.
texts.en: Erika is 30 years old and has been making a living growing basic grains for 13 years. She lives with her husband and three children in a house that the family owns. With income from sales, Erika is able to cover some household costs. Erika is applying for a loan in order to buy farming supplies for growing corn and sorghum, such as fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more. She will also improve her land (shown in the photograph) in order to earn a higher income and provide her family with everything that they need.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve the land.

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
This is Janiffer. She previously accessed a loan that she used for her business. Her earnings were a big help for her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She is requesting a loan to purchase hair oil, shampoo, braids, and weaves for her business. She appreciates Kiva for their financial support.. 

She looks forward to this financial increase with happiness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to purchase hair oil, shampoo, braids and weaves for her business

loans.name: Ismael Antonio

texts.es: Ismael de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de de maíz y maicillo,  comercializa en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside con lo que obtiene de su trabajo logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Ismael está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ismael is 31 years old and lives in a house that he owns with his family. For a number of years Ismael has been growing corn and sorghum. He sells his products in the area around where he lives and, with earnings from his work, is able to cover some household costs. Ismael is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve his land, which is shown in the photograph. With this loan, Ismael can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve his land.

loans.name: Santos Gregoria

texts.es: Doña Santos de 50 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de jocotes desde hace varios años, adicional a eso también cultiva maíz y maicillo, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que tiene en su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijo y su nieta, Doña santos está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, controles de plagas, herbicidas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que muestra la fotografía, para poder seguir con sus cultivos y obtener mejores ganancias y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en: Santos is 50 years old and has been making a living growing mangoes for a number of years. In addition Santos grows corn and sorghum. She sells her products in various markets and, with money that she earns from sales, helps to cover household costs. Santos lives in a house that she owns with her son and granddaughter. Santos is applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve the land where she grows her crops (shown in the photograph). This loan will allow Santos to continue growing crops and to earn a higher profit; in turn, she can offer her family a higher quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, anti-disease treatments and more, and to improve her land.

loans.name: Şerife

texts.en:
Şerife is an educator and has run her own preschool for 12 years. She chose this job because she loves children. She opened her first preschool in a small apartment and worked day and night to grow her business. This month she moved into a larger, two-story building. She also sells Amway products, working both as an educator and an Amway manager. With the loan, she’ll buy products for her new preschool building. She wants to expand and open additional branches.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Şerife Hanım eğitimci ve oniki yıldır kendi açtığı kreşi işletiyor.  Çocukları çok sevdiğinden bu işi yapıyor.  İlk kreşini küçük bir dairede açıyor ve gece gündüz çalışarak işini geliştirip büyütüyor.  Bu ay daha da büyük iki katlı bir bir binaya geçti.  Aynı zamanda amwey ürünlerinde yöneticilik ve eğitmenlik de yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile yeni yere taşıdığı kreşine  malzeme almak.  İşini daha da büyütüp şubeler açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products for her new preschool building

loans.name: Sothea's Group

texts.en:
Sothea, 32, lives with her husband and two children in a village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 10 years and they supplement the family’s income by working for others for a fee.
 
Sothea’s group consists of three members who are just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now Sothea is leading this group to seek a loan to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy. With this loan, she hopes to increase her family’s income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her rice paddy

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with two school going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

For the past year, she has operated a business selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase pieces of leso (women's wrap) for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase pieces of leso (women's wrap)  for resale.

loans.name: Sambat

texts.en:
Sambat is a 50-year-old married woman from the Svay Chek District of Banteay Meanchey Province. She has two children who are already married. Sambat’s main income comes from agriculture, and she has been a farmer for almost thirty years. By working extremely hard on farmland, she is able to earn USD 3 a day.

Sambat has never had a latrine for household use, and now she wants to improve her living conditions by having a latrine in her house. Because of her insufficient budget, she is requesting a loan to pay for the construction of latrine. This loan will help her family members become healthier and also benefit the surrounding environment by keeping it clean and free of disease. She is thankful to Kiva lenders for supporting her loan.

loans.use: to build a latrine for her household.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married and has six children, all of whom are adults. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Fatuma has operated a cafe business making consumables such as rice, tea, beans and chapatti (flat bread) for sale to passersby and neighbours.She cited seasonality as her major challenge.

With the loan she wants to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, onions, wheat flour and sugar for her business. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients such as cooking oil, onions, wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Voun's Group

texts.en:
Voun is 30 years old and is from a rural area of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She has one child who is still too young for school. 

To make living, Voun has been growing rice and working for others for a fee. Her current business earns her about 40,000KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Voun has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has fully repaid the loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase grocery supplies to start a trading business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a latrine in her house.

loans.name: Edwena

texts.en:
Edwena is a 30-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. 

Edwena is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a business in the Philippines selling blocks of ice, and has been in this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more blocks of ice to sell to her customers.

In the future, Edwena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more blocks of ice to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Nurhayat

texts.en:
Nurhayat is married and is the mother of two daughters, one aged 14 and the other 21. 

After her husband went bankrupt, they had economic problems. She has worked many different jobs, such as housecleaning and dishwashing. Having wet hands all the time caused her health problems. When she went to a doctor, she was advised to use herbal products, which she bought from Amway. She found herself selling the products she used and told her friends and family about them. 

Now she has sold Amway products for two years. She’ll use the loan to buy products 30 percent off and raise her sales in two months. She wants to be promoted to group leader. Her dream is to overcome their economic troubles.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff

loans.use: to buy more Amway products to re-sell.

loans.name: Dyna

texts.en:
Dyna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet café business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit of computer for her business.

Dyna has been in this business for seven years and she earns more income from her general store.

Dyna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional computer for her business

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey is 45 years old and married. She lives with her husband and four children in a rural area located in the Chheng Prey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working as a paid worker in the local area. The current business earns her family about 60,000 KHR per day to feed the family but she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day.

This is the second loan for Srey with VisionFund. Now she is applying for a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her family’s business and earn more income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Saing

texts.en:
Saing is a 40-year-old father of three school-aged children. He lives in a rural area of Svay Chek District, Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. To make a living, he works as a farmer on a small rice field near his house. He has been a farmer for almost twenty years, which allows him to make USD 5 per day.

Saing would like to get his first loan from HKL, which will enable him to build a hygienic latrine for the sake of his family members. He thanks lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides him with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to build a hygienic latrine for his family.

loans.name: Grand Maria School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Cyrus. He is the Head Teacher of Grand Maria Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Nabbigo in Wakiso with 180 students. Grand Maria Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a Tulip water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase Tulip Filtration water treatment system, with 10 Sets of 20 Litre Buckets which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Grand Maria Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Cyrus ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Light Star School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Maria. She is the Administrator of Light Star Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kyenjojo with 350 students. Light Star Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Light Star Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Maria ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Battambang province, Seang is a 59 year-old married woman and also a mother of ten children. She currently has two children dependent on her and she struggles to earn a living for them through her two hectares of rice farming. The average income for her family is only 34,500 KHR per day. 

This is the seventh loan cycle for Seang, and the first cycle for her co-borrower from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. In a group of two, they are applying for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, Seang plans to use her share of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to pay for land plowing fees. She believes that the loan will pave a way for her family to be able to live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seeds and to pay for land plowing fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Sreymom is a resident of Moung Russey district located in Battambang province. She is 25 years old and a married woman with one child. The primary source of income for her family comes from a three-hectare rice farm. She has been engaged in agribusiness for about four years already and it provides an average daily income of 36,700 KHR.
 
Sreymom has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for one cycle already and she has completely repaid the previous loan. Now, she and her co-borrower who is a first-time borrower are requesting a loan of 2,200,000 KHR. Sreymom's portion of the loan is 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees. She hopes that she will get a higher yield out of the farm through the help of the loan so that she can improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay land plowing fees

loans.name: Crane School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Patrick. He is the Head Teacher of Crane Education Centre School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Kyegera in Wakiso with 800 students. Crane Education Centre School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Crane Education Centre School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Patrick ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Sun's Group

texts.en:
Sun lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He is 61 years old and is a single father who has six children. He struggles for the future of his family by working very hard on six hectares of rice farm which he has occupied for about 40 years. 

Sun is the leader of a group of three members. The group has requested a loan of 3,600,000 KHR, of which Sun's  portion is 1,200,000 KHR.  Sun plans to use his portion of the loan to invest in his rice farm by buying fertilizer and paying for plowing fees. He strongly hopes that the loan will enable him to get a higher yield than in previous years so that he will be able to enhance the lives of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and and pay for land plowing fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Katikamu School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Julius. He is the Head teacher at Katikamu SDA Secondary School a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Gayaza, Wakiso District with 390 students. Katikamu SDA School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Katikamu SDA will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Julius ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Asatullo

texts.en:
Asatullo comes from a rural area. He is married and has three little children. His wife is housewife and she has been busy with bringing up the children. 

Asatullo is only earner of his family. He has a pharmacy business where he sells medicine. Asatullo has managed the business alone for more than eight years. 

He is going to buy cow's milk because his little children must drink milk every day. He is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy cow's milk. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cow's milk for his children.

loans.name: Hoeum's Group

texts.en:
Hoeum and her family live in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 50 years old and a local farmer who has seven children - five of whom rely on her as they are in school. She is a hard-working mother and  struggles to make a living through rice farming. She earns extra money through fishing. Unfortunately, the average income for her family is only 33,600 KHR per day, which is barely enough to feed the whole family and to pay for school expenses of five children who are currently going to school. 

This is the third loan cycle for Hoeum, and the seventh cycle for her co-borrower, with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Hoeum is now the leader of the group. They have requested a loan of 2,800,000 KHR of which contribute they will have an equal share. Hoeum plans to use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees for the rice farm. Hoeum believes that the loan will help her to uplift the living conditions of her family at a gradual pace.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees for her farm.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Eva is 53 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Eva has a native hat weaving business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Eva has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle to start an agriculture business.

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en:
Hong lives in Battambang province with her family of 8 children. She is a 39-year-old married woman who makes a living through agribusiness. She struggles to earn money to feed her children by working very hard on two hectares of rice farm. She is able to earn an average of 34,500 KHR per day to support the whole family. 

Hong has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for seven cycles already. She has fully repaid the past loans, and they have allowed her to improve the family's living conditions at a gradual pace. Now, she leads a group of two members to request a loan of 2,600,000 KHR, of which Hong will borrow 1,400,000 KHR. As leader, she will use her share of the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees for the rice farm. She strongly hopes that she will be able to keep improving her family’s situation through the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for labor fees for her farm.

loans.name: Cheourm's Group

texts.en:
Choeurm is a resident of Battambang province. She is a 47-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She struggles to earn a living for the family through two hectares of rice farm, which she has occupied for around 30 years. The average income of her family is only 36,300 KHR per day. 

Choeurm and her joint-borrower have been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for six and five cycles, respectively. She has fully repaid her past loan and it has helped her to improve her lifestyle gradually. Now, in a group of two, they are requesting a loan of 2,800,000 KHR of which they will have an equal share of 1,400,000 KHR. As leader, she will use the loan to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees for her rice farm. She hopes that the loan will allow her to harvest a higher yield from the farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees for her farm.

loans.name: Tabariétou

texts.fr: Veuve âgée de 48 ans, Tabarietou vit dans le quartier d’Agoè avec quatre(04) enfants en charge. Elle  commercialise des produits de premières nécessités. Tabarietou  s’approvisionne en piment,épice, potasse, etc une  fois  par mois au marché d’Agoè et revend dans les environs de son quartier. Tabarietou  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices par l'achat de 15 sachets de potasse et 10 bols de piment rouge.
texts.en:
Tabariètou, who is a 48-year old widow, lives in the Agoè district with four children who are in her care. She sells basic commodities and gets supplies of chili peppers, spices, potash, etc. once a month in the market at Agoè. She then resells her products in her district's surroundings. 

Tabariètou is requesting a loan so that she can buy 15 sachets of potash and ten bowls of red chili peppers and thereby expand her business so she can satisfy customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 15 sachets of potash and ten bowls of red chili peppers.

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr: Mariée  âgée de 32 ans, Zénabou est mère de quatre enfants  et réside dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle fait le commerce comme activité dans l’achat et la vente des bijoux.                                                                        Zénabou  s’approvisionne une fois  par mois au grand marché de Lomé et revend  au marché de son quartier. Zénabou sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Zénabou, who is married and 32 years old, is mother to four children and lives in the Agoè district. She has a business buying and selling jewelry and gets her supplies once a month at Lomé's Grand Market. She the sells her products at the market in her district. 

Zénabou is requesting a loan to expand her business so that she can satisfy customer demand and make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 84 clay necklaces.

loans.name: Lami

texts.fr:
Mariée  âgée de 35 ans, Lami est mère de quatre enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè. Elle fait le commerce de friperie comme activité en achetant  des soutiens gorge, des sacs de sortie qu’elle revend par vente ambulante dans son quartier et les quartiers voisins. Lami s’approvisionne une  fois  par mois au marché de Hédzranawé.                                                                                                                                             
Lami  sollicite un prêt pour  acheter 100 soutiens gorge et  50 sacs de sortie agrandir son commerce afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Lami, who is married and 55 years old, is mother to four children and lives in the Agoè district. She has a business selling second-hand clothing by buying bras and handbags which she sells on a door-to-door basis in her district and neighboring districts. Lami gets her supplies once a month in the market in Hédzranawé. 

Lami is requesting a loan to buy 100 bras and 50 handbags and expand her business so that she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy 100 bras and 50 handbags.

loans.name: Wassila

texts.fr:
Wassila, est une femme mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle habite le quartier  Agoè à Lomé.
Elle a commencé le commerce de pagne teintés et de pagne depuis l'année 1996. Au début de son activité, elle a été soutenu financièrement par son mari.

Wassila est revendeuse ambulante et sillonne au moins 5 quartiers par jour soit environ 15 kilomètres par jour.
Elle sollicite ce second crédit auprès d'Assilassimé pour acheter acheter 3 pièces de basin, 3 pièces de pagne traditionnel et 10 pièces habit teintés.

Le revenu de son activité lui permettra d'aider son mari dans les dépenses du ménage.
texts.en:
Wassila is a married woman who is mother to three children. She lives in the Agoè district of Lomé. 

She began selling dyed "pagnes" (colorful fabric) and traditional "pagnes" in 1996. When she initially set up her business she was financially supported by her husband.

Wassila sells on a door-to-door basis and crosses at least five districts (around 15 kilometers) a day. She is requesting this second loan from Assilassimé to buy three pieces of damask fabric, three pieces of tradtional "pagne" fabric and ten pieces of dyed clothing.

The income she generates from her business will enable her to help her husband with the household expenses.

loans.use: to buy three pieces of damask fabric, three pieces of traditional "pagne" fabric and ten pieces of dyed clothing.

loans.name: Jose Leo Dan

texts.es: José tiene 35 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 años y 10 años de edad quienes a la fecha se encuentran estudiando. José es un hombre muy trabajador que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia. José tiene un negocio de tienda  desde hace mucho tiempo en la cual distribuye variedad de mercadería como: especies, cereales, detergente, aceite, leche, golosinas, etc. Con el deseo de mantener su negocio activo por mucho más tiempo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de golosinas, aceites, detergente, pan dulce, especies, cereales y de más productos demandados por sus clientes con el fin de satisfacer a un mayor número de clientes y poder aumentar sus ventas e ingresos.
texts.en: José is 35 years old and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children, ages 7 and 10, who currently are students. José is a very hard-working man who, with much effort, has managed to get his family ahead. José has had a store for a long time, in which he sells a variety of merchandise such as spices, cereal, detergent, oil, milk, snacks, etc. With the desire to maintain his business actively for a long time into the future, he has decided to ask FUSAI for this loan to invest in the purchase of snacks, oil, detergent, pan dulce, spices, cereal and other products requested by his customers with the goal to satisfy more customers and be able to increase his sales and income.

loans.use: to purchase snacks, oil, detergent, pan dulce, spices, cereal, etc.

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es: Irma tiene 34 años de edad, habita en un municipio de Managua. Tiene 3 hijos de edad, los cuales están en edad escolar. Junto a su compañero de vida se dedica a la venta de joyas de acero de manera ambulante desde hace algunos años. Se movilizan al interior del país para ofertar sus productos y satisfacer la demanda de los habitantes. El crédito será usado para la inversión de capital, al igual que créditos anteriores los ha usado para eso, Comprará joyas de acero. Espera en algunos años poder hacer que su negocio sea auto sostenible y también desea poner un negocio de venta de comida en su vivienda.
texts.en: Irma is 34 years old and lives in the municipality of Managua. She has three children, who are school-aged. With her life partner, she has worked selling stainless steel jewelry as a street vendor for some years. They go to the interior of the country to offer their products and satisfy the demand of the people living there. The loan will be used to invest in capital, just as they used the previous loans to do this. She will buy surgical steel jewelry. She hopes in some years to be able to have a business that is sustainable and also wants to install a business selling food in her home.

loans.use: to purchase surgical steel jewelry

loans.name: Karla Mariela

texts.es:
Karla es una joven muy emprendedora de 25 años de edad, dedica su tiempo libre a comercializar productos de belleza para poder así pagar sus estudios universitarios. Actualmente ella vive con su madre y 2 hermanos quienes ya son mayores de edad. Karla se va los fines de semana a estudiar a otra ciudad bastante lejos.


Karla se ha dedicado a vender sus productos desde hace 6 años, ella los compra por mayor y los comercializa por unidades a personas vecinas  y compañeros de clase. Con esta actividad y una pequeña ayuda de su madre ella logra pagar sus estudios, los cuales son un poco costosos.
 

Con el préstamo ella podrá invertir en su negocio, pues hay un pedido de productos bastante grande y no cuenta con el capital necesario para ello, por lo cual solicita apoyo para poder seguir trabajando, pues de no hacer esta actividad afectaría los gastos de su estudios universitarios.


El sueño de karla es poder terminar su ultimo año de estudios y encontrar un empleo con el cual pueda apoyar a su madre en los gastos del hogar y formar su propia familia.
texts.en:
Karla is a very enterprising young woman, 25 years old. She spends her free time selling beauty products to be able to pay for her university fees. At the moment she lives with her mother and two siblings who are adults. Karla goes on the weekends to study in another city which is quite far away.

Karla has worked selling her products for 6 years. She buys them in bulk and sells them individually to neighbors and classmates. With this work and a little help from her mother, she has managed to pay for her education, which is a bit costly. 
 
With the loan, she will invest in her business, since she has a fairly large order of products and doesn't have the capital necessary for it. For this reason, she asks for a loan to be able to continue working, since without doing this work, it would affect the university expenses. 

Karla's dream is to be able to finish her last year of school and find a job with which she can help her mother with the household expenses and form her own family.

loans.use: to invest in a beauty product business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en: Gina is a 37-year-old married woman with five children, all in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gina has a business buying and selling dried coconut meat in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Gina requested a 19,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Manuel Eugenio

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 63 años de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador, ha dedicado su vida a la agricultura, todo para sacar adelante a su familia, la cual está compuesta por su esposa quien se dedica a las labores del hogar, sus 2 hijas una ellas mayor de edad y sus 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad. Ellos estudian a 4 cuadras desde su casa.


Manuel se ha dedicado a realizar las actividades agrícolas desde hace 50 años, él siempre acompañaba a su padre todas las mañanas. Así también él ha realizado diversas labores en los cultivos de hortalizas.
 

Manuel necesita el crédito para comprar los fertilizantes que le hacen falta para poder cubrir sus parcelas de maíz las cuales necesitan ser fertilizadas, pues es de ahí de donde obtiene la alimentación de su familia.

En un futuro él quisiera poder establecer nuevamente su parcela de sandía como lo  hacia hace 5 años, pero por el momento lo que necesita es poder fertilizar su parcela de maíz.
texts.en:
Manuel, 63, is a very hardworking man.  He has devoted his life to agriculture, all so he can get his family ahead.  His family is his wife, who does the household work; his two daughters, one of them an adult; and two minor sons.  They attend school four blocks from home.
 
Manuel has earned a living in agricultural work for 50 years.  He always used to go with his father every morning.  He has also done a variety of jobs growing vegetables.

Manuel needs the loan to buy the fertilizer he needs to cover his cornfields.  They need to be fertilized because that's where he gets his family's food.

In the future he would like to be able to start a watermelon field, as he did five years ago.  For the moment, however, he needs to be able to fertilize his corn.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his cornfields

loans.name: Phallat's Group

texts.en:
Thmor Kol district of Battambang province is the home of Phallat, who is a 28-year-old married woman. In a family with two children, Phallat has struggled to make a living through agribusiness and raising chickens for sale. She has been rice farming for about 10 years already.

This is the second loan cycle for Phallat and the first for her co-borrower. Phallat has completely repaid her previous loan. Now, in this group of two, they are applying for a loan of 1,150,000 riels. As the group leader, Phallat will use her share of the loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline to use on her rice farm. She hopes that the loan will help to uplift the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline to use on her rice farm

loans.name: Ganjina

texts.en:
Ganjina is a young and hardworking woman. She is 25 years old. Ganjina lives with her husband and two non-adult children in an agricultural region. Ganjina’s husband is a driver. Ganjina has her own business. She has been busy with animal husbandry for more than five years. She feeds cows. Ganjina feeds cows for some months and then sells them in a local market. 

She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) to buy cows. She is going to increase her working capital and maximize profit. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase her working capital

loans.name: Nukramo

texts.en: Nukramo is 38 years old. She lives with her family in the southern part of Tajikistan. Nukramo works in a state organization; she is a janitor. She has worked there more than eight years. She is the main bread winner of her family because her husband is a carter and has a small income. Nukramo and her husband are bringing up five children. Their children are non-adults. They live poorly and really need financial support. Nukramo is going to repair her house because her house is in bad condition. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 somoni to buy building materials for repairing her house. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy building materials for repairing her house.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina works hard to support her family. Gina is married and has a buy-and-sell, ready-to-wear business in the Philippines.

Gina requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear items such as blouses, kid-ware, shorts, etc. to sell.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Gina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready-to-wear items such as blouses, kid-ware, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Larrie

texts.en:
Larrie works hard to support her family. Larrie is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Larrie requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Larrie has been in this business for 40 years now.

In the future, Larrie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille is 53 years old and married with two children.  

Lucille is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucille requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucille has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Lucille would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: María Antonia

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora, ha dedicado su vida a las labores agrícolas ayudando a su hermano. Actualmente ella vive con sus 2 hijos quienes son menores de edad, ellos estudian educación básica a 3 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa, por lo cual María tiene que levantarse muy temprano para atenderlos.


María se dedica a esta labores agrícolas desde que tenia 12 años de edad, ella salía a dejarles la comida a su padre y su hermanos quienes trabajaban a 2 kilómetros de distancia desde su casa, de igual forma apoyaba en algunas actividades y así fue aprendiendo el trabajo..
