Con el préstamo ella podrá comprar los fertilizantes que le faltan para aplicar a su parcela de maíz, ya que los quintales que logró comprar no fueron suficientes para cubrir toda su parcela.


Su sueño es poder obtener una cosecha provechosa, pues es de donde obtiene sus alimentos y algunos ingresos. Así también en un futuro quisiera tener su parcela de hortalizas.
texts.en:
María, 33, is a fighter.  She has dedicated her life to agricultural work, helping her brother.  Right now she lives with her two young children.  They are getting a basic education 3 km from their house, which is why María has to get up very early to take care of them.

María has made a living in agricultural work since she was 12 years old.  She would go out to leave food with her father and her brothers who worked 2 km from their home and, likewise, help them with many activities. Thus, she learned the job.

With the loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizer that she needs to apply to her plot of corn since the quintal (100 kg) that she was able to buy was not enough to cover her entire plot.  Her dream is to have a profitable harvest, since it is where she gets her food and some income.  Also, in the future she would like to have her own plot of vegetables.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizer that she needs to apply to her plot of corn.

loans.name: Si's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Cham province, Si is a 29-year-old married woman who is blessed with two children. Currently, one child is going to school and another one is too little to go to school. The family earns money from a 5-hectare rice farm which Si has occupied for about 8 years now. She also earns extra money from a small grocery business. The average income for her family is only 27,200 KHR per day.
She is the leader of a group of three borrowers. This is the second cycle for all of them to request a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  As a group, they are requesting for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR, which Si owns a portion of 1,500,000 KHR. She plans to use a portion of this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farm and another portion to buy some groceries to sell. She hopes that she will be able to harvest a higher yield from her rice farm through the help of this loan.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Marlie

texts.en: Marlie is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlie is 25 years old and has one child who is currently in school. Marlie has a food and juice vending business in the Philippines. Marlie has requested a PHP 14000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients like juice, sugar, tempura, fish balls and more for her food vending business. Marlie has been in this business for 2 years now. Marlie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like juice, sugar, tempura, fish balls and more for her food vending business

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia works hard to support her family. She is married and has a native hats weaving business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Ofelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

In the future, Ofelia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Chanthorn

texts.en:
Chanthorn, age 32, farms rice and sells grocery items to earn a living. She has been engaged in the activities for 15 years. She supplements her income by also working as a paid worker. She has three children and lives in a rural village in the Kampong Siem district of Cambodia. 
 
Chanthorn has been with VisionFund for one cycle and has completely repaid her loan. She is now applying for a loan in order to buy a reliable motorbike on which to commute to work. She will also use a portion of her loan funds to buy grocery items to offer for sale.

loans.use: to buy a reliable motorbike on which to commute to work

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Torng's Group

texts.en:
Torng is living in Battambang province with her family. She is 52 year old, married, and a mother of 7 children, two of whom are living with and dependent on her. The primary income for the family comes from a rice farming business, which she has occupied for about 11 years already. She also earns extra income by working for local residents for a fee. 

In a group of two members, Torng is the group leader. This is the fifth and the third loan cycles for Torng and her joint-borrower, respectively. As a group, they request a loan of 1,500,000 KHR, of which Torng owns a portion of 700,000 KHR. She will use her share of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed as well as to pay for land plowing of the farm. She believes that the loan will enable her to improve the life of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed as well as to pay for land plowing

loans.name: Try's Group

texts.en: Try is a resident from Siem Reap, a province where the great Angkor Wat is located. She is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. Currently, all of her children are going to school. She struggles to earn a living through rice and cassava farming. She has engaged in agribusiness for about 15 years now and it has returned her an average income of 36,100 KHR per day. In a group of two members, Try and her co-borrower have requested for a loan of 1,800,000 KHR. This is the first time for both of them to apply for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Try plans to use her portion of 1,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees. She hopes that she will be able to get a higher yield from her farm so that she will be able to buy school materials for her children in order to keep them going to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay for land plowing fees

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en: Nilda works hard to support her family. Nilda is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nilda has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more boxes of fish to resell. Nilda has been in this business for 6 years now. Nilda would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fish to resell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 54 years old and married with six children. With two children currently in school, Rebecca works very hard to provide for them.

Rebecca runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy additional items, like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, shampoo, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, candies, etc., to sell. Rebecca has been in her business for one year and sells a variety of items. In the future, Rebecca would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items, like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, shampoo, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, candies, etc., to sell

loans.name: Olga Yanira

texts.es:
Olga, invirtió el préstamo anterior en comprar productos de belleza con los que fortaleció su negocio, sus clientes aumentaron, brinda mejor servicio y ha logrado mantener su buen record crediticio. 
Nuevamente acude a la institución para solicitar más capital que invertirá en la compra de tintes, tratamientos cosméticos, mascarillas, tijeras, pinzas, algunas piezas de ropa y otros accesorios, para ofrecer otro tipo de productos, continuar teniendo a sus clientes satisfechos y mejorar su situación económica. Su familia se encuentra en óptimas condiciones.
texts.en:
Olga invested her previous loan in buying beauty products to strengthen her business.  Her clientele increased, she provides better service, and she has managed to maintain a good credit record.

She's going to the organization once again to request more capital.  She'll invest in buying dyes, cosmetic treatments, masks, scissors, tweezers, and some garments and other accessories so she can offer another type of product, continue to satisfy her customers, and improve her economic situation.

Her family lives in optimum conditions.

loans.use: to buy dyes, cosmetic treatments, masks, scissors, tweezers, and some garments and accessories

loans.name: Shalom Group

texts.en: Shalom is a group of seven people, whose members are friends and belong to the same savings group. They are into soft drinks, pepper, bean and gari, children wear, provisions, manicure and pedicure. Lydia is the representative for the group and is 58 years old. She is single and she has grown up children who are not dependent on her. To meet her needs, Lydia has been selling provisions such as milo, milk, sugar, margarine and tea-bags at her residence for the past eight years. She gets her supplies from wholesalers. To expand her business and become more competitive in this field, Lydia wishes to increase her stock of products, which in turn will enable her to increase her turnover and income. For this reason, Lydia is requesting a sixth loan from ID-Ghana, together with other members of the Shalom group. All her previous loans have been fully repaid.

loans.use: to buy provisions such as milo, milk, sugar, margarine and tea-bags to sell

loans.name: José Alejandro

texts.es:
José es un joven muy trabajador y con deseos de superación personal, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero, no tiene hijos y actualmente está sacando sus estudios universitarios. 


José laboró por 4 años de voluntario en un proyecto, luego le otorgaron la plaza y tiene responsabilidad mayores en dicha institución.


El crédito lo necesita para cancelar un crédito, ya que sufrió un robo y no cuenta con solvencia para pagar las cuotas mensuales. 

José sueña con culminar su carrera universitaria con éxito, para así poder optar a nuevas oportunidades de empleo.
texts.en:
Jose is a hard working young man with a desire to get ahead. He is 26 years old and single. He doesn't have children and is currently studying at the university level. Jose worked for four years on a project as a volunteer and he was then offered a job in which he has great responsibilities at the same organization. 

He needs this loan to pay off another loan because he was robbed and does not have the solvency to pay his monthly installments. Jose dreams of finishing his university degree with success so that he can receive new employment opportunities.

loans.use: to pay a loan.

loans.name: Susarkan

texts.ru: Сусаркан 58 лет, замужем, мать 5 детей. У Сусаркан - средне-специальное педагогическое образование, долгое время работала воспитателем а после и заведующей в детском садике. С 1982 года занимается животноводством и полеводством., выращивая картофель и кукурузу. Благодаря упорному труду Сусаркан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка. Совокупный ежемесячный доход составляет 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сусаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку теленка и индюков для разведения. Доходы от кредита Сусаркан планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины и планирует накопить средства на обучение сына в университете и свадьбу дочери.
texts.en: Susarkan is 58, married, and has five children. She has a secondary education with a specialization in teaching and worked as an educator for a long time before becoming the superintendent at a kindergarten. She has been raising livestock and planting potatoes and corn since 1982. Thanks to her hard work, Susarkan currently has two dairy cows and two calves. Her total income is 15,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to expand her farm, she applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with the Bai-Tushum Bank in order to purchase a calf and turkeys for breeding. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money for her son's university education and her daughter's wedding.

loans.use: To buy a bull calf and turkeys

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion has a live-in female partner with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Salvacion is 45 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Salvacion has a general store business in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Salvacion has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Esterlina

texts.en:
Esterlina is 55 years old and married with eight children. With two children currently in school, Esterlina works very hard to provide for them.

Esterlina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 17,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

Esterlina has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, detergent soap, bath soap, canned goods, bread, etc. 

In the future, Esterlina would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia works hard to support her family. Delia is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Delia requested a 20,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Delia has been in this business for six years now.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

In the future, Delia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta is 50 years old and has three children. Vicenta is married and has one child who is still in school.

Vicenta is in the agricultural business, engaged in pig fattening in the Philippines. Vicenta requested a 29,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Vicenta has been in pig fattening for five years now and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Vicenta would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Srey, aged 34, is living in a rural village of the Choeng Prey district. She has two children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. She and her husband are farmers who grow rice on 2 hectares of farmland. They have been in this business for 16 years, earning about US$10 per day to support her family needs.
  
This microloan is for Srey with Kiva partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan to pay for seeds and fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to pay for seeds and fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sohun

texts.en:
Sohun, 23, is married with two sons. She resides in a rural village of the Prey Chhor district of the Kampong Cham province. To support her family, she has been farming rice for several years while her husband works as a worker to gain more income to better support the family. Together, they can earn about 27,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

Sohun is just with VisionFund for this cycle and she is now applying for a loan to buy a cow to support her farming business. She hopes to make more rice to increase her family’s income to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy a cow to support her farming business

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Mürvet

texts.en:
Mürvet is married and the mother of two children, who are 25 and 26 years old. She sells Tupperware and cleaning products in addition to working in the cafeteria of a newspaper business. When her husband’s earning were insufficient to support the household and pay for the children’s education, she followed her friends’ advice and began selling Tupperware. She sells to relatives, neighbors, and coworkers. At first she had trouble remembering and selling the products, but she got used to it with time. She also started selling cleaning products. With the loan, she’ll buy Tupperware products to sell and increase her income. By selling a lot and progressing with her work, she is able to contribute to her family’s budget and fill in the gap.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Mürvet Hanım evli.Yirmi beş ve yirmi altı yaşlarında iki çocuk annesi.  Tupperware ve Ersa temizlik ürünleri satışı yapıyor aynı zamanda da bir gazetenin mutfağında çalışıyor.  Eşinin kazancı ev geçimine  eğitimine yetmeyince arkadaşının tavsiyesi ile Tupperware başlamış. Akrabalarına,komşularına ,iş arkadaşlarına satış yapıyor.  İlk başlarda ürün tanıtımında ve satışında zorluk yaşasa da zamanla alışıyor.  Zamanla Ersa temizlik ürünlerini de satmaya başlıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile tupperware ürünleri çekip satarak kazancını arttıracak.  İşinde ilerlemek çok satış yapıp aile ekonomisine katkıda bulunmak.  Ailesinin ve evinin eksiklerini tamamlamak.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Sebprey

texts.en:
Sebprey is aged 35 years and married with four children. She lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Dambae district, earning a living through growing cassava and soybeans. She has been in these agribusinesses for 17 years. Together, they can earn about 80,000 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day from the current business and can save about 40,000 KHR each day for the future needs.

Sebprey has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle, and now she is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more crops so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an electronic mobile load and accessories retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy an additional amount of electronic load and additional stock of accessories to sell for her electronic mobile load and accessories retailing business.

Elizabeth has been in this business for four years. Elizabeth earns more income from a general store.

Elizabeth has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional amount of electronic mobile load credits and additional stock of accessories to sell

loans.name: Sokna

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Sokna is 23 years old and married with one baby daughter. She earns a living through farming rice and growing cassava. Together, they can earn about 46,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for their future needs. 

This is the first loan for Sokna with VisionFund. Now she is seeking a loan to buy fertilizers for her paddy. She will also use a portion of the loan to spend on plowing the field. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her paddy

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Jeanlyn

texts.en:
Jeanlyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jeanlyn is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jeanlyn has a laundry service business in the Philippines. Jeanlyn requested a 16,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials such as detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. for her business.

Jeanlyn has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Jeanlyn would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials such as detergent soap, fabric conditioners, etc. for her business

loans.name: Savoern's Group

texts.en:
A married mother living in a rural village located in the Srey Snom district of the Siem Reap province, Savoern is 35 years old and has four children. To support her family, she has struggled to grow cassava and rice for 17 years. She is able to earn about 50,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

Savoern is just with VisionFund for this cycle. Now she is leading her group to seek a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to grow more rice so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ke's Group

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house with her family members in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, Ke is aged 35 years and married with two children. To make a living, she has been selling grocery items, while her husband has been a carpenter for 10 years.

This is a group loan for Ke’s group, and she is in her seventh micro-loan cycle, while her fellow group member is in a sixth micro-loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy more grocery items for resale. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items for resale

loans.name: Yampier Isaac

texts.es:
Yampier es un joven emprendedor, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Parcona junto a su familia.
Desde hace varios años trabaja como obrero de campo en una empresa Agroindustrial, le va muy bien porque es un joven trabajador, luchador y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor motivación en la vida es su familia, es por ellos que siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Yampier está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una computadora para que pueda relajarse en sus tiempos libres. De esta manera seguirá esforzándose para más adelante: "Convertirse en un gran empresario".
texts.en:
Yampier is an enterprising young man who is 20 years old, single, and lives in Parcona along with his family.  For several years he has worked as a field laborer for an Agro-industrial company.  It is going well because he is hard-working, a fighter, and has great desire to get ahead in life.  His greatest motivation in life is his family; it is for them that he always pushes himself in all that he does so that he can offer them a better quality of life.

Yampier is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support they have offered him, he will be able to buy a computer so that he can relax during his free time.  This way he will continue pushing himself to be successful:  "To become a great businessman."

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Gulkhumor

texts.ru:
Гулхумор 40-летняя жительница города Душанбе. Она проживает вместе с мужем и сыном. Ее сыну 19 лет. Гулхумор коммуникабельная, активная женщина. Она научилась шитью у своей матери и три года назад начала шить. Гулхумор домохозяйка, ей очень удобно предоставлять услугу дома. 
Сейчас Гулхумор берет кредит для ремонта дома. Ей необходимо отремонтировать свой дом до прихода холодов. Женщина всегда являлась ответственной в семье, и Гулхумор такая же ответственная. Она заботиться о своей семье.
texts.en: Gulkhumor is 40 years old and she lives in the city of Dushanbe with her husband and her 19-year-old son.  She is an active and outgoing woman.  She learned to sew from her mother and she began to work as a seamstress three years ago.  Gulkhumor is a homemaker, so it is very convenient for her to work from home.  She is now asking for a loan to make repairs to her home.  She needs to prepare her home for the coming winter.  A woman is always responsible for her family, and Gulkhumor is a responsible woman who is looking after her family.

loans.use: to buy building materials so she can prepare her home for the coming winter.

loans.name: Sofronia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Sofronia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from direct selling Natasha and Avon products. Sofronia is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc., for her food vending business.

Sofronia has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, spices, fish, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 31 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Janet is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Janet has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita is 37 years old and married with five children.

Adelita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of items to sell in her general store.

Adelita has borrowed and paid back 4 loans from NWTF prior to this loan. She has been running the general store for 7 years and also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear items and firewood.

Adelita aspires to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Anastacia

texts.en:
Anastacia works hard to support her family. Anastacia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Anastacia requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Anastacia has been in this business for 5 years now.

Anastacia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Sebastiana

texts.en:
Sebastiana is 53 years old and married with eight children. With two children still in school, Sebastiana works very hard to provide for them.

Sebastiana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items such as canned goods, detergent soap, eggs, bread, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell.

Sebastiana has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, detergent soap, eggs, bread, cooking oil, noodles, etc. 

In the future, Sebastiana would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items such as canned goods, detergent soap, eggs, bread, cooking oil, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
A 46-year-old mother residing in a rural village of the Battambang province’s Thmor Koul district, Yan has five children to take care of and earns a living through growing rice and raising cows. Having been in this business for 10 years, she can earn about 12,500 KHR (Cambodian riels) per day to make a living, and can save about 5,000 KHR each day for the future needs. 

Yan’s group consists of two members who live in the same village, and they are second-loan-cycle clients. She successfully used the past loan to better her living conditions. Now leading her group to apply for a loan, Yan will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland, and will use a portion of it to spend for plowing and labor. She hopes to make more cassava so as to increase her family’s income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en:
A villager from the Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Sinat is 22 years old and married. She has two children. The main sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and working for others for a fee. Having been in this business for 11 years, she is able to earn daily income of 50,600 KHR (Cambodian riels) to support her family, and she can save about 20,000 KHR per day for their future needs. 

This is the fourth loan for Sinat with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 3,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Ebru

texts.en:
Ebru is single. She has been working in the bazaar for 10 years. When her place of employment closed, she began selling underclothes and socks thanks to a friend. She advances her business by buying space in bazaars in different districts to sell. Today she earns her income by selling men’s clothing. With the loan she receives, she will increase the variety of clothes that she sells. One day, she wants to open a young men’s clothing store.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Ebru Hanım bekar.  On yıldır pazarcılık yapıyor.  Çalıştığı iş yeri kapanınca pazarcılılık yapan bir arkadaşı sayesinde iç çamaşırı,çorap satarak mesleğe başlıyor.  Çeşitli semtlerde Pazar yerleri alarak işlerini ilerletiyor.  Bugün erkek giyim satışı yaparak gelir elde ediyor. Aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini arttıracak.  İlerde erkek genç giyim üzerine mağaza açmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Chanthy, 26, has one child. Chanthy and her husband are farmers who have been farming rice, and working for others for a fee, for 11 years to make a living. She is able to earn about 60,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Chanthy has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is seeking another loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice healthily and she also hopes to make more rice to better her family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past two years, Sylvia has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sylvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shirts and skirts for selling, and will help Sylvia to generate greater profits and take good care of her family by providing enough for basic needs. Sylvia hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Sylvia is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sylvia who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shirts and skirts for selling

loans.name: Annaly

texts.en:
Annaly is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annaly is 35 years old and has four children who are in school.

Annaly has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Annaly requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

Annaly has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Annaly would like to save enough money so that she will be able to afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Avita

texts.en:
Avita works hard to support her family. Avita is married and has a plastic, native bag-making business in the Philippines.

Avita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional materials for her business.

Avita has been in this business for 5 years now.

Avita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her business

loans.name: Medoline

texts.en:
Meet Medoline, a smallholder farmer from Chuka, Kenya. She has been involved in mixed farming for last 10 years, since she was 27. She sells milk, eggs, tea and vegetables produced on her 1 acre farm at a local market. She also engages in other small businesses to make ends meet. 

The mother of three enjoys mostly attending to her farm animals and tilling land. Marketing of her produce and seasonal drought poses challenges for this undeterred farmer. She makes a point to name all the animals on the farm. Her favorite dairy cow goes by the name Kairu.

Medoline is seeking a loan to go into cereal farming. She wants to start growing cereal crops for human food and animal feed. In the future, she sees herself producing cereals for industrial starch. 

Medoline made up her mind to join Juhudi Kilimo since it is the only microfinance organization in Kenya that supports marginalized rural smallholder farmers to get loans. 

She is very optimistic that this loan will increase her income so that she can afford to pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase cereals to go into cereal farming

loans.name: Shahla

texts.en: Shahla is a 52-year-old widow and she has two sons. Shahla is a teacher. She has 30 years of work experience in this field and continues her teaching activities. She teaches elementary classes and is a kind and wise woman who is greatly respected and loved by her pupils and colleagues. Her salary from this work is 120 AZN but it's not enough funds to take care of her family. Because of that, she works additionally after classes, at home with children from poor families who can't pay to study at school. Shahla needs a loan of 1,200 AZN to buy a computer, professional literature, copy–books, pencils, etc. She hopes that Kiva will help her provide an education to local poor children.

loans.use: to buy a computer, professional literature, copy–books, pencils, etc

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy is 43 years old and lives in the town of Entebbe in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with three of them currently in school. For the past three years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her bar business, which operates as a bar and guest house. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy drinks of all types, and will help Prossy to generate greater profits and earn more profits. Prossy hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger bar and open up a restaurant. 

Prossy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Prossy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy drinks of all types

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil is 57 years old and married, and he has one son. Adil lives with his family in his own city. His parents also live with him because they are old and ill; because of that, Adil is taking care of his parents, too. He is a very positive man. He is a market vendor. He sells food products like cakes, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

He has had this business for 37 years. He started with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. He wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

He is now requesting a 1,000 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) loan. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. He has a good loan history. This is his seventh loan.

loans.use: to buy food products like cakes, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 40 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 3 years, Pauline has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand her business, Pauline has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy basins, plastic chairs, cups, kettles, and laundry baskets, and will help Pauline to generate greater profits and stock up the shop. Pauline hopes that in the future she will be able to prosper financially. 

Pauline is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pauline who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy basins, plastic chairs, cups, kettles, and laundry baskets

loans.name: Gustavo Antonio

texts.es:
Gustavo es un joven emprendedor, tiene 24 años de edad, es soltera y vive en La Tinguiña junto a su familia.
Actualmente está estudiando una carrera profesional porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja haciendo colectivos a distintos destinos de la zona donde vive y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, siempre preocupándose por el prójimo y respetando las leyes de tránsito.
Gustavo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá culminar la construcción de su cuarto para que pueda sentirse más a gusto dentro de su vivienda y pueda tener mayor independencia, con esto estará mejorando su calidad de vida y continuará esforzándose para poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Ser un profesional exitoso".
texts.en:
Gustavo is a young entrepreneur. He is 24 years old, single, and lives in La Tinguiña with his family.
He is currently studying a professional degree because he really wants to get ahead.
For the past year he has worked driving a colectivo, or shared taxi, to different destinations from the area where he lives. He does very well because he is responsible, hardworking, always concerned for those around him, and he respects the traffic laws.
Gustavo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with the support that they have given him he will be able to finish the construction of his room, so that he will feel more comfortable in his house and have more independence. With this he will will be improving his quality of life and will continue to strive to accomplish his biggest dream: “To be a successful professional.”

loans.use: to build his room.

loans.name: Hacer

texts.en:
Hacer is a married mother of five girls. She raised her girls and saw to their marriages. When she became bored of sitting at home, she began to sell underclothes to her friends and acquaintances. When demand increased she grew her business. With the loan she receives, she will increase the variety of her products and meet her increasing orders. She plans on working as long as she remains healthy. Working, being occupied with something, gives her pleasure.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Hacer Hanım evli beş kız annesi.  Kızlarını yetiştirmiş evlendirmiş.  Evde boş oturmakdan sıkılınca arkadaşlarına ve çevresine çamaşır satmaya başlamış.  Talepler çoğeldıkça işini ilerletmiş.  Gittiği günlerde ,okumalarda ve çevresine satışını yapıyor.  Aldığı kredi ile ürün çeşidini arttırıp,siparişlerini tamamlayacak.  Sağlığı el verdikçe bu işi yapmayı düşünüyor ,çalışmak bir şeylerle uğraşmak ona zevk veriyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry and goats and construct a piggery

loans.name: Adrine

texts.en:
Adrine is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 5 years, Adrine has been working hard to manage her clinic, which operates a drug shop. 

To help expand her business, Adrine has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drugs and will help Adrine to generate greater profits and increase her daily sales. Adrine hopes that she will be able to open up two more branches in three years time. 

Adrine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Adrine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more drugs

loans.name: Özlem

texts.en:
Ozlem is a married mother of a 10-year-old boy. In order to contribute to her family and meet her child’s needs she began selling Amway products with the help of her brother. For three years, Ozlem has been helping her friend by working in her convenience store, where she has also sold her products. This year, her friend wants her to do her own Farece work. She believes that Ozlem could sell them in the store. In order to increase her income, Ozlem will buy Farace products with the loan she receives and sell them in the store. Step by step, she would like to grow her business. She wants to finish her degree and become an elementary school teacher. She places much importance on her son’s education and wants to raise him and educate him in the best way.

Translated from Turkish by Maya Staff 
Özlem Hanım evli on yaşında bir erkek çocuğu annesi.  Ailesine katkı sağlamak,çocuğunun ihtiyaçlarını karşılamak için kardeşinin yardımıyla  amwey ürünleri satmaya başlamış.  Üç aydır bir arkadaşının tuhafiyesinde ona yardımcı olmak için çalışıyor ve burada da satışlarını yapıyor.  Arkadaşı bu sene Farece işinin  kendisinin yapmasını öneriyor.  Tuhafiye dükkanında satabileceğini söylüyor.  Özlem hanımda gelirini arttırmak için aldığı kredi ile farace alıp çalıştığı dükkanda satacak.  Adım adım işini büyütmek istiyor.  Dışarıdan okuduğu okulunu bitirip anaokulu öğretmeni olmak istiyor.  Oğlunun eğitimine çok önem veriyor onu en iyi şekilde büyütüp okutmak istiyor.

loans.use: to buy products

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kachwamba in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 5 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Moses has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand his business, Moses has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Moses to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children in better schools. Moses hopes that in the future he will be able to expand the business into a bigger wholesale shop. 

Moses is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moses who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business

loans.name: Jawa Group

texts.en:
Nisrine, Majed and Ali are three young Syrian refugees in their late twenties. They have been living in Lebanon for almost two years and working as a singer, a music teacher and a dancer, respectively. 

They are asking for a 1,507,000 Lebanese pounds loan, for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa, to prepare for an upcoming interactive show that will be held end of July to entertain Syrian refugee kids which will also be a kind of therapy during which traumatized kids will have the chance to express themselves.

loans.use: to prepare a show for under-privileged Syrian refugees

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en:
Sunday arrived in Israel seven years ago after escaping war in Sudan and completing the long journey by foot to Israel. A mother of three, Sunday is an asylum seeker, which limits the employment opportunities available to her. 

Driven to provide for her young children and to take control of her life, Sunday used a small loan from Microfy, which has been repaid in full, to open a coffee shop in south Tel Aviv. Her shop provides a safe place for the local community to socialize and enjoy a drink. While most of her clientele are Sudanese and Eritrean asylum seekers, she also receives a number of Israelis and tourists as patrons. 

Following initial success in her business, Sunday now wants to expand the store, which is in need of painting and furnishing. Currently Sunday has borrowed furniture to provide seating for customers, but she now wants a second loan from Kiva partner Microfy to buy tables and chairs, as well as a television and freezer, to better provide for her clients. Part of the loan will also go towards complying with Israeli regulations so that she can complete the business registration process. 

Please help Sunday reach her goal of sustaining a business to service her community.

loans.use: to buy furniture and make repairs to improve her coffee shop

loans.name: Xuraman

texts.en:
Xuraman is 58 year old and married with four children who are in her care. 

Xuraman’s principal activity and source of family income is the sale of appliances, and she has been doing this work for more than 24 years. She has managed to get ahead in her  business and is a great example of success for her children. 

Xuraman  wants to apply for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy sound equipment, irons, USB flash drives, fans and other products. She thinks the loan will be a big help, and with her earnings, she will be able to pay the educational costs for her children. 

Her main goals are to grow her business and to expand to other areas of the country.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment, irons, USB flash drives, fans and other products.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a married woman of 27 years. Her family consists of her husband and two children (one son and one daughter). Jhunu studied up to grade 8, and did not get opportunity to study further. After marriage, she is now a housewife and looks after her family. Her husband, Badal, age 34 years, has a secondary education and is associated with a small business. One of their children is a student of grade 6; the other is too young for school. They live in their own house in the small village Tekatuli in Jalpaiguri district.

Jhunu's husband earns very little, and it is hardly sufficient for the household and for the educational expenses of their child. Jhunu is active and diligent, and she wants to help her husband and share the family expenses. She wants to start a milk supply business. Dairy is one of the most promising businesses in their area.

With the aim of purchasing one dairy cow, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She will supply milk to her neighbors, who will be her clients.  She will use the additional income from her output of milk to bear the expenses of the family household and pay for her children's education and admit them to better and more renowned schools. She sees a brighter future for herself and hopes to get good revenue to provide her family with higher living standards.

She heartily thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for starting a milk supply business.

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Norah has been working hard to manage her clothing business, selling clothes at wholesale and retail. 

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more dresses, and will help Norah to generate greater profits and increase daily sales. Norah hopes that in the future she will be able to start shopping overseas. 

Norah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Norah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: purchase more dresses.

loans.name: Sharifa

texts.en:
Sharifa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has no children. For the past four years, Sharifa has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sharifa has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Sharifa to generate greater profits and expand her business. Sharifa hopes that in the future she will be able to have more stock. 

Sharifa is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sharifa who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice, 56, is a farmer who owns a tranquil, rustic homestead in Murang’a, Kenya. On the farm, she lives with her husband.  They have been practising mixed farming for the last nine years. Their three children pay a visit from time to time, and offer assistance on the farm when needed. Her primary income sources are eggs and tea produced from the farm; she sells these at a local market.
 
Some time back, Alice joined a self-help group composed of mostly marginalized female farmers named Mawiri SHG. All the members of this group were in search of some income generative activity. 

Juhudi Kilimo motivated them to seize the opportunity of each member securing a loan, and have the rest of the members guarantee each other.  After being successfully registered, they went through a training of basic financial and business skills. 

Alice applied for a loan of KES 65,000 to purchase poultry, a dairy goat and to construct a piggery. 

She is a successful poultry farmer who is looking to expand the poultry section and diversify into other activities. She is always cautious when approaching new business opportunities. The fact that she spends most of her time at the farm makes her confident that she can take good care of the goats and pigs. 

Income generated from these investments will be enough to meet her farm expenses. She says her family will also get to enjoy all the benefits that come along with increased income.

loans.use: To purchase poultry, goats and start a piggery

loans.name: Elda Noemy

texts.es:
Elda de 30 años de edad, es comerciante, estudió hasta noveno grado, por el bajo nivel económico en que vivia le fue imposible seguir estudiando, ahora está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a demoler piedra y tienen 3 hijos.

Elda desde pequeña se ha dedicado con su madre al comercio, vendiendo en una pequeña tienda en su casa, luego decidió poner su propio negocio en la casa cuando se acompañó, también tiene una venta de tortillas en la cual las hace por las tardes.

Los fondos del crédito serán destinados para surtir mas el negocio, comprar mas productos para tener mayor clientela, como, arroz, frijoles, azucar, café, pan, embutidos, leche, etc.

El sueño a un futuro es ampliar  su negocio, tener mayor demanda de clientes y dar estudió a sus hijos para que sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Elda is 30 years old and a businesswoman. She studied up to Grade 9 but could not continue given her family's poor economic situation. Now she is married and has 3 children. Her husband works breaking rocks. Since she was small Elda has worked with her mother in business, selling in the small store in their house. Later when she got married she decided to open her own business in her house. She also sells tortillas which she makes in the afternoon. 

The money from the loan will be used to stock her business, buying products to increase her clientele like sugar, rice, beans, coffee, bread, canned goods, milk, etc. Her dreams for the future are to expand her business, have greater demand from her clients and to provide education for her children so they can become professionals.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Mamata

texts.en:
Mamata is 42 years old. She is married to Sukumar, who is 50 years old. She is a very enthusiastic woman who hails from Maynaguri in the Jalpaiguri district. Together they are raising one son who is a student of grade 9. They live in a small village Tekatuli in their own kachha house (made of wood, straw and mud). Mamata is illiterate. She could not attend school due to the poor economic resources of her parents, but her husband studied till grade 8.

Mamata's husband is associated with a small trade and he does not have a fixed income. He is the only breadwinner for the family, so his inconsistent income does not provide the family with sufficient financial sustenance. He takes care of his family with great difficulty.  

Mamata, though a housewife, has decided to do something of her own to help the family financially. She is energetic and active, so she wants to start a business of milk supply and milk products (curd, butter, cheese) to sell to her neighbors. Dairy is one of the most promising businesses in their region.  That is why Mamata wants to purchase a dairy cow that can generate income.

She heard that BJS gives business loans to rural women, so she asked for a loan from them to purchase a cow. She hopes the business will be a profitable one to fulfill her dream of educating her children better and improving her family's living conditions.

She gives her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and milk products business.

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is 27. She lives in Maynaguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She is married and a housewife. Her family consists of her three children (one son and two daughters) and her husband. Two of her children are attending school, and they read in grades 9 and 4. The third one is too young for school. Merina is illiterate and can sign her name only. 

Merina's husband, Sariful, is a cycle-van puller. A cycle-van is a kind of transport that is widely used in rural areas in India, especially in West Bengal. He carries loads and people in his van and thus earns money to cover the expenses of his family's household. 

Very recently the van was damaged in an accident. As a result, his income has stopped and they are facing an acute financial crisis. They thought it over and have decided to purchase a new cycle-van but lack the capital.

Merina heard that BJS gives financial assistance to rural women and she took a loan to purchase a new cycle van for her husband. This will allow her husband to carry on earnings to strengthen their family's economy.

Merina wants to improve her family's financial condition so that she can reach her goals, which are to give financial sustenance to her family and provide higher education to her children.

She and her husband give their hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for her husband.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is 35 years old and lives in the town of Zana, in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 15 years, Agnes has been working hard to manage her salon business, in which she provides hair services. 

To help expand her business, Agnes has requested a loan of UGX 3,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy weaves and dryers and will help Agnes to generate greater profits and increase her clients. Agnes hopes that, in the future, she will be able to construct a big salon. 

Agnes is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Agnes, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy weaves and dryers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more improved cookstoves for her door to door business.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is an energetic and enterprising woman from Maynaguri. She lives with her husband, Sushil, age 36, and her two children (one son and one daughter). She is 35 and has a primary education. Her husband is an arts graduate. Both their children are in school. They live in a remote region in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Malati's husband is a cobbler, associated with shoe repair services. He is unable to rent a shop so he runs his business on a street footpath in the busiest area of his locality. He is tenacious and a man with hopes of getting ahead. He wants to grow the business, satisfy his customers and get more income from his business. His income is too scanty to cover all the household expenses of his family. so he needs capital to purchase more materials to extend the existing business. He learned about this business from his father, who was a cobbler his whole life.

Malati wants to help her husband in every possible way. It is for this reason Malati is requesting a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner). She wants to use the loan to purchase materials like synthetic leather, adhesive, soles, buckles etc. With these materials she will be able to improve the business and make a very important infusion of capital into business. She hopes that the income will be a great help for them to get over the financial hurdles and she will be able to strengthen the family financially and provide her children with higher education.

In the future she wants to start their shoe making shop with the profit generated.

She and her husband give thanks to BJS and Kiva for their financial help.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her husband's cobbler business.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is 29. She is married and lives with her husband and three lovely sons. Two of them attend school and one is too young for school. She and her husband both are uneducated and are only able to sign their names. They were deprived of education due to the poor economic resources of their families. They live in a village Khagrabari in Jalpaiguri district.

Kalpana is a hardworking woman; she is a housewife and taking care of her children. Her husband is busy earning income to run the family well. He has an animal husbandry and he sells milk to his neighbours. He is the only earning member for the family, so he works hard all the day looking after his cattle. At present he has two milking cows and one buffalo.  

In spite of his tireless work, he can't give sufficient well being to his family. He wants to increase his income to cope with the increasing expenses of his family and to satisfy the growing demands of his customers. He and Kalpana both have decided to start making milk products such as curd, butter, and paneer (cottage cheese), which he wants to sell in the market to increase his earnings. These products have a great demand in his region.

With the aim to help her husband, Kalpana has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase one cow to fulfill their wish. They hope very much for a positive outcome to reach their dreams. Kalpana hopes the loan will help her to get chance to provide a good education to her sons for progressing in life, and to live in better conditions.

She appreciates the financial help of her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for their existing business of selling milk.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 39 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar, rice, maize flour and soda for the business, and it will help Sarah to generate greater profits and see her children grow up in a healthy environment. Sarah hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar, rice, maize flour and soda for the business.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus, 38, is a very passionate dairy farmer based near Nyamira, which is a popular banana growing region in Kenya. He is committed to a lovely wife with whom he has been blessed with a 7-year-old daughter and a year-old son. 

Justus has been doing mixed farming for the last 16 years to provide for his family. His primary income sources are milk, eggs, maize, beans as well as other personal business.

He stated that he most enjoys dairy farming. His biggest challenges, however, are diseases, drought and lack of capital.
 
Justus is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow after assessing the persistent demand for milk in the Kegogi location. With the loan, he is going to purchase an animal with average production of 15 litres of milk per day. Having understood the market requirements, he wants to expand the dairy farm in a modern manner with more animals so that he can diversify the farm’s products.
 
Your loan will help Justus make enough money to settle his high family expenses. He stated that the loan will benefit his family by providing him with the financial ability to improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Sulaiman

texts.en:
Sulaiman is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past two years, Sulaiman has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Sulaiman has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy spare parts to sell in his shop. This will help Sulaiman to generate greater profits and improve his family's standard of living. Sulaiman hopes that in the future he will be able to buy another plot of land. 

Sulaiman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sulaiman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to sell in his shop

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 35 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past eight years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her hardware business, which sells cement, iron bars and iron sheets. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cement, iron bars and iron sheets, which will help Mariam to generate greater profits and earn income to cater to her family's basic needs. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to own a bigger business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more cement, iron bars and iron sheets

loans.name: Marco

texts.es: Marco tiene la edad de 27 años, está divorciado  y vive con los padres  actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de almacigo y  abono y dar asistencia a una plantación de café que quieren iniciar. El  desea darle el adecuado mantenimiento al cultivo para que este le permita tener una mayor producción y así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como productor. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Marco is 27 years old, divorced and currently lives with his parents. He wants the loan to purchase seedlings and fertilizer and to help the coffee plantation he plans to start. He wants to put enough work and maintenance into growing coffee so that production increases and he can therefore make more income. He hopes in the future to give his family a better quality of life and greater economic stability, and to continue to grow as a person and as a producer. This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans in state banks before, but FUDECOSUR has given the loan with better cretit terms and much lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Stella Del Carmen

texts.es:
Stella de 47 años de edad, es ama de casa, debido a la pobreza en que ha vivido le imposible terminar sus estudios, con mucho sacrificio y dedicación a penas pudo cursar hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su esposo es quien le ayuda arduamente para sacar adelante a sus hijos que son 4, ellos han cursado hasta bachillerato.

Stella se ha dedicado a trabajar arduamente en la agricultura, desde hace mucho tiempo aprendió este trabajo que con mucho esmero le enseñaron sus padres para que tuviera fuentes de ingreso, su compañero de vida y sus hijos le ayudan mucho, ya que se levantan muy temprano y se disponen a irse a trabajar en el campo, para cubrir las necesidades básicas como son la alimentación, salud entre otros, la distancia que tiene que caminar para llegar al campo donde trabaja es de un kilómetro aproximadamente.

Ella utilizará el préstamo para la compra de una motocicleta que será su medio de trasporte para desplazarse a su lugar de trabajo.

El sueño a un futuro es mejorar la calidad de vida para su familia y poner a estudiar a sus hijos en la universidad, para que sean profesionales y tengan mejores oportunidades de trabajo.
texts.en:
Stella is 47 years old and is a housewife. Due to the poverty she lives in she could not complete her studies. With much dedication and sacrifice she managed to study up to Grade 6. She is married and it is her husband who helped her raise her 4 children who have all completed their Secondary schooling. 

Stella works hard in agriculture. A long time ago she learned this trade which her parents taught her with great care so that she would have a source of income. Her husband and her children help her a lot. She gets up very early and gets ready to go to work in the fields to cover the basic needs of the family like food and health amongst others. The distance she has to walk to get to the fields where she works is about 1 km. 

She will use the loan to buy a motorcycle which will used as her transportation to her place of work. Her dreams for the future are to improve the family's quality of living and allow her children to study at university so that they become professionals and have better working opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi is a 26-year-old housewife from Maynaguri. Her family consists of her husband and their two little sons. They live in their own kachha house (made of mud, bamboo and straw) in Khagrabari, a remote region in the district of Jalpaiguri. Madhabi and her husband both have elementary education and were unable to go for further study due to their poverty. Madhabi got married at a very tender age. Now she looks after her children and husband.

Madhabi's husband works under a local cycle-van owner on a daily wages basis. Cycle van is a kind of transport used in rural areas of West Bengal to carry loads and people. His income is inconsistent. Though he is the only earning member for the family, yet he is unable to provide the family with a decent lifestyle. They are facing an acute financial problem.

For this reason, Madhabi has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase a cycle-van of their own. For generating more income her husband will deliver goods as well as vegetables to the market shops and carry people and will earn a livelihood for the family. His high volume of work will produce a steady income for the family and strengthen the family economy. Madhabi hopes that, with the profit, she will provide her sons with better education in renowned schools to secure their future.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle-van for her husband.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con la esposa y sus dos hijos, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y maicillo desde hace 5 Años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, El cliente solícita un crédito a INTEGRAL para la compra de insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, herbicidas,  etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografía  para tener un mejor nivel de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en: The client is 27 years old and lives in his own house with his wife and two children. He has been growing corn and sorghum for 5 years. He manages to pay some of the household necessities with what he earns from his sales. The client is requesting a loan from Integral to buy inputs like fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc to improve the land that is shown in the photo. He wants to provide himself and his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, manure, pest control, herbicides, etc. to improve the land.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph, 46, is a diligent farmer based in a popular banana-growing region of Kenya called Nyamira. Joseph has sustained his family of five children over the last eight years through selling tea produced on his farm at a local market. He also holds a salary-paying job.

Many farmers like Joseph practice mixed farming. However, Joseph finds animal rearing to be such a big challenge. Throughout his life as a farmer, he has always enjoyed crop farming since it is not as taxing as mixed farming. 

Joseph is seeking a loan to purchase farm inputs. He has always had trouble raising funds for purchasing farm inputs in the past. This has led to poor quality yields and as a result, losses. To resolve this issue, he joined a group named Nyagwekonda in order to access Juhudi Kilimo agricultural loans. Juhudi offers loans to individual farmers in a group whose members share a strong bond of solidarity. 

Your loan contribution will enable Joseph to afford proper farm inputs necessary for healthy crop development. With the increased yields, he will comfortably settle his highest monthly farm expenses and channel the surplus amount to his family’s needs and wants.

loans.use: to pay for farm implements

loans.name: Marlon Balmore

texts.es: Marlon de 32 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijas menores de edad, el cliente tiene más de tres años de dedicarse al negocio de venta de tamales de pollo  y de elotes, su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia en donde su esposa le ayuda a vender mientras que el vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias, Marlon solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar la materia prima necesaria como: maíz, leche, elotes, aceite, manteca, etc.  para seguir con su negocio y poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Marlon is 32 years old and lives with his wife and his two young daughters. For more than 3 years the client has been working in his business selling chicken tamales and corn. His business is located in his place of residence where his wife helps him with sales. He goes out in the streets of the different neighborhoods selling. Marlon is requesting a loan to invest in his business and buy needed raw material like, corn. milk, corn on the cob, oil, lard, etc. to continue with his business and be able to provide his family with a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy corn, milk, oil, lard, etc.

loans.name: Margarita Elizabeth

texts.es: Margarita de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gatos que se le presentan en su hogar, Margarita está solicitando  un crédito  para la compra de harina, aceite, chicharrón, quesillo, frijol, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Margarita is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She works making and selling pupusas. She manages to pay some of the household expenses with what she earns. Margarita is requesting a loan to buy flour, oil, pork cracklings, cheese, beans, etc. She wants to provide her family with a better quality of living.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, pork cracklings, cheese, beans, etc.

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Manuel de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a sus hijos y su esposa, el posee una tienda en su hogar, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Manuel solicita un crédito para la compra de productos como: sodas, azúcar, aceite, golosinas, arroz, frijol, etc. y así tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Manuel, age 38, lives in his own house with his wife and their children.  He has a store at his house.  With what he gets from his sales, he manages to cover some household expenses.

Manuel is requesting a loan to buy products like sodas, sugar, cooking oil, candy, rice, and beans, etc.  This way he will have improved income, and he willl give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy products like sodas, sugar, cooking oil, candy, rice, and beans, etc.

loans.name: Abla Edem

texts.fr:
Mariée, âgée de 46 ans, Abla vit à Agoè avec cinq enfants en charge et fait de la restauration. Elle prépare du riz et d’haricot qu’elle vend à la devanture de son domicile à Agoè. 
Abla  s’approvisionne deux (02) fois  par mois au marché d’Agoè. Abla  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock en prenant  02 sacs de riz et 05 bols d’haricot afin de faire plus de bénéfices et participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Abla is 46 years old, married, and she lives in Agoè.  She has five children in her care and she is involved in the preparation of meals.  She prepares dishes made with rice and beans and sells them in front of her house in Agoè.

She buys her supplies twice a month at the Agoè market.  She is requesting a loan in order to expand her stock of merchandise, and she plans to use it to buy two bags of rice and five bowls of beans.  Her goal is to increase her profits and to be able to cover some of the family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy two bags of rice and five bowls of beans.

loans.name: Ayawa Joséphine

texts.fr:
Mariée  âgée de 60 ans, Joséphine est mère de Trois enfants  et réside dans le quartier Agoè. Elle fait le commerce comme activité dans l’achat et la vente des denrées alimentaires (poisson fumé, légumes). Joséphine  s’approvisionne Trois fois  par mois au marché d’Assiyéyé  et revend  à son domicile. 
Son activité consiste a acheter le poisson frais et à le frire avant de le revendre.                                                                                                                                                                               Joséphine sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les clients et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Joséphine is 60 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She lives in the neighborhood of Agoè.  She works in retail, buying and selling food products such as dried fish and vegetables.  She stocks up three times per month at the Assiyéyé market, and she resells from home.  Her activity consists in buying fresh fish which she then fries and resells.  She is requesting a loan in order to expand her business, meet the needs of her customers and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy three boxes of fresh fish.

loans.name: Jose Emilio

texts.es:
José, seguirá invirtiendo en el cultivo de maíz y frijol, por lo que solicita capital para comprar abono, insecticida, plaguicidas y herbicidas, de esta manera preparara la tierra para sembrar y proteger su cultivo de plagas.
Con ayuda del préstamo anterior ha tenido una mejor producción de granos, mayor calidad, mejores ingresos lo que le facilita cancelar sus compromisos económicos, su familia conserva el mismo número de miembros con la diferencia que actualmente tienen  un mejor estilo de vida.
texts.en: José continues to invest in his corn and bean crops. So he is requesting capital to buy fertilizer, insecticides, pest control and herbicides. In this way he can prepare the ground for planting and protect his crops from infestation. With the help of the last loan he had a higher grain production, better quality and higher income which allowed him to cover his financial obligations. His family still has the same number of members but they now have a better lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, pesticide and herbicide.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's, men's, and children's underwear wholesale.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es: José de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia, es muy responsable y trabajador, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, con lo que gana de su trabajo logra solventar todas las necesidades que se le presentan en su hogar, Jose solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
José, age 51, lives in his own house.  He is very responsible and hard working.  He grows corn.  With what he earns from his work, he manages to pay for all of the household necessities.
