José is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and compost, etc.  He will do this in order to give his family a better quality of life without any limitations.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and compost, etc.

loans.name: Adolé

texts.fr:
Veuve, âgée de 42 ans, Adolé  est mère de deux(02) enfants dans le quartier d’Agoè Elle fait le commerce  comme activité en achetant des plateaux d’œufs qu’elle revend par vente ambulante. Adolé s’approvisionne huit fois  par mois au marché d’Agoè Assiyéyé.     
Pour réduire ses fréquences d'approvisionnement, Adolé sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock  de 19 plateaux d’œufs et ainsi économiser les frais de transport.
texts.en:
Adolé is 42 years old and a widow.  She is the mother of two (02) children and she lives in the Agoè neighborhood.  She is involved in retail and she buys egg trays which she resells as an itinerant seller.  She buys eggs eight times per month at the Assiyéyé market in Agoè.

In order to make fewer trips to the market,  Adolé is requesting a loan to increase her stock and buy 19 egg trays.  This loan will allow her to reduce her transportation costs.

loans.use: to buy 19 egg trays.

loans.name: Turdan

texts.ru: Турдан 57 лет, замужем,  дети взрослые и самостоятельные, живут отдельно, у Турдан среднее образование, вместе с супругом с 2004 года занимаются полеводством. На собственном участке мерою 3,00 ГА выращивают фасоль, реализуя ее частным оптовым покупателям. Продукция, выращенная по средствам ручного труда, без применения техники и вредной для почвы неорганической химии, пользуется большим спросом среди местного населения. Также в хозяйстве Турдан имеется: 2 лошади и 43 овцы. Деятельность Турдан приносит ей прибыль в размере 6,500 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своей полеводческой деятельности Турдан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку минеральных удобрений, которые планирует закупить в ветеринарной аптеке. Доходы от кредита Турдан хочет вложить в дальнейшее увеличение урожайности, а также хочет отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Turdan is 57, married, and has adult children who live independently. She has a secondary education and has been planting crops with her spouse since 2004. They plant beans on their 3.0 hectare plot of land and sell them to private wholesalers. Crops planted by hand without the use of machinery and non-organic chemicals that harm the soil are in demand among the local population. She also has two horses and 43 sheep and earns 6,500 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her farming activities, Turdan applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with the Bai-Tushum Bank to buy fertilizers from the veterinary supply store. She wants to use the profits to invest in increasing her crop yields and to repair her house.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for growing organic beans

loans.name: Luz Elena

texts.es: Luz de 41 años de edad vive junto a sus hijos en casa de un familiar, ella es agricultora y adicional a eso también es comerciante, su principal siembra es el maíz,  con lo que vende logra solventar algunas necesidades de su hogar, Luz solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, controles de plagas, etc. asi como muestra la fotografia, Para darle un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is 41 years old and lives with her children in the home of a family member. She is a farmer and also a vendor. Her main crop is corn, and with what she sells she manages to pay for some of her household necessities. 

Luz is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers, manures, herbicides, pest-control agents, etc., as shown in the photograph. This is in order to give her family a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, herbicides, pest-control agents, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: remodel his room.

loans.name: Henry Alexander

texts.es: Henry de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos, el se dedica a la crianza de ganados, con lo que trabaja logra solventar todas las necesidades de su hogar, Henry esta solicitando un crédito para comprar vitaminas y concentrado para el ganado y asi poderle dar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Henry is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and children. He raises cattle, and with the work he does manages to pay for all of his household necessities. 

Henry is requesting a loan so that he can buy vitamin supplements and concentrated feed for cattle, and this way be able to provide his family with a better standard of living without any privations.

loans.use: To buy vitamin supplements and concentrated feed for cattle.

loans.name: Nelson Francisco

texts.es: Nelson de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus hijos y nietos, es agricultor cultiva maíz y maicillo, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografía para luego comercializarlos en los diferentes mercados, Nelson solicita u crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, herbicidas, etc. para darle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Nelson is 48 years old and lives in his own home with his children and grandchildren. He is a farmer and grows corn and sorghum. When his harvest is ready he stores in bins as shown in the photograph, to later sell it in the various markets. 

Nelson is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manures, herbicides, etc. This is an order to provide his family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, herbicides, etc.

loans.name: Tobonbi

texts.ru:
Тобонби проживает вместе с сыном и мужем в городе Душанбе. Ее сыну 22 года. Он учится. Сама Тобонби занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она образованная женщина, которая решила стать домохозяйкой и вырастить, воспитать сына. Со временем сын вырос и стал самостоятельным. Тобонби поняла, что ей необходимо заняться своим делом. Вот уже шесть лет как она занимается шитьем. 
Тобонби 46 лет, она берет кредит для ремонта квартиры. Тобонби хочет купить пластиковые двери и окна, чтобы зимой сохранить теплоту в комнате.
texts.en: Tobonbi lives together with her son and husband in the city of Dushanbe. Her son is 22 years old, and he is a student. Tobonbi is involved in sewing national dresses. She is an educated woman who decided to become a homemaker to raise and educate her son. With time, her son grew up and became independent. Tobonbi then understood that she had to get involved in her own business. It has been six since she started her sewing business. Tobonbi is 46 years old, and she is requesting this loan to repair her apartment. Tobonbi wants to buy plastic doors and windows to keep the heat inside during the winter.

loans.use: to buy plastic doors and windows

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es: María de 40 años de edad vive casa propia junto a sus hijos, su esposo reside en los EE.UU y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica al cultivo de maíz, cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en graneros como muestra en la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlos, con lo que logra de sus ventas llena las necesidades de su hogar, Maria solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos agrícolas fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. Para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
María is 40 years old and lives in her own home with her children. Her husband lives in the United States and helps her financially. She grows corn, and when her harvest is ready stores it in bins as shown in the photograph, to later go out and sell it. With what she makes from her sales, she meets the needs of her household.

Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of agricultural supplies such as fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, etc.  This is in order to provide her family with a better standard of living without any privations.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, etc.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Agée de 37 ans, elle est mariée et  mère de quatre enfants dans le quartier  d’Agoè. Elle commercialise depuis 2012 des produits de friperie (serviettes et torchons).
Après un an d'exercice de cette activité, elle a cessé pour démarrer la vente des maïs et manioc fermentés (EMA en Ewé) où elle  s’approvisionne trois fois  par mois au grand marché  d’Agbélouvé localité située à 60 kilomètres de Lomé. Elle fait la vente ambulante de ses produits dans son quartier et ces périphériques.                                                                                                       Elle sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock  afin de faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en: Adjowa is 37 years old, married and the mother of four children.  She lives in the neighborhood of Agoè.  She started selling second-hand fabrics (napkins and dish towels) in 2012.  After one year, she stopped this activity and started selling maize and fermented cassava (called "ema" in the Ewé language).  She stocks up three times per month at the Grand Market in Agbélouvé, a locality about 60 kilometers away from Lomé.  She works as an itinerant seller in her neighborhood and in surrounding districts.  Adjowa is requesting a loan to increase her stock and her profits.

loans.use: to buy four bags of fermented cassava.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr:
Mariée, âgée de 38 ans, Abla vit à Agoè avec quatre enfants en charge et fait de la restauration. Elle prépare du riz et d’haricot qu’elle vend à la devanture du commissariat de police du quartier Agoè. 
Abla  s’approvisionne deux fois  par mois au marché de son quartier. Abla  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son stock en prenant  4 sacs de riz et 10 bol du haricot  afin de  faire plus de bénéfices et participer aux dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: Abla, who is 38 years old and married, lives in Agoè with four children in her care. She has a restauration activity and prepares rice and beans, which she sells in front of Agoè district's police station. Abla gets her provisions twice a month from the market in her district. She is requesting a loan to build up her stock by buying four sacks of rice and ten bowls of beans, so that she can make more profit and contribute to the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy four sacks of rice and ten bowls of beans.

loans.name: Sixto Doroteo

texts.es: Sixto de 51 años de edad vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, tiene muchos años de experiencia cultivando maíz, maicillo y frijol, comercializa sus productos en los alrededores de la zona, Don Sixto solicita un crédito para la compra de sulfatos, gramoxone, etc.  para el maíz así como muestra la fotografía,  para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: 51 year old Sixto lives with his wife and their two children. He has many years of experience growing corn, sorghum, and beans, and he markets his products around the region. Don Sixto is requesting a loan to purchase sulfates, Gramoxone (an herbicide), etc, for the corn, as shown in the photo. He requests this loan in order to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase sulfates, Gramoxone (an herbicide), etc.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es: Ana tiene 21 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida. Ana es una mujer muy trabajadora y se dedica a la venta de verduras desde hace mucho tiempo. Ana desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica en su vivienda y para invertir en la compra de arena y cemento para repellar las paredes de la misma. Ana espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana is 21 years old and lives in her own home with her life companion. Ana is a very hard-working woman and has worked selling vegetables for a long time.

Ana wishes to improve the condition of her home, so she is requesting this loan from FUSAI so that she can use it for the installation of electrical service in her home and to purchase sand and cement for re-plastering the walls 

Ana is hoping to be able to have this loan, and thereby provide her family with better living conditions.

loans.use: To install electrical service and to buy cement and sand for re-plastering the walls of her home.

loans.name: Juan De Jesus

texts.es: Juan de 49 años de edad es muy responsable muy trabajador, vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz adicional a eso también se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero, Comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados, con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Juan Solicita un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi tener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan is 49 years old and is very responsible and hard-working. He lives in his own home with his family. He grows corn and also raises dairy cattle. He sells his products in the various markets, and with the earnings he gets manages to pay for some of his household expenses. 

Juan is requesting a loan for the purchase of seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, etc. This is so that he can have a better income and provide his family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers, manures, pest-control agents, etc.

loans.name: Ranokhon

texts.ru: Ранохон добросовестная женщина. Она родилась в 1969 году. Ранохон замужем и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Ее дети несовершеннолетние. Ранохон очень трудолюбивая женщина. Она всегда старается для благополучия своей семьи. Ранохон уже более 12 лет занимается собственным бизнесом. Она арендует столовую в средней школе. Ранохон готовит блюда и продает ученикам и учителям школы. Ее муж помогает ей введению бизнеса. Он повар. Ранохон должна провести ремонт помещения и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов как краски, водо-эмульсию и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие. Этот займ поможет ей улучшить условию бизнеса.
texts.en: Ranokhon is a conscientious woman. She was born in 1969. Ranokhon is married and raising 4 children, all of whom are minors. Ranokhon is a very hardworking woman. She always tries hard for the welfare of her family. Ranokhon has been involved in her own business for over 12 years. She leases a cafeteria at a secondary school. Ranokhon prepares food and serves it to the school students and teachers. Her husband helps her with running the business. He is a cook. Ranokhon has to repair the space and is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 US dollars to purchase construction materials, such as paint, water emulsion and the like. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your mercy. This loan will help her improve the business conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials, such as paint and water-emulsion, to repair her cafe

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru:
Сабохат жительница города Душанбе. Ей 55 лет. У нее большая семья. Она живет с мужем, сыном и его семьей. Сабохат бабушка, у нее четверо замечательных внуков. Гулхумор активная и трудолюбивая женщина. Даже ее невестка поражается ее трудолюбию. Сабохат приняла свою невестку как дочку. Она ее обучает выкройке и шитью. Таким образом они проводят свое время. 
Сабохат в первые берет кредит. Она надеется, что ей помогут и поддержат. Так как она берет кредит для приобретения модернизированной швейной машинки, чтобы начать вышивать. Это дело для нее новое, она нуждается в вашей поддержке. Пока Сабохат не знает как ее новое мастерство примут клиенты.
texts.en:
Sabohat is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 55 years old and has a large family. She lives with her husband, son and his family. Sabohat is a grandmother, who has four remarkable grandsons. Sabohat is an active and hardworking woman. Even her daughter-in-law is amazed by her hard work. Sabohat accepted her daughter-in-law as her own daughter. She teaches her cutting and sewing. This is how they spend their time.

Sabohat is requesting a loan for the first time. She hopes that she will be helped and supported because she is requesting a loan to purchase a new sewing machine in order to start embroidering. This is a new trade for her, and she needs your support. For now, Sabohat is uncertain how happy her clients will be with her new trade.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine in order to start embroidering and to continue her business

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is 40 years old and lives in the town of Zana in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, with none of them currently in school. For the past three years, Night has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, in which she sews sweaters, bed covers and caps. 

To help expand her business, Night has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a Baby Lock machine for sewing equipment, and will help Night to generate greater profits and improve her standards of living. Night hopes that in the future, she will be able to build rental houses. 

Night is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Night who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy a Baby Lock machine for sewing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 50 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past nine years, James has been working hard to manage his salon business, which deals in hairdressing. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a steamer and a bigger dryer, and will help James to generate greater profits and improve his standards of living. James hopes that in the future, he will be able to build more rental houses. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy a steamer and a bigger dryer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a goat, a chaff cutter and poultry

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 45 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, with one of them currently in school. For the past seven years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and firewood, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and earn income to cater for their basic needs. Aisha hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct rentals. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aisha who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal and firewood

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 29 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past four years, he has been working hard to manage his hardware business, where sells cement, nails and other items. To help expand this business, Joseph has requested a loan for 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy various items, including cement, limestone, nails,spades, and a wheelbarrow. This will help him generate greater profits and expand his business. Joseph hopes that in the future he will be able to stock even more materials. Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP), which primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en: Andrew is 52 years old and lives in the town of Abaita in the Kampala west region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past five years, Andrew has been working hard to manage his business, in which he raises chickens. To help expand this business, he is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more chicks. This will allow him to generate greater profits and expand. In the future, he hopes to run a much larger poultry farm. Andrew is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like him who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Susan, a 50-year-old farmer from Murang’a, an area in Kenya which is known for its expansive pineapple farms. This mother of five, however, is not interested in any farming activity other than dairy, which she started doing 10 years ago and has never looked back. She loves it. Her main source of income is milk.

Susan is very appreciative of the fact that milk prices in the region are high. This enables her to enjoy good profit margins and expand her operations. She has named her favourite dairy cow ‘Mercy’.

Susan is seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow in order to boost milk production to increase sales volume. She believes the key to increased milk production is proper health. A dairy cow needs roughage and protein in her diet to be healthy. 

Susan will use the additional income she will make to further her children’s education.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fatiah

texts.en:
Fatiah, a 30-year-old mother of two children who ae currently in school, lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her cosmetics shop. 

To help expand her business, Fatiah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more cosmetics. This will help Fatiah to generate greater profits. Fatiah hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big cosmetics shop. 

Fatiah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Fatiah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
"Christine is 30 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past five years, Christine has been working hard to manage her hardware business, which sells paint. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sadolin paint, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and increase income. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Christine who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: buy sadolin paint

loans.name: Silvia Ruth

texts.es: Silvia tiene 58 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos desde hace mucho tiempo y es así como colabora con la economía del hogar. Silvia desea mejorar las condiciones del techo de la vivienda por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para proceder al cambio de techo lo antes posible.
texts.en: Silvia is 58 years old and lives in a house that she owns with her husband. Silvia has been making a living selling soft drinks for a long time and, through this business, she is able to support her household economy. Silvia wants to make improvements to the roof of her house and so is applying for a loan form "FUSAI". This loan will be used to buy corrugated metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to replace the roof of her home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal sheeting, wood and nails in order to replace the roof of her home as soon as possible.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
"Joy is 38 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Joy has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells agro chemical items. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more agro chemicals like pastes and others for sale, and will help Joy to generate greater profits and improve the family standard of living. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to take her children to better schools. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more agro chemicals like pastes and others for sale,

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is 36 years old and lives in the town of Zana, in the Kampala West region of Uganda. He is married and has three children who are all currently in school. 

For the past ten years, Muhamed has been working hard to manage his phone and accessories business, in which he sells phone accessories. 

To help expand his business, Muhamed has requested a loan of UGX 2,500,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more phones and covers and will help Muhamed to generate greater profits and improve his standard of living. 

Muhamed hopes that, in the future, he will be able to build rental houses. 

Muhamed is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Muhamed, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more phones and covers.

loans.name: Chrisantus

texts.en:
Hello! Lenders meet Chrisantus, a 57 year-old reputable man, who lives in the Nyamira area of Kenya.  Chrisantus is a family man and he is blessed with a wife and two children. He has been practicing farming for over 30 year, since he did not have the opportunity to continue with his education because his parents were poor and could not afford to pay for his tuition fees. As a result of this, Chrisantus vowed that he would work hard and be able to give his children the best education that he could afford. 
Through mixed farming he has been able to take care of all the family needs and tries to give them the best that he can. Chrisantus' s primary sources of income are milk, crop transportation services and personal business.  Chrisantus would like to improve his agriculture business, and therefore he is seeking a loan of KES 62,400 to purchase a dairy cow and be able to increase his milk production rate.

Through the loan, he is sure of increasing the profit margins, and this will enable him to educate his children. Profits from the dairy cow would also be used to improve the living conditions of the family and take care of the family expenses.  Profits that he will get will be used to repay the loan as quickly as possible.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Maria Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada a su negocio propio, vende aretes de diferentes estilos, anillo de compromiso, pulseras, cadenas de hombre y de mujer, brazaletes, todos estos productos elaborados de plata, tiene 6 años de dedicarse a este negocio.
Doña María sus clientes son los vecinos de su comunidad, compra plata al por mayor y las ventas las realiza al por menor,  cuenta con un proveedor  que trae el producto desde el extranjero, esta solicitando el préstamo para comprar diferentes tipos de diseños de anillos, aretes, pulseras y cadenas porque tiene producto encargado.
Doña María espera que esta inversión le sea de mucha ayuda para que su negocio siga creciendo y le genere las ganancias necesarias para seguir apoyando a su familia, uno de sus sueños es poder obtener más clientes y poder construir una casa a través de las ganancias.  

Danlí, Honduras – Junio 2014
texts.en:
María is hard-working and dedicated to her business. She sells different styles of earrings, engagement rings, bracelets and chains for men and women. All of these products are made with silver. María has had this business for six years.

María's customers are neighbours in the community. María buys silver in bulk and sells retail. She has a supplier who brings the products from abroad. María is applying for this loan in order to buy rings, necklaces and chains of different styles as she has orders for these products.

María hopes that this investment will be of great help in expanding her business. She wants it to generate the necessary profits in order to continue supporting her family. One of María's dreams is to have more customers and build a house with the profits.

Danlí, Honduras; June 2014

loans.use: to buy rings, earrings, bracelets and chains for her business.

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en:
"Vincent is 48 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe in the Kampala region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Vincent has been working hard to manage his furniture business, which sells furniture and beds. 

To help expand his business, Vincent has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more furniture, and will help Vincent to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Vincent hopes that in the future he will be able to increase income. 

Vincent is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Vincent who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: purchase more furniture

loans.name: Wilson

texts.es:
Wilson es un hombre emprendedor, tiene 34 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Calleria junto a su familia.
Desde hace casi 2 años trabaja como Asistente Cubicador en una empresa Industrial y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, trabajadora, honesta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Su mayor motivación en la vida son sus padres, y es por ellos que
Wilson está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá hacer algunas reparaciones a su vehículo para que de esta manera se transporte de su casa a su trabajo sin ningún inconveniente y pueda seguir trabajando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Wilson is an enterprising man. He is 34 years old, single and lives in Calleria with his family.

For two years Wilson has been working as a packing assistant at a large business. This work is going well as he is a very responsible, hard-working and honest person. Wilson also has a great desire to prosper; his greatest motivation in life are his parents.

Wilson is very grateful to Kiva lenders as, thanks to their support, he will be able to make some repairs to his vehicle and maintain it so that he can travel between his work and home without problems. Wilson can then continue working with effort and dedication in order to prosper with his family.

loans.use: to fix his vehicle.

loans.name: Afiyo Dzigbodi

texts.fr:
Mariée, âgée de 34 ans, Afiyo est mère d’un enfant et réside à Agoè. Elle fait le commerce des friperies (prêt à porter) comme activité en achetant  des robes et sous-vêtements  qu’elle revend par vente ambulante dans son quartier et  au marché.                                     
Afiyo s’approvisionne deux  fois  par mois au grand marché de Lomé. 
Afiyo  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir son commerce afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients et  faire plus de bénéfices en  conséquence.
texts.en:
Afiyo, age 34, is married and the mother of one child. She lives in Agoè. She sells secondhand clothing (ready-to-wear). She buys dresses and underwear, that she resells as a traveling saleswoman, in her neighborhood and at the market.

Afiyo gets her supplies twice a month at the Grand Market in Lomé. She's seeking a loan in order to expand her business, satisfy her customers' needs, and, thusly, increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 15 dresses and half a dozen underwear

loans.name: Felistus

texts.en:
Felistus is a hardworking 52 year-old farmer from Kalimoni village in Kenya. She is a committed wife and a mother to three girls and one boy. She has been doing mixed farming for the last 12 years. Her main income sources are milk, eggs and greenery.
Felistus enjoys farming. She is contented with the life she has. Her ambition is to generate more income and take better care of the people she looks after. Her main challenge is low sales but she is optimistic that she can turn it round by seeking a loan to purchase an additional dairy cow.
Felistus finds raising of cows to be a fun experience. Besides, it is a great step forward towards self-sufficiency and food security. With your loan, Felistus will get surplus dairy products from the cow that could bring her extra income for her children’s education. 
She acknowledges that keeping a dairy cow is a big commitment that needs careful preparation, but she knows she is up for the task and she is going to do it big.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Asmene Kekeli Group

texts.fr: Ablavi est membre du groupe KEKELI. Agée 38 ans, mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Elle a commencé son petit commerce de vente des céréales  depuis 2006. Elle s'approvisionne 3 fois par mois au marché de Notsè  et les cède par la vente ambulante dans son quartier. Ablavi dispose de stock de maïs  et aimerait simplement augmenter son stock  afin de satisfaire ses clients. A cet effet, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter  2 sacs de maïs et 10 bols du haricot. Les autres membres du groupe KEKELI exercent aussi le petit commerce de fruit, de légume, de pagnes et de céréales.
texts.en:
Ablavi, age 38, is a member of Kekeli Group. She's married and the mother of four children. She started her cereals retail business in 2006. She gets her supplies three times a month at the Notsè market, and sells as a traveling saleswoman in her neighborhood.

Ablavi already has corn in stock, and would simply like to increase her stock in order to meet customer demand. To this effect, she's seeking this loan to buy two sacks of corn and ten bowls of bean.

The other members of Kekeli Group are also retailers, who sell fruits, vegetables, pagnes (colorful African cloth), and cereals.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of corn and 10 bowls of bean

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, two currently in school. For the past 14 years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her local bakery shop, which sells bread and doughnuts . 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and other items, and will help Aidah to generate greater profits. She will also be able to take good care of her children so they have a better life. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to improve her family's standard of living. 

Aidah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Aidah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more baking flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is 34 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, one currently in school. For the past five years, Stella has been working hard to manage her hardware shop, which sells building materials. 

To help expand her business, Stella has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cement, hoes, wire, paint and other items, and will help Stella generate greater profits and expand the business. Stella hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her capital use. 

Stella is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stella who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy cement, hoes, wire, paint and other items

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Florence has been working hard to manage her catering business. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food items for the catering service, and will help Florence generate greater profits and expand her business. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a hotel. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Florence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food items for her catering service

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is 50 years old and lives in the town of Wakiso, in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, who are all currently in school. For the past 25 years, Godwin has been working hard to manage his cosmetics shop. 

To help expand his business, Godwin has requested a loan of 4,500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cosmetic items, and will help Godwin to generate greater profits and stock the shop. Godwin hopes that in the future he will be able to own a big cosmetics shop. 

Godwin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Godwin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy cosmetic items

loans.name: Iddayah

texts.en:
Iddayah is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kasese, in the Fortportal region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. For the past 10 years, Iddayah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Iddayah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt for the business, and will help Iddayah to generate greater profits and take good care of her family by providing enough basic needs. Iddayah hopes that in the future she will be able to improve the business more. 

Iddayah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Iddayah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more essential goods like sugar and salt

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  27 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJOMBOUUGOU, commune de KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec MAMA  2ème personne debout sur la photo de la droite à la gauche. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  3 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau du marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. MAMA espère avoir un bénéfice de 190.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi II Group are married women who average 27 years of age and two children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djombougou, in Kadiana, Kolondieba Cercle, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their fourth loan from the MFI. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

The crops they grow are rice and peanut, just like Mama, second woman standing from the right in the photograph. With this loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover plowing costs to exploit 3 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold at the market, to a clientele comprising both men and women. Mama intends to turn a profit of XOF 190'000, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover plowing costs to exploit 3 hectares

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand and gravel in order to cement the floor of her house.

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  26 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJOMBOUGOU, commune de KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec MARIAM  2ème personne debout sur la photo de la gauche à la droite. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  3 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau de  KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 185.00FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Benkadi Group are married women who average 26 years of age and two children each. They all live in polygamous families in Djombougou, in Kadiana, Kolondieba Cercle, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with Kiva's partner, Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are seeking their seventh loan from the MFI. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

The crops they grow are rice and peanut, just like Mariam, second woman standing from the left in the photograph. With this loan, she intends to buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover plowing costs to exploit 3 hectares.

After the harvest, the production is sold in Kadiana, to a clientele comprising both men and women. Mariam intends to turn a profit of XOF 185'000, which will enable her to repay the loan, and also to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds, and cover plowing costs to exploit 3 hectares

loans.name: Rogers

texts.en:
Rogers is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, one currently in school. For the past six years, Rogers has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells household commodities. 

To help expand his business, Rogers has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy household items and will help Rogers generate greater profits to increase his income. Rogers hopes that in the future he will be able to own a wholesale shop. 

Rogers is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rogers who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow and raise poultry.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is 31 years old and lives in the town of Rukoki in the Fortportal region of Uganda. For the past five years, Hassan has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells spare parts. 

To help expand his business, Hassan has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts for sale, and will help Hassan generate greater profits and take care of his family with all basic needs. Hassan hopes that in the future he will be able to improve more on the business. 

Hassan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hassan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts for sale
