texts.en:
Amina is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past six years, Amina has been working hard to manage her spare parts business.

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more spare parts and will help Amina generate greater profits and have a bigger business. Amina hopes that in the future she will be able to expand the business. 

Amina is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Amina who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kalerwe, in the Kampala region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, who are all currently in school. For the past 10 years, Lawrence has been working hard to manage his food stall. 

To help expand his business, Lawrence has requested a loan of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. He will use the loan to buy more cassava, which will help Lawrence to generate greater profits and increase his income. Lawrence hopes that in the future he will have more business. 

Lawrence is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lawrence who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy more cassava

loans.name: Sharifah

texts.en:
Sharifah is 28 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two currently in school. For the past two years, Sharifah has been working hard to manage her salon business, which provides hair care services. 

To help expand her business, Sharifah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy salon products and will help Sharifah generate greater profits and increase her income. Sharifah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Sharifah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sharifah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy salon products.

loans.name: Cecilio Efrain

texts.es: El señor Cecilio, solicita este crédito para darle mantenimiento a sus cultivos actualmente tiene cosechado, 1/4 de manzana de Plátanos, 1 manzana de Pitahaya, 1 manzana de Cítricos como Limones y Naranjas Agrias y el resto que con 3 manzanas tiene cosechada Piña, el comprara Abono como Completo, Triple, Urea, Fertilizantes también realizara limpieza en el cultivo, Agradece el gran apoyo que Kiva y Afodenic le han brindado.
texts.en:
Cecilio is requesting this loan in order to maintain his crops. Currently he is cultivating a quarter manzana of plaintain (a manzana is a land measurement equivalent to 1.73 acres), one manzana of pitahaya (dragon fruit), one manzana of citrus such as lemons and sour oranges, and the rest with three manzanas of pineapple.

He will buy complete, triple and urea fertilizers, and will also do clearing on his fields. He appreciates the great support that Kiva and Afodenic have provided him.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nansana in the Kampala region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past 10 years, Annet has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothing material. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials and will help Annet generate greater profits and increase her income. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her working capital. 

Annet is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Annet who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more material for clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for university tuition and some requested materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To remodel his house.

loans.name: Samalie

texts.en:
Samalie is 30 years old, married, and has four children, two of whom attend school. She lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala region of Uganda. For the past 10 years, Samalie has been working hard to manage her boutique, where she sells clothes . 

To help expand her business, Samalie requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to purchase more clothes. The loan will help Samalie to generate greater profits and increase her profit margin. She hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another branch. 

Samalie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes

loans.name: Bishafoat

texts.ru: Бишафоат прекрасная жена и любящая мама двоих детей. У нее высшее образование. После окончание университета проработала по своей специальности  несколько лет, но по семейным обстоятельствам перешла на частную деятельность. Открыла свой маленький бизнес с малым оборотом денежных средств. Постепенно расширила свою деятельность и ее «базарчик» превратился в «магазинчик». У Бишафоат пятнадцатилетний опыт работы в сфере тарговли. С каждым годом ее маленький магазин предлагал все большое наименование продуктов для своих клиентов. И в связи с сезонностью все ее денежные средства заняты в ее продуктах. На руках имеет только немного  денег, которые бережет на всякий жизненный случай. Бишафоат собирается освежить свою квартиру и сделать ремонт в ванной комнате. Все старые трубы давно уже ржавели и капают. Ей необходимо сделать ремонт и поменять трубы. Но не имеет достаточную сумму денег для этого. Поэтому обратилась в МДО «Арванд»  за помощью. Очень надеться на поддержку и благодарит всех за искренность.
texts.en:
Bishafoat is a wonderful wife and the loving mother of two children. She has higher education. After finishing university, she worked in the field she specialized in for several years, but for family reasons she switched to having her own business. She opened a small business with a low turnover. She expanded her business stepwise, and her small "market" turned into a proper store. 

Bishafoat has fifteen years of experience from working in retail. Every year she offered more branded products to the customers in her smal store. Due to seasonality, all her money is bound up in her products. She only has a little bit of money on her hands, and they go to different living costs. 

Bishafoat decided to freshen up her apartment and renovate the bathroom. All the old pipes have long been rusty and dripping. She needs to repair and change the pipes, but she does not have sufficient money for this. Therefore she turned to "MDO Arvand" for help. She hopes for support and thanks everyone sincerely.

loans.use: to purchase pipes for renovating her bathroom

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru: Назира проживает в Гиссарском районе. Ей 44 года. Она мать четверых детей. Назира очень ответственный человек. Она занимается животноводством. Занимается домашним хозяйством, воспитывает детей и плюс обеспечивает семью. Ее дети учатся, и помогают матери в свободное время. Назира берет кредит с целью купить корову, чтобы также заняться торговлей молока.
texts.en:
Nazira lives in the Gissar region. She is 44 years old and the mother of four children. Nazira is a very responsible person. She works with livestock breeding. She does the household chores, raises the children and also provides for the family. Her children go to school and help their mother in their spare time. 

Nazira takes a loan with the aim to purchase a cow in order to also work with selling milk.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow in order to sell the milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buld a grazing unit and buld a piggery

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ggaba in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married, and has two children who are currently in school. For the past six years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells cassava and bananas. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. 

The loan will be used to buy more food items, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and meet family needs. 

Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to own a big business. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more food items

loans.name: Anabel

texts.es:
Anable is a Kubo Financiero's client and this is her story: 

Anabel is 39 years old, is married and has three children. She makes a living by selling vegetables and legumes in various tianguis located near her house; she has been in this business for 15 years now.

She locates her stand in markets from Saturdays to Thursdays, resting on Fridays; in the stand she has five young employees who help them with the selling of her products. She asks for this loan, her second on Kiva, to continue the improvements she has been carrying out in her house during this year; specifically details on her stairs and flooring.

Thanks to the effort she puts in her work Anabel has been able to give her family a good standard of living. Her goal is to continue growing her business, employ more people and in the future establish her business formally.
texts.en:
Anable is a Kubo Financiero's client and this is her story: 

Anabel is 39 years old, is married, and has three children. She makes a living by selling vegetables and legumes in various tianguis located near her house; she has been in this business for 15 years now.

She locates her stand in the markets from Saturdays to Thursdays, resting on Fridays; in the stand she has five young employees who help them with the selling of her products. 

She asks for this loan, her second on Kiva, to continue the improvements she has been carrying out in her house during this year; specifically, details on her stairs and flooring.

Thanks to the effort she puts in her work, Anabel has been able to give her family a good standard of living. Her goal is to continue growing her business, employ more people, and in the future, establish her business formally.

loans.use: to improve her home by installing flooring and finish stair detailing

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet Margaret, a 70-year-old farmer from Kalimoni village in Central Kenya. She resides with her 75-year-old husband, and she is blessed with four children. Margaret has been actively involved in farming for the last six years to earn a decent living. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs and various food crops at a local town. 

Margaret enjoys making an income from farming. One of the challenges she faces is low sales due to low production volume. A solution to this challenge is seeking a loan to acquire an additional dairy cow. The dairy cow will provide her lots of practical benefits. She believes the pasture she gives to her cow provides great-tasting dairy products that are more nutritious and flavorful than those processed and sold at shops. She will also be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. 

Margaret is going to use the extra income to pay for her grandchildren’s education

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Meresi

texts.en:
Meresi is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past three years, Meresi has been working hard to manage her shoe making business, which sells shoes for men, women and children.

To help expand her business, Meresi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes and materials, and will help Meresi to generate greater profits and increase the daily income. Meresi hopes that in the future she will be able to have more houses to rent.

Meresi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Meresi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Hello there! The above picture presents to you Margaret, who lives in Eldoret area of Kenya, also known as the Home Of Champions because of producing so many elite runners who have broken so many world records. She is a mother of 3 children and has been doing farming for the last 10 years. Through dairy farming and poultry keeping she has been able to produce milk and eggs.

Margaret is a very dedicated farmer who has a never-say-die attitude and enjoys every bit of farming because, through farming, she is able to take care of her family’s needs and wants. Although she experiences challenges in farming her attitude keeps her going. Thoroughly enjoying what she does, she has even nicknamed the 3 cows that she has, namely Tulmet, Birirmet and Chenwach.

Margaret is seeking a KES 63,100 loan to be able to buy a dairy cow and increase the number from the three that she currently has. Through the loan she would be able to increase her milk productivity and also increase her income levels, hence reducing the poverty levels that are currently facing her.

Margaret's biggest dream is to get out of this poverty level, and this loan will be a stepping stone toward improving the living standards of her family and also increasing her income levels.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Muhamed is 33 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, neither of whom is currently in school. For the past six years, Muhamed has been working hard to manage his clothing business, which sells clothes.

To help expand his business, Muhamed has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Muhamed to generate greater profits and expand on the business. He hopes that in the future he will be able to have more customers.

Muhamed is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Muhamed who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Yanci Beatriz

texts.es: Yanci tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su pequeño hijo de tres meses de edad. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable quien hace todo lo que este en sus manos para dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y polines dado que desea reparar el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Yanci is 26 years old and resides in her own home along with her life companion and their three-month-old child. She is a hardworking and responsible woman who does everything within her power to provide better living conditions for her family.

With this intent, Yanci decided to request a loan from FUSAI. She will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, and beams in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and beams in order to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Pozi Abasa

texts.en:
Pozi is 36 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Pallisa region of Uganda. He is married and has five children, three of whom are currently in school. For the past ten years, Pozi has been working hard to manage his business, which sells produce. 

To help expand his business, Pozi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy maize, millet, and cassava, and will help Pozi to generate greater profits and increase stock. Pozi hopes that in the future he will be able to have enough stock for supply. 

Pozi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Pozi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy maize, millet, and cassava

loans.name: Madina Khaitsa

texts.en:
Madina Khaitsa is 35 years old and lives in the town of Nakaloke, in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. 

For the past two years, Madina Khaitsa has been working hard to manage her charcoal business, in which she sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Madina Khaitsa has requested a loan of UGX 2,000,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and will help Madina Khaitsa to generate greater profits. Madina Khaitsa hopes that, in the future, she will be able to expand the business. 

Madina Khaitsa is a member of BRAC Uganda's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Madina Khaitsa, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 36 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. A married mother of four children, two of whom are currently in school, she has been working hard to manage her shoe-selling business for the past three years.

To help expand her business and generate greater profits, Sarah has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more second-hand shoes. She hopes to improve her family's living standard in the future. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: buy more second-hand shoes

loans.name: Tatiana Vanessa

texts.es: Tatiana desea realizar un préstamo crediticio para crecer económicamente, personalmente siendo independiente y propietaria de su propio negocio pues se decidió por montar un negocio de cibercafé en su sector el cual será pionero prestando este servicio pues no hay un negocio que oferte servicios similares, el crédito lo usara para comprar computadores, impresora, y artículos relacionados con papelería con lo que iniciara su negocio y comenzara a forjar su futuro.
texts.en:
Tatiana wants to take out a loan so that she can grow financially, become personally independent, and own a business. She decided to establish a cybercafé business in her neighborhood, which would make her the first one who is providing this service. There are no other businesses that provide similar services.

This loan will be used to buy computers, printers, and stationery products so that she can start her business and begin shaping her future.

loans.use: to buy computers, printers, and stationery products.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 44 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala south region of Uganda. A married mother of three children, none currently in school, she has been working hard for the past six years to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, soap, salt, rice and beans.

To help expand her business, Grace has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy sugar, soap, salt, rice and beans. This will help Grace generate greater profits and open up another branch. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy land. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Grace who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: buy sugar, soap, salt, rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Siguidia 1 Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SIGUIDIA  1  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SEBLE, commune de KADIANAA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec MAMAKAN  1ère personne debout à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  3 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau du marché après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 100.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SIGUIDIA 1 are married women who average 39 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in polygamous families in SEBLE, a commune of KADIANA in the KOLONDIEBA circle, a prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 5th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mamakan grows groundnuts and rice. She is the member standing 1st from the left in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 3 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold at the market to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mamakan expects to earn a profit of 100,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the agricultural season.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 40 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 10 years, James has been working hard to manage his electronics shop, which sells electrical items. 

To help expand his business, James has requested a loan of 3,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more electronic items and will help James to generate greater profits and improve his income. James hopes that in the future he will be able to own his own building. 

James is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more electronic items

loans.name: Dúo Piedad De Dios Group

texts.es: Este dúo esta conformado por Felisa de 62 años de edad, es originaria de Sumpango, se dedica al negocio que es de vender comida en el mercado de la terminal, todos los días se levantan desde las tres de la madrugada para poder trasladarse al destino de su venta,  ya que el negocio lo atiende desde las 4 de la madrugada,  vende desayuno y almuerzos y cuenta que gracias a Dios sus ventas ha estado aumentando por tal razón necesitan otro crédito para poder seguir generando mas ganancias y así poder ayudar a sus hijos para estudiar, es el tercer crédito que solicita con kiva y agradece la oportunidad que se le ha dado ella promete pagar puntualmente en los pagos correspondientes.
texts.en: This duo was formed by Felisa, a 62 year-old from Sumpango, who makes a living selling food in the market at the bus terminal. To get there, she wakes up at 3am every day, since her business opens at 4am. She sells breakfast and lunch, and she thanks God that her sales have been increasing. This is why she needs a loan to be able to continue generating profits and support her children’s studies. This is the third Kiva loan she has requested. She appreciates the opportunities given to her, and promises to repay her loans on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food that she sells.

loans.name: Vilma Maria

texts.es:
Tiempo atrás, Vilma era conocida por vender las mejores comidas del lugar. A diario, llegaba gente para encargar su almuerzo o cena. Al ver como poco a poco sus ingresos iban creciendo, decidió no desperdiciarlo e invertirlos en algo mejor. Ahora, a sus 48 años tiene su pulpería, la cual ya tiene seis años de ser establecida. Al mismo tiempo, sigue vendiendo comida para poder sustentar a sus hijos, entre las edades de 17 a 32. Con tan solo haber estudiado la primaria, siempre ha luchado por salir adelante con la ayuda económica de su esposo y moral de sus hijas.
Vilma sueña con seguir viendo crecer su negocio, para ello necesita seguir invirtiendo en ello, por esta razón, necesita de un préstamo para comprar granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, entre otros productos para aumentar sus ventas, debido a que tendrá mayor variedad en su pulpería. Entre sus planes está seguir aumentando los tipos de productos y así llegar a tener una abarrotería.
texts.en:
A long time ago, Vilma was known for selling the best food in the area. Every day people would come by to order lunch or dinner. As her revenue gradually increased, she decided that she didn’t want to lose it so she invested it in something better. Now, at the age of 48, she has her own store that she established six years ago. At the same time, she continues to sell food in order to support her children, who are between the ages of 17 and 32. Having only a primary school education, Vilma has always struggled to move forward even though she has financial assistance from her husband and the moral support of her daughters.

Vilma dreams of continuing to grow her business, but she needs to keep investing in it. For this reason, she needs a loan in order to buy basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, and other products to increase her sales. This will enable her to have more variety in her store. Her plans include continuing to increase the types of products she offers so that her business becomes a full-fledged grocery store.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more tie dye, lace, and wax cotton to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 8 years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another shop. 

Sarah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sarah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Norah

texts.en:
Norah is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kampala South region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 10 years, Norah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells posho, sugar, beans, soft drinks, eggs, tomatoes, cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Norah has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stock of posho, sugar, beans, soft drinks, eggs, tomatoes and cooking oil. This will help Norah to generate greater profits and earn more net income. Norah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a wholesale shop. 

Norah is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Norah who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of posho, sugar, beans, soft drinks, eggs, tomatoes and cooking oil

loans.name: Siguidia  Ii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe SIGUIDIA II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à SEBLE, commune de KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec MAWA  2 ème personne accroupie sur la photo de la gauche à la droite. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  4 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau de  KADIANA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. MAWA espère réaliser un bénéfice de 200.000FCFA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group SIGUIDIA II are married women who average 34 years of age and 3 children each. They all live in polygamous families in SEBLE, a commune of KADIANA in the KOLONDIEBA circle, a prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 2nd time partnering with the MFI. The previous loan was correctly repaid.  

Mawa grows groundnuts and rice. She is the member seen 2nd from the left in the front row of the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 4 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in Kadiana to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mawa expects to earn a profit of 200,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Unguruza Group

texts.fr:
Révérien  fait partie du groupe  Unguruza  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 45 ans et est marié à Bénigne, un  cultivateur. Ensemble ils ont 4 enfants  âgés de 3 à  12 ans dont 2 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de  boutique (riz, haricot, du sel,…) depuis 12 ans.  

Il est à son troisième crédit   à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il va augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de riz, de haricot, de sel…, à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Révérien is part of the Unguruza group and lives in Gitega. He is 45 years old and is married to Bénigne, a farmer. Together they have four children aged 3 to 12 years of whom two study. 

He has been a retail merchant (rice, beans, salt, ...) for the past twelve years. 

This is his third credit loan with Turame. With the KIVA loan, he will increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, salt,..., for resale, to earn more.

loans.use: increase his working capital and buy a large quantity of rice, beans, salt,..., for resale, to earn more.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.es: Sabina tiene 48 años de edad y habita en condiciones muy humildes junto  a su grupo familiar. Ella trabaja como empleada doméstica desde hace mucho tiempo. Sabina ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para proceder a reparar el techo de la vivienda que se encuentra deteriorado y cuando llueve el agua se filtra.
texts.en: Sabina is 48 years old and lives in a very modest house with her family. She has worked as a maid for a many years. She has made the decision to apply for this FUSAI loan to invest in sheet metal, wood, and nails in order to go forward with the repair of her house's roof, as it is in disrepair and leaks when it rains.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal, wood, and nails to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en:
Specioza is 30 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Specioza has been working hard to manage her shoe business, which sells shoes. 

To help expand her business, Specioza has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Specioza to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. Specioza hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a vehicle. 

Specioza is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Specioza who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Henry Musisi

texts.en:
Henry Musisi is 44 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. For the past 20 years, Henry Musisi has been working hard to manage his welding shop, which sells beds. 

To help expand his business, Henry Musisi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more welding materials, which will help Henry Musisi to generate greater profits and fulfill basic needs. Henry Musisi hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more land. 

Henry Musisi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Henry Musisi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more welding materials

loans.name: Boneventula K

texts.en:
Boneventula K is 41 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala South region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children, five of whom are currently in school. For the past seven years, Boneventula K has been working hard to manage his clothing shop, which sells clothes and garments. 

To help expand his business, Boneventula K has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothing materials, which will help Boneventula K to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees. Boneventula K hopes that in the future he will be able to construct rental houses. 

Boneventula K is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Boneventula K who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials

loans.name: Sheka

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is Sheka, a man in his late thirties from Tombo western rural in Freetown. He is married with 1 child who is twelve years old.  He started this business to improve his standard of living. 

Sheka runs a general stock business. He sells soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap, and cigarettes. He has been running this business since 2002. He works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.  Sheka says that the main challenges to his business are transportation problems and sometimes goods expiring.

Sheka has requested a loan in order to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap, and cigarettes.  The extra income from this loan will allow him to become a successful businessman and improve his standard of living. In the future, he plans to expand his business more than ever. He thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap, and cigarettes.

loans.name: Zoila Yesenia

texts.es: Zoila tiene 26 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora quien con mucho esfuerzo junto a su esposo mantienen la economía del hogar. Ella no cuenta con energía eléctrica por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica dado que no cuenta con el servicio. Espera poder contar con dicho financiamiento y así dar inicio a la instalación lo antes posible.
texts.en:
Zoila is 26 years old and lives in her own home with her husband. She is a very hard-working woman who the great deal of effort and together with her husband, covers the household expenses.

She does not have electrical service, so has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI in order to have it installed. She hopes to be able to have this loan and to this way begin the installation as soon as possible.

loans.use: To install electrical service in her home.

loans.name: Yulduz

texts.ru:
Юлдуз жительница города Душанбе. Она с 19 лет занимается шитьем. У нее средне-специальное образование. Юлдуз шьет национальные платья по собственному стилю одежды. Она не только швея, но и модельер. Свое мастерство она показывает, когда шьет платья. Это работа всей ее жизни. В деле ей помогает ее ученица. Она тоже как и Юлдуз мастерица. 
Юлдуз берет кредит с целью отремонтировать свою швейную машинку. Она говорит что - "С моей швейной машинкой не сравнится любая новая". Она привыкла к ней и собирается ее починить. Она ждет вашей помощи.
texts.en: Yulduz is a resident of Dushanbe and has 19 years of sewing experience. She has a secondary vocational education and sews traditional dresses in her own style. She isn't just a seamstress, she is a designer. She has been sewing all her life and her skill shows when she makes dresses. She has a student helping her who is also a seamstress. Yulduz is taking out a loan to repair her sewing machine. She says, "Any new sewing machine can't compare with mine." She is used to it and has made up her mind to fix it. She is waiting for your help.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine

loans.name: Walquin Alonso

texts.es: Con el sueño de tener su propia finca el señor Walquin se despierta todos los días a alimentar no solo su ganado si no sus sueños de que un día toda esta ardua labor le de los frutos para comprar su finca. Con gran ilusión y esperanza Walquin llega solicitando un crédito para la compra de ganado y sus respectivas vacunas pues sus animales siempre se destacan por su buen estado de salud, con este crédito genera mayores ingresos para acercarse a su sueño de comprar una finca y no solo eso para alimentar su familia conformada por su pareja y su hija pro quien trabaja incluso más duro para que esta acceda a una buena educación y pueda estudiar lo que le guste.
texts.en:
With the dream of having his own farm, Sr. Walquin wakes up every day to feed not only his livestock, but his own aspirations that the results of all of his hard work will enable him to buy a farm. Full of hope and anticipation, Walquin is requesting a loan in order to buy livestock and the appropriate vaccines so that his animals remain in good health.

This loan will generate more income so that he can come closer to his dream of buying a farm. Not only will he be able to feed his family, which includes his partner and his daughter, but his hard work will enable him to provide a good education so that his daughter can study whatever she wants.

loans.use: to buy livestock and vaccines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Sauya

texts.en:
Sauya is 30 years old and lives in the town of Bulenga in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, and 1 of them is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Sauya has been working hard to manage her produce business. 

To help expand her business, Sauya has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more produce, and will help Sauya to generate greater profits. Sauya hopes that in the future she will be able to expand on the business. 

Sauya is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Sauya who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more produce

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à MASSAMAKANA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec SALI, 2ème personne debout sur la photo de la droite à la gauche. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau du village, et à  KEBILA   après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice 150.000 FCFA qui servira à payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group BENKADI I are married women who average 39 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in polygamous families in MASSAMAKANA, a commune of KEBILA in the KOLONDIEBA circle, a prefecture of the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season, and this is their 7th time partnering with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

SALI grows groundnuts and rice. She is the member standing 2nd from the right in the group photo. She will use her loan to buy inputs and seeds, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 1 hectare of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village and in Kebila to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Sali expects to earn a profit of 150,000 FCFA, which she will use to repay her loan and to help her husband with day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy inputs and seeds, and to cover the cost of plowing for the agricultural season.

loans.name: Nuriat

texts.en:
"Nuriat is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, none of them currently attend school. For the past 9 years, Nuriat has been working hard to manage her clothing shop. 

To help expand her business, Nuriat has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Nuriat to generate greater profits and improve her financial status. Nuriat hopes that in the future she will be able to have a large inventory of clothes. 

Nuriat is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nuriat who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes

loans.name: Narziniso

texts.ru:
Нарзинисо женщина, которая никогда не перестанет работать, достигать и познавать все новое и новое. Ее дети уже выросли и стали самостоятельными. Живут отдельно по соседству, но каждый день приходят навести ее и помогать в делах. На иждивении имеет только одного последнего ребенка. Несмотря на свой возраст, трудится и помогает семье материально. Особенно в этом году ей пришлось нелегко. Зима пришла холодной,  истратив все запасы корма для скота, не смогла закупить новые, и пришлось продать одну корову на малые деньги. Сейчас у нее имеется две барашки. Она подкармливает их и к осени продаст. Очень надеется, что  хоть немножечко сможет получить доход, покрывая все затраты. 
Нарзинисо также швея. Она вышивает национальные платья. В ее деревни ее все знают и пользуются ее услугой. Несмотря на то, что хозяйство лежит на ее хрупких плечах, успевает обслужить своих клиентов своевременно и сшить для них красивые национальные платья. Чтобы ее платья получились еще красивее, и соответствовать современным моделям Нарзинисо хочет приобрести вышивальную машинку. С этой целью обратилась в МДО «Арванд» за кредитом . Заранее выражает благодарность за финансовую помощь.
texts.en:
Narziniso is a woman who never stops working, achieving her goals and learning new things. Her children are already grown-up and self-sufficient. They live close to her in separate homes, but they visit her everyday and help her with her business. Only one remaining child depends on her. Despite her age, she works hard and helps her family financially. This year especially was not easy for her. The winter was very cold and she used up all of her cattle feed reserves. She was unable to buy new feed and was forced to sell one cow for very little money. Now she has two lambs. She fattens them up and will sell them in autumn. She really hopes that, although she will be able to receive a small income, it will cover all of her expenses.

Narziniso is also a seamstress. She sews ethnic Tajik dresses. Everyone in her village knows her and uses her services. Despite the fact that her household lies on her delicate shoulders, she manages to serve her clients on time and sew them beautiful ethnic Tajik dresses. In order for her dresses to turn out even more beautiful and conform to modern styles, Narziniso wants to buy an embroidery machine. For this reason, she turned to MDO "Arvand" for a loan. She thanks everyone in advance for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Gloria Emilse

texts.es:
Gloria es una persona emprendedora y pujante, con ilusiones grandes y visión de progreso.
Ella trabaja en un almacén de cerámicas desde hace varios años buscando un sustento estable para sus hijos.
Ella ejerce una actividad alterna que le permite tener unos ingresos extra y gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, esta actividad es la venta de cosméticos y productos para el cuidado de la piel.
Es una actividad aprendida a través de su experiencia en el almacén de cerámicas.
Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su familia una vida sana y fuera de toda necesidad. Pero sabe que para esto hay que trabajar duro y tener carácter.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de surtido de productos de belleza, de esta forma tendrá la oportunidad de aumentar su inventario y mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Gloria is an enterprising and energetic individual with great dreams and a vision for progressing in life.

She has been working at a ceramics store for several years, seeking a steady income for supporting her children.

She has an alternative activity which allows her to have some extra income and enjoy a better quality of life. This activity is selling cosmetics and skin-care products. It is an activity learned through her experience in the ceramics store.

The greatest dream is to be able to provide her family with a healthy life free of hardships. But she knows that for this it is necessary to work hard and have a strong character.

She is requesting a loan to buy a supply of beauty products that will enable her to have the opportunity to increase her inventory and improve her sales.

loans.use: To buy a supply of beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more soft drinks, pure water, butter, soap, and cigarettes

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Mariam is 50 years old and lives in the town of Kyengere in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, none of them are currently in school. For the past 13 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her construction business, which deals in stone quarrying. 

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to employ more labour at the quarry, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and expand the business. Mariam hopes that through her business she can continue with her own self development. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mariam who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to employ more labour for the quarry

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and lives in the town of Kyengere in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, none of which are  currently in school. For the past 13 years, Joyce has been working hard to manage her agricultural business. 

To help expand her business, Joyce has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to invest it on more land to garden, and will help Joyce to generate greater profits and improve her business. Joyce hopes that in the future she will be able to become a leading producer of mushrooms. 

Joyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more land to garden

loans.name: Dúo Arca De Noe Group

texts.es: Dúo Arca de Noe, este grupo esta formado por la señora Gloria de 43 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de insumos y verduras, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas verduras para la venta ya que desea agrandar mas su negocio.Les agradese por la ayuda que le han brindado en su negocio.
texts.en:
“Arca de Noe” (Noah’s Ark) Group

This group was started by Sra. Gloria, age 43. She sells provisions and vegetables. Gloria has been in this line of work for several years. She is taking this opportunity to request a loan in order to buy more vegetables to sell because she wants to expand her business.

She is grateful for the assistance that has been given to her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 45 years old and lives in the town of Nateete in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 2 of them are currently in school. For the past 22 years, Teddy has been working hard to manage her food stall business, which sells Irish potatoes and banana. 

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more irish potatoes and bananas, and will help Teddy to generate greater profits and increase her income. Teddy hopes that in the future she will be able to offer her buyers larger quantities. 

Teddy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Teddy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more irish potatoes and bananas

loans.name: Slyvia

texts.en:
Slyvia is 27 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, one of them is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Slyvia has been working hard to manage her boutique business, which sells clothes and bags. 

To help expand her business, Slyvia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes and bags, and will help Slyvia to generate greater profits and expand the business. Slyvia hopes that in the future she will be able to increase her profits.

To help expand his business, James Henly has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy fabric and threads, and will help James Henly to generate greater profits and expand the business. James Henly hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his profits. 

James Henly is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like James Henly who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy fabric and threads

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Andrew is 38 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala  East region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children, one of them is currently in school. For the past 5 years, Andrew has been working hard to manage his stone mining business, which deals in stone quarrying. 

To help expand his business, Andrew has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to hire more labour for the quarrying, and will help Andrew to generate greater profits and expand the business. Andrew hopes that in the future he will be able to build a house. 

Andrew is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Andrew who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to hire more labour for the quarry

loans.name: Moreen

texts.en:
Moreen is 29 years old and lives in the town of Kyengere in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has two children with one of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Moreen has been working hard to manage her grocery shop, which deals in grocery items. 

To help expand her business, Moreen has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more grocery items, and will help Moreen to generate greater profits and business expansion. Moreen hopes that in the future she will be able to become a wholesaler. 

Moreen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Moreen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items

loans.name: Deysi Leonor

texts.es:
Deysi es una joven emprendedora, tiene 26 años de edad, es soltera y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Es madre soltera pero ese no ha sido un impedimento para ella. Todos los días sale muy temprano a trabajar para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en un restaurante de la zona, le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajadora y sobre todo muy amable y respetuosa con los clientes.
Deysi está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su casa, de esta manera sus comidas podrán ser más duraderos y mejorará su calidad de vida. Así seguirá esforzándose para poder brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Deysi is a young business woman who is 26 years old, single, and lives with her family in Guadalupe. She is a single mother, which has not prevented her from raising her children well; every day she leaves very early to work so that she can provide her children with a better life. 

She has worked in a restaurant in the area for over a year, where she is doing very well, as she is very responsible, hardworking, and above all, is very friendly and respectful to customers.
 
Deysi is grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she will be able to buy a refrigerator for her home. With this, her food will last longer, which will improve her quality of life. She will continue to strive to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy display cabinets, shelves, and merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more goods like salt, butter, soap, sugar, etc., for her business

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 8 years, Judith has been working hard to manage her housing business, which deals in rental houses. 

To help expand her business, Judith has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to construct more houses, and will help Judith to generate greater profits and business expansion. Judith hopes that in the future she will be able to increase more profits. 

Judith is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Judith who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to construct more houses

loans.name: Herman

texts.en:
Herman is 47 years old and lives in the town of Mpigi in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has four children with three of them currently in school. For the past five years, Herman has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells soft drinks, beer and other household items. 

To help expand his business, Herman has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beer, sodas, and household items, and will help Herman to generate greater profits and expand the business. Herman hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his profits. 

Herman is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Herman who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more beer, sodas, and household items

loans.name: Abasi

texts.en:
Abasi is a 29-year-old married man who lives in the town of Kyengere in the Kampala East region of Uganda. For the past eight years, he has been working hard to manage his spare parts business. 

To help expand his enterprise and generate greater profits, Abasi has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more spare parts for motorcycles. He hopes to become a leading distributor in the future.

Abasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Abasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro loans.

loans.use: buy more motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Nathan

texts.en:
Nathan is 39 years old and lives in the town of Kyengere in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Nathan has been working hard to manage his poultry business, rearing chicken. 

To help expand his business, Nathan has requested a loan of 4,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for the chicken, and will help Nathan to generate greater profits and expand on the poultry farm. Nathan hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another business. 

Nathan is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nathan who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food for the chicken

loans.name: Baker

texts.en:
Baker is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kyengere in the Kampala East region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 5 years, Baker has been working hard to manage his poultry business, rearing chicken. 

To help expand his business, Baker has requested a loan of 2,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy food for the chicken, and will help Baker to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Baker hopes that in the future he will be able to start up another business. 

Baker is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Baker who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy food for the chicken

loans.name: Dúo Damas Laboriosas Antigua Group

texts.es:
Dúo Damas Laboriosas Antigua.
Este grupo esta conformado por la señora Vilma del Carmen de 65 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y areglos, se ha dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en ropa para la venta ya que sus clientes han aumentado, el sueño de ella es poder tener un negocio mas grande para generar mejores ganancias para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: Vilma del Carmen makes up part of the "Dúo Damas Laboriosas Antigua" (Working Women Duo of Antigua) group. She is 65 years old and makes a living selling and repairing clothes. She has done this for several years. On this occasion, she is asking for this loan for the purchase of more merchandise--more clothing-- for resale because the number of her customers has increased. Her dream is to have a larger business so that she can make a larger profit in order to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: 52954 Group

texts.es: Dúo Pachali, integrado por doña Lindaura, soltera, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de diferente marca desde hace 5 años, ella vende por las aldeas cercanas, ya que no hay mucha gente que venda y que visite a sus clientes hasta la puerta de sus hogares, y es muy conocida. Ahora desea comprar una vitrina para exhibir sus productos en un lugar más grande,en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta.
texts.en:
Dúo Pachali.

This duo includes Lindaura, who is single and has made a living selling cosmetics of different brands for the last 5 years. She sells in the surrounding villages because there aren't many salespeople who visit their clients on their doorsteps and she is very well-known. Now she wants to buy a display cabinet in order to display her products in a larger space. On this occasion she is requesting this loan in order to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her beauty products business

loans.name: Luis Agner

texts.es:
Luis es un joven emprendedor, tiene 21 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Actualmente estudia la carrera de Contabilidad en la Universidad, le va muy bien porque es un joven muy inteligente y estudioso. A su corta edad se ha convertido en una persona exitosa, tiene su pequeña bodega desde hace más de 4 años con la que trabaja y obtiene ingresos con los cuales apoya a su familia con algunos gastos del hogar.
Luis está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindando él podrá comprar mercadería para surtir el negocio y ofrecer otros productos, de esta manera sus ingresos aumentarán y esforzándose para convertirse en un gran profesional.
texts.en:
Luis is an enterprising young man, 21 years old and single, who lives in Guadalupe with his family. 

He currently is studying accounting at the university and it is going very well for him because he is a very intelligent and studious young man. At his young age he has become a successful person. He has had a small general store for the past 4 years, where he works and gets income with which he helps his family with some household expenses. 

Luis is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have offered him, he will be able to purchase merchandise to stock his business and offer other products, and in this way his income will increase and he will work hard to become a great professional.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock his business.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es: Ana Con su creikiva anterior compró mercancia ropa jeanes calzado y otros articulos que vendió oportunamente. Con su credikiva obtuvo mayores utilidades, con las que mejoró su vivienda  aplicano sus propias ganancias. Ana recibió como herencia su propia casa, con la cual tendrá satisfecha su necesidad de vivienda propia, así mismo se siente satisfecha de poder cumplir con los pedidos de su clientela. como agradecimiento pide a sus financiadores que sigan apoyando a los generadores de empleo. Con sau nuevo credikiva comprará una vez mas ropa y calzado exclusivamente,llenado las expectativas de su clientela.
texts.en:
With her previous Kiva loan, Ana bought merchandise such as clothes, jeans, shoes, and other items, which she sold in a timely manner. The Kiva loan resulted in more profits, which she used to improve her home with the money she earned.

Ana acquired her house as an inheritance, which satisfied her need of owning a home. At the same time, she is pleased that she is able to fulfill her customers’ orders. In addition to expressing her appreciation, Ana would like to ask the Kiva lenders to continue supporting those who create jobs.

Her new Kiva loan will be used this time to exclusively buy more clothes and shoes, which will help her to meet her customers’ expectations.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Martha Isabel

texts.es:
“La familia unida, hace la fuerza” ese el lema de Martha y de su familia, quienes de generación en generación han llevado su elaboración y venta de artesanías por los rincones de Masaya y de su casa. A sus 51 años, es madre soltera de dos hijos de 20 y 17 años de edad, de los cuales está a cargo. Su nivel académico es de primaria, pues su situación económica no le permitió avanzar más y contribuyó en el trabajo familiar. Ahora ya tiene 24 años, desde que pasó a sus manos este negocio y único ingreso, en el cual sirve de apoyo su hermano y su hija.
Martha vive en una zona periurbana, donde muchas de las casas tienen los baños en los patios, sus paredes son de plásticos y no tienen techo. Así mismo usan letrinas con las mismas características de los baños, en lugar de inodoros. Por consiguiente, para la mamá de Martha, quien es mayor de edad y se le dificulta caminar, es bastante complicado hacer uso de estas herramientas. Por esta razón, es que Martha solicita de un préstamo para construir su servicios higiénico y así poder una vida con menos riesgos de salud y físicos. En un futuro piensa solicitar otro préstamo para seguir creciendo y luego para remodelar su casa.
texts.en:
“A close family produces strength,” is the motto of Martha and her family. For generations, her family has been producing and selling handicrafts on the street corners of Masaya and from their home. At age 51, Martha is a single mother of two children (ages 20 and 17) who are under her charge. She has only a primary school education because her financial situation did not allow her to continue. As a result, she had to contribute to the family business. She has now been in this line of work for 24 years and it is her only source of income. Martha receives help from her brother and her daughter.

Martha lives in a peri-urban area where most of the houses have bathrooms that are located on the patios. The walls are plastic and there is no roof. At the same time, many families use latrines, which have the same characteristics as bathrooms, but used in place of toilets. Martha’s elderly mother has a difficult time walking, so she would find it complicated to use this type of facility. For this reason, Martha is requesting a loan in order to build an enclosed toilet, which would pose less physical and health risks.

In the future, Martha plans to request another loan so that she can continue expanding and remodeling her home.

loans.use: to build an enclosed toilet.

loans.name: Mabel Emilia

texts.es:
La señora Mabel, hace mucho tiempo, opto por ser independiente económicamente y obtener unos ingresos propios, por esta razón decidió empezar a estudiar el arte de la fabricación de velas decorativas y artesanías.
Desde ese momento ya sabía que debía esforzarse mucho para salir adelante con su negocio y poder tener esa independencia que siempre había soñado.
Hoy en día es una microempresaria pujante y trabajadora; no solo vende los productos que ella misma fabrica, sino que también dicta clases de este arte.
Es una actividad que le apasiona y la hace sentir realizada, pues con esto demuestra que lo único que se necesita para salir adelante es empeño y corazón.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales de bisutería y decoración, con los que podrá mantener a flote su negocio y podrá seguir trabajando en su actividad.
texts.en:
A long time ago, Mabel chose to be economically independent and obtain some income of her own. That is why she decided to study the art of making decorative candles and handicrafts. Even then she knew that she must work hard to get ahead with her business and be able to have that independence that she had always dreamed about.

Today she is a strong, hardworking small-business owner. Not only does she sell the products that she herself makes, but she also teaches classes on this art. It is work that she is passionate about and that makes her feel fulfilled, and with that she shows that the only thing needed to get ahead is determination and heart. 

She is requesting the loan to buy materials for decorations, with which she will be able to keep her business afloat and be able to keep doing her work.

loans.use: to buy materials for decorations.

loans.name: Wilfer Norbey

texts.es: Wilfer un hombre de 25 años de edad, padre de dos hijo ambos menores de edad pro los cuales ha luchado por darles una educación, una alimentación, un techo o vida digna, con el pensamiento de mejorar la vida a su familia Wilfer quiere iniciar un negocio de venta  de mercancía más puntualmente pijamas, ofertándolas puerta a puerta y dándole a los clientes formas de pago cómodas para que le compren sus productos pues necesita un mejor capital para pensar en el futuro de sus hijas. Solicita crédito para iniciar su proyecto comprando mercancía en grandes cantidades pues es más económico y así sacar mayor provecho por su venta
texts.en: Wilfer, a 25 year old man, is father to two children, both of whom are minors, for whom he is fighting to give them education, food, a roof over their heads, and a dignified life.  With the idea to improve his family's life, Wilfer wants to open a business selling merchandise, more specifically pajamas, offering them door to door to his customers with comfortable ways of paying so that they buy his products.  He needs more capital, thinking of his daughters' future.  He asks for a loan to start his business purchasing merchandise in large quantities since it is more economical and, in turn, taking more advantage of each sale.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to open his business of selling pajamas door to door.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es: Doña Catalina, es madre soltera, vive junto a uno de sus hijos y reside en una aldea que pertenece al municipio de San Marcos, Santa Bárbara.  Ella y su hijo se han dedicado siempre al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles. Hace 8 años  que ella esta produciendo maíz, frijoles y hortalizas y esta producción la vende al detalle en su casa. Esta actividad es su única fuente de ingresos. El préstamo que solicita es por 7,000 lempiras con el cual va comprar abonos, fertilizantes y otros para dar asistencia al cultivo de maíz y frijol y con las ganancias piensa adquirir otro terreno para ampliar el cultivo.
texts.en:
Doña Catalina is a single mother who lives with one of her children in a neighborhood located in the town of San Marcos, Santa Bárbarba. She and her son have always cultivated basic staple crops, such as corn and beans. Catalina has been producing corn, beans, and vegetables for eight years. Whatever is produced is sold from her home. This business is her only source of income.

The loan she is requesting is in the amount of 7,000 HNL. She will buy compost, fertilizers, and other supplies so that she can maintain her corn and bean crops. With her profits, Catalina plans to acquire another plot of land so that she can grow more crops.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, and other farming supplies.

loans.name: Mariluz

texts.es: Mariluz tiene 33 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijas de 4 años y 14 años de edad. Mariluz es una mujer muy trabajadora quien se dedica  a  la elaboración de juegos de cama desde hace tres años y es así como se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Mariluz desea construir un muro de retención para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, grava y hierro.
texts.en: Mariluz is 33 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and two daughters, ages 4 and 14. Mariluz is a very hard-working woman who has worked making bed linen for the past 3 years and in this way earns her living and brings sustenance to the household. Mariluz wants to build a retaining wall, for which she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, rocks and iron.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, sand, rocks, and iron to build a retaining wall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business selling fruit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cement, paint and general stock to expand her business.

loans.name: Dúo Dones Maravillosos Group

texts.es:
DUO DONES MARAVILLOSOS
El señor Abner Hurillas de 24 años, soltero,  desde hace 2 años posee un destace de pollos ubicada en la Colonia Carlos Ramos, Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio él  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de don Abner es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más gallinas para la venta ya destazadas y así poder seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO DONES MARAVILLOSOS group
Abner Hurillas, 24 years old and single, has for the past two years owned a chicken butchering business located in the colony of Carlos Ramos, Chimaltenango, and by his efforts he managed to establish and improve his house, through his business, and he has gotten his family ahead.

Abner's dream is to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family through the microloan that he has asked of FAPE. With the loan, he wants to purchase more hens for sale after butchering and in this way grow his business.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to sell as meat.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is 37 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has five children with four of them currently in school. For the past five years, Richard has been working hard to manage his bar business, which sells beers, sodas, wines, spirits, etc. 

To help expand his business, Richard has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy beers, sodas, wines, spirits, and plastic chairs. It will help Richard to generate greater profits and improve his standards of living. Richard hopes that in the future he will be able to expand on the business. 

Richard is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Richard who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: buy beers, sodas, wines, spirits, and plastic chairs.

loans.name: Stephen K

texts.en:
Stephen is 43 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children who are all currently in school. For the past 4 years, Stephen has been working hard to manage his poultry business, which rears chicken. 

To help expand his business, Stephen has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase broilers, manure, layers, chicken feeds, and will help Stephen to generate greater profits and expand on the business. Stephen hopes that in the future he will be able to get more profits. 

Stephen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Stephen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase broilers, manure, layers, chicken feeds

loans.name: Mildred Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Mildred ha sufrido el duro flagelo del desplazamiento forzado a causa de la violencia y junto con sus hijos ha tenido que soportar duras pruebas, en muchas ocasiones aguantando hambre y frio.
Ella se quedo sin el apoyo de su esposo y desde ese momento se hizo cargo completamente de sus tres hijos.
Ella comenzó a trabajar con un kiosco en el que vendía frituras y bebidas con el afán de obtener recursos para sobrevivir. Con la iniciativa de una amiga comenzó a preparar palitos de queso, alimentos muy populares en Sincelejo y con los cuales lleva trabajando por 5 años.
Tiene contratadas a otras tres madres cabeza de hogar que le ayudan en sus preparaciones.
Su sueño es poder tener un negocio grande y aparte de su casa, pues su lugar de trabajo es la cocina de su propia casa humildemente construida en bareque.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de insumos e ingredientes como harina, queso, bocadillo, entre otros; de esta forma puede capitalizar su negocio y darle un impulso a su actividad, además de seguir ofreciendo empleo y contribuyendo a que mas familia puedan tener sustento.
texts.en:
Mildred has suffered the hard calamity of forced displacement due to the violence and, with her children, she has had to survive difficult tests and, many times, suffering from hunger and cold.

She was left without the support of her husband and from that moment she took complete responsibility for her three children.
