She began to work in a kiosk where she sold fritters and drinks with the hope to get income to survive. With the initiative of a friend, she began to prepare cheese sticks, very popular foods in Sincelejo, and with which she has worked for 5 years.  

She has hired three other mothers who are heads of their households so that they help her prepare them.

Her dream is to be able to have a large business separate from her house, since her workplace is the kitchen of her own humbly built house, made of daub and wattle.

She asks for a loan to purchase the supplies and ingredients such as flour, cheese, and guava paste, among others. In this way she can build capital and give a boost to her  business, in addition, to continuing to offer employment and contributing to other families' ability to sustain themselves.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase sand, cement, brick, iron, gravel, etc. to build a retention wall.

loans.name: Las Talentosas Group

texts.es: EL grupo “LAS TALENTOSAS”  está conformada por mujeres empeñosas en mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Aurora tiene 63 años de edad es casada con hijos independientes. Ellas hace 03 años implemento un stand en donde ofrece tortas bocaditos panetones turrones en donde tiene el apoyo de su esposo quien es maestro en pastelería. Años atrás se dedicaba a prestar servicios domésticos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de una exhibidora  para exhibir sus tortas. El grupo “LAS TALENTOSAS” agradece  por el crédito brindado. Aurora es la segunda del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: The “LAS TALENTOSAS” group consists of enterprising women improving their families' quality of life. Aurora is 63 years old, married, with independent children. Three years ago, she opened a stand where she sells cakes, sandwiches, panettone, and nougat candies with which she has the help of her husband who is a master pastry maker. Years ago, she worked in domestic service. The loan will be invested in the purchase of a display case to show their cakes.  The “LAS TALENTOSAS” group is grateful for the offered loan. Aurora is the second from the left.

loans.use: to purchase a display case.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a household appliance

loans.name: Jardines De Alamos Group

texts.es:
Este es el nuevo grupo “Jardines De Álamos” y está conformada por 05 socios entusiastas dispuestos a comenzar a trabajar. Florinda de 31 años  es separada con 02 hijos dependientes. 
Actualmente Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de prendas de vestir. Con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación Florinda ha logrado brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de camisas, pantalones y polos. El deseo de Florinda es seguir prosperando en su negocio. El nuevo grupo “Jardines De Álamos” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Florinda es la primera del lado derecho viste casaca negra y polo anaranjado.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Jardines de Alamos" (Poplar Gardens) and it comprises 5 enthusiastic members who are ready to start working. Florinda, 31, is separated and has 2 dependent children.

Currently, she buys and sells clothing. With much effort and dedication, Florinda has been able to offer her children a better quality of life. She requested this loan to buy shirts, pants and t-shirts. Florinda's wish is for her business to continue prospering. The new group "Jardines de Alamos" (Poplar Gardens) is grateful to those who make this loan possible. Florinda is the first on the right, wearing a black sweater and an orange t-shirt.

loans.use: buy shirts, pants and t-shirts.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus tres hijos de 13 años, 11 años y 7 años de edad. María se dedica a la venta de ropa ambulante desde hace 6 años. Todos los días recorre las principales zonas de su localidad y es así como junto a su compañero de vida mantienen la economía de su familia. María desea construir un baño para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena, ladrillo y grava. Espera poder tener accesos a este financiamiento y así poder construir el baño lo antes posible.
texts.en: María is 37 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and their 3 children, who are 13, 11, and 7 years old. María has been selling clothing as a street vendor for 6 years. She goes around to the main neighborhoods in her area every day, and this is how she and her partner maintain the family economy. María would like to build a bathroom, which is why she is requesting this loan from FUSAI to purchase cement, sand, bricks, and gravel. She hopes to have access to this financing so she can build the bathroom as quickly as possible.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, and gravel for building a bathroom.

loans.name: Dúo Girasoles De Santon Tomas Group

texts.es:
Dúo Girasoles de Santo Tomas
Este dúo está formado por doña Silvia Patricia, ella tiene 40 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y a la venta de ropa desde ya hace varios años,  ella está solicitando el crédito para la inversión de compra de cosméticos de belleza y ropa con el propósito de mantener a sus clientas siempre con producto de belleza como lociones, cremas de mano cuerpo , rostro, cremas para pelo, en esta oportunidad esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos y ropa para la venta.
texts.en:
"Dúo Girasoles de Santo Tomas" (Sunflowers of Santo Tomas Duo)

Silvia Patricia, 40, is part of this duo and has been selling cosmetics and clothing for many years. She is requesting a loan to invest in cosmetics and clothing, with the purpose of always having a supply of lotions, hand and body creams, face cream and hair product for her clients. She's taking this opportunity to request a loan to buy cosmetics and clothing to sell.

loans.use: buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sausage and milk to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits, and drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make deriviatives of royal quinoa and in this way improve his family's quality of life.

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.en:
Mariam's group is comprised of hardworking women. Mariam is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past 3 years, Mariam has been working hard to manage her clothing sales business.

To help expand her business, Mariam has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Mariam to generate greater profits and increase her business. Mariam hopes that in the future she will be able to own a commercial building. 

Mariam is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mitina's Group

texts.en:
Mitina's group is comprised of hardworking women. Mitina is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has one child. For the past 4 years, Mitina has been working hard to manage her clothing sales business.

To help expand her business, Mitina has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Mitina to generate greater profits and educate her siblings. Mitina hopes that in the future she will be able to build a permanent house. 

Mitina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 19 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has 2 children, who are currently in school. For the past 3 years, Aisha has been working hard to manage her food stall business, where she sells vegetables. 

To help expand her business, Aisha has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and bananas, and will help Aisha to generate greater profits and educate her children. Aisha hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Aisha is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and bananas to sell.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a hardworking woman. She is 22 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Joy has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells beers, sodas, and spirits. 

To help expand her business, Joy has requested a loan of 700,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more beers, sodas, and spirits, and will help Joy to generate greater profits and improve on her life style. Joy hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house. 

Joy is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more beers, sodas, and spirits for her business.

loans.name: Ana Hilda

texts.es: Ana de 65 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella posee un negocio  de venta de productos varios como: ropa, cuadernos, papel para regalo, lapiceros, cuadernos, maquillaje, etc.  su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas y con la ayuda de sus hijos logran solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Ana esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para surtir su negocio y asi ella y sus hijos puedan tener una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Ana, 65 years old, lives in her own house with her two children. She owns a business selling various products such as clothing, notebooks, gift wrap, pencil holders, notebooks, make-up, etc. Her business has been located in her residence for a number of years, and with what she gets from her sales and with the help of her children, they manage to pay the expenses that come up in their household. Ana is asking for this loan to purchase more merchandise in bulk to stock her business and in this way she and her children will be able to have better economic stability.

loans.use: to purchase clothing, notebooks, gift wrap, pencil holders, notebooks, make-up, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Vilma Haydee

texts.es: Vilma hace 9 años decidió poner en su lugar de residencia una venta de licuados, agua, gaseosa  y refrescos para poder ayudar en los gastos de su hogar, ha tenido muy buenas ganancias ya que tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad y los buenos precios, y es asi como ha logrado salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, vive en casa propia con su hijo, Vilma está solicitando un crédito para la compra de frutas por mayor, leche, azúcar, agua, gaseosas, etc.  para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener una mejor calidad de vida junto con su hijo.
texts.en: Nine years ago, Vima decided to open a business in her home selling smoothies, water, soft drinks and other drinks to be able to help with the household expenses. She has had very good profit since she has many customers due to her friendliness and good prices, and it is in this way that she has managed to get ahead on the household expenses. She lives in her own house with her child. Vilma is asking for this loan to purchase fruit in bulk, milk, sugar, water, soft drinks, etc. to be able to continue with her sales and, in this way, have a better quality of life alongside her child.

loans.use: to purchase fruit in bulk, milk, sugar, water, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Aywayro Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal AYWAYRO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Maras, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia  Margarita tiene 51 años de edad es casada y tiene 05 hijos, la socia alterna a sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio ,la socia cría a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solictan,la socia a la vez se dedica a la venta de chicha, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio  el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a   su negocio.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los demás socios se dedican a la agricultura, crianza de animales menores, venta de chicha.
texts.en:
Margarita is a member of the communal bank AYWAYRO. The bank is located in the Maras district, Urubamba province, in Cusco department.
Margarita is 51 years old, married, and has 5 children. She splits her daily work with the business of raising small animals. She has had this business for a good while, which is going well thanks to the resolve that she puts into her business every day. She raises her small animals to later sell them to her customers who ask for them. At the same time, she works selling chicha (traditional drink). She has had this business for a good while, which is going well for her due to the resolve which she puts into her business every day. 

She asks for the loan to purchase feed for her business. 

She is grateful for the loan that has been granted and pledges to meet all the established payments.

The other members work in agriculture, raising small animals and selling chicha.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her business.

loans.name: Kasifa

texts.en:
Kasifa is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has two children who are  currently in school. For the past four years, Kasifa has been working hard to manage her agriculture and charcoal sale business, which deal in farming and selling charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Kasifa has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal and farm items, and will help Kasifa to generate greater profits and provide for fees for the children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a cow. 

Kasifa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: buy more charcoal and farm items.

loans.name: Janifer

texts.en:
Janifer is a hardworking woman. She is 21 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past two years, Janifer has been working hard to manage her clothing business, where she sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Janifer has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Janifer to generate greater profits and to provide for the family. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Janifer is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 49 años de edad y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Desde varios años trabaja brindado servicios de veterinaria y venta de productos relacionados al sector. Le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable, emprendedora, honesta y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.
Su mayor motivación es su familia, por quienes lucha constantemente para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Agustina está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio y así ofrecer diversas opciones a los clientes. De esta manera sus ingresos incrementarán y con esto mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Agustina is a hard-working woman. She is 49 years old and lives in Guadalupe with her family.

For a number of years, she has worked offering veterinary services and selling related products in the area. It is going very well for her because she is a very responsible, enterprising and honest person with great desire to get ahead.

Her strongest motivation is her family, for whom she fights constantly to be able to offer them a better future.

Augustina is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, thanks to the help they have offered her, she will be able to purchase merchandise to stock the business and, in turn, offer diverse options to her customers. In this way, her income will increase and with this, she will improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to stock her veterinary business.

loans.name: Fátima Del Rosario

texts.es:
Fátima es una señora casada con 3 hijos a su cargo a quienes les brinda su apoyo  para su desarrollo y desempeña como docente de educación primaria  con  5 años de experiencia y de profesión Lic. 
Actualmente esta señora se presento a la oficina de ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un financiamiento el cual lo utilizaría para compra de un escritorio con su silla, lo que le vendrá a dar mejor comodidad para la elaboración de sus planes educativos. Con este crédito es el numero tres  de los cuales se siente muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le ha brindado para su desarrollo  en su seno familiar.
texts.en:
Fátima is married, with 3 children in her charge who she provides for. She works as a primary school teacher. She has 5 years of experience and a professional degree. 

She came to the Ceprodel office to recieve the benefit of a loan that she will use to buy a desk and chair. This will help her be more comfortable as she works on her educational plans. This is loan number three for her; she feels very grateful for the support that she has been provided for development in her family home.

loans.use: to buy a desk and chair.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth's group is comprised of hardworking women. Elizabeth is 24 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has four children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Elizabeth has been working hard to manage her clothing sale business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Elizabeth has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Elizabeth to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Elizabeth hopes that in the future she will be able to but a plot of land. 

Elizabeth is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain his mototaxi.

loans.name: Beautrice

texts.en:
Beautrice is a hardworking woman. She is 18 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past two years, Beautrice has been working hard to manage her clothing business, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Beautrice has requested a loan of 250,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes, and will help Beautrice to generate greater profits and provide for the family. Beautrice hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy goats and pigs. 

Beautrice is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rita's Group

texts.en:
Rita's Group is comprised of hardworking women. Rita is 21 years old and lives in the town of Sironko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Rita has been working hard to manage her school business, which sells text books. 

To help expand her business, Rita has requested a loan of 600,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase books, and sideboards, and will help Rita to generate greater profits and to provide necessities for her family. Rita hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Rita is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase books and sideboards for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions, cooking oil and Maggi to expand her business.

loans.name: Marta Silva

texts.es: Marta de 51 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella posee una tienda desde hace varios años, su negocio está ubicado en su lugar de residencia, vende golosinas, refrescos, azucar, dulces, etc. tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, Marta esta solicitando un crédito para la compra mas mercadería por mayor, para seguir con la elaboración de las tortillas y así pueda ella y su familia tener una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Marta is 51 years old and lives in her own home with her family. She has had a store for many years. Her business is located in her home and she sells sweets, soft drinks, sugar, candies, etc. She has many customers due to her friendliness while selling.

Marta is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise wholesale, to continue making tortillas and in that way she and her family can have a better quality of life without a single limitation.

loans.use: to buy sweets, soft drinks, sugar, candies, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Concepcion Group

texts.es: Dúo concepción quien está conformado por doña María Luisa de 54 años quien posee un local donde ella se dedica a la venta de tortilla en su localidad solicita su crédito para la compra de leña y maíz ya que esto le ayuda a poder tener mercadería para su negocio , ella también se dedica a la venta de leña ya que el lugar donde ella se ubica no hay alguien quien venda leña a sus clientes esto le ayuda porque posee un mejor ingresos en su negocio y ha incrementado sus ventas su meta es poder lograr hacer crecer mas su negocio y poder tener otro local en donde ella pueda ahorrar para su futuro más adelante y no pasar necesidades económicas.
texts.en: The "Dúo Concepción" group is made up [in part] by María Luisa, who is 54 years old and owns a store where she sells torillas in her town. She is requesting a loan to buy firewood and corn, since this helps her to have merchandise for her business. She also sells firewood because in the area where she is located, no one sells firewood to her clients. This allows her to have a better income in her business and she has increased her sales. Her goal is to be able to grow her business more and to have another store where she can save for the future ahead and not experience economic shortfalls.

loans.use: to buy corn for torillas and firewood for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase merchandise to open a beauty product business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more food containers and bowls to expand her business.

loans.name: Nuevo Porvenir Group

texts.es:
ELENA tiene 26 años, una hija de 6 años y actualmente está embarazada. Vive con su esposo. Quien trabaja  diariamente en una trici-moto para ayudar a cubrir los gastos del hogar.
ELENA se dedica a la venta de comida preparada cerca a la estación de policía- además ella trabaja en un pequeño gabinete de belleza.
Para ELENA es el cuarto (4to) crédito gestionado en FODEMI y menciona que le va muy bien. Ella cree que es una buena opción para la gente pobre y humilde.
Con sus compañeros de grupo se conocen desde la infancia y reconoce que son muy organizados en actividades que realizan en beneficio de su comunidad y barrio.
Con este crédito ELENA implementara un nuevo negocio, el mismo que consiste en “venta de sabanas y toldos” los mismos que tienen una considerable salida en las ventas en la costa pacífica y no requiere de mucho esfuerzo por parte de ella que se encuentra embarazada.
Ha podido construir su propia casa y en un futuro espera tener más mercadería y entregar al por mayor a sus amigas y clientes.
texts.en:
Elena, age 26, has a six year old daughter, and Elena is currently pregnant.  She lives with her husband.  He works every day in a three wheeled motorized vehicle in order to help cover the household expenses.  Elena sells prepared food near the police station.  She also works at a small beauty parlor.

This is Elena's fourth loan with FODEMI.  She says that it is going very well for her.  She believes that it is a good option for poor and humble people.

She and her colleagues in the communal bank have known each other since they were children.  She acknowledges that they are very organized in doing things that benefit their community and neighborhood.

Elena will use this loan to set up a new business, which will consist of selling sheets and canvas awnings.  They have a considerable success in sales on the Pacific coast, and they do not require a lot of effort on her part in light of her pregnancy.  She has been able to build her own house, and in the future she hopes to have more merchandise to deliver wholesale to her friends and customers.

loans.use: to set up a new business, which will consist of selling sheets and canvas awnings.

loans.name: Dúo Elohim Group

texts.es:
Dúo Elohim

Maritza es casada tiene una hija de 13 años de edad quien asiste al colegio cercano a su domicilio, ella se dedica a atender su negocio el cual es venta de productos de limpieza para el hogar el cual inicio hace 4 años, tomo la decisión de iniciar un negocio para obtener ingresos para apoyar en los ingresos de su hogar, se siente muy satisfecha por que le gusta lo que hace y le esta yendo muy bien en el negocio, solicita el crédito para invertir mas en la compra de su mercadería para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y obtener mas ganancias y asi poder darle a su hija una mejor vida, le gustaría mucho tener un lugar adecuado para su negocio ya que actualmente vende ambulantemente.
texts.en:
Dúo Elohim

Martiza is married and has 13 year old daughter who attends the nearby high school. She works in her business, which is the sale of home cleaning products, and which she started 4 years ago. She made the decision to start a business to obtain income to contribute to the household income. She feels very satisfied because she likes what she does and things are going very well for her in her business. She is requesting the loan to purchase more merchandise to satisfy her customers' needs and to earn more income so she can give her daughter a better life. She would very much like to have an adequate place for her business, since she currently works as a street vendor.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, rebar, galvanized metal roofing sheets, etc. to build two rooms.

loans.name: 21 De Junio Group

texts.es:
JORGE es un hombre dinámico de 60 años, es mecánico y desde muy joven trabaja en su propio taller. El es parte del grupo 21 de junio que en esta ocasión solicitan un crédito a FODEMI para mejorar su negocio.
Don JORGE vive con su esposa y 5 hijos. Por la inseguridad del local donde funciona el taller, en 2 ocasiones le sustrajeron varias de sus herramientas. 
Para JORGE es el primer  crédito en esta institución, con el que desea adquirir un taladro y un compresor. Y asi poder continuar con su trabajo diario.
Dice estar muy contento con esta oportunidad de crédito ya que representa una ayuda muy importante para la gente de escasos recursos y posibilidades de trabajo. Se nota la ayuda social y generosa. Sin que la vida de las personas se encuentre atentada. Porque anteriormente los llamados chulqueros (personas que prestan dinero a alto interés mensual) nos cobraban un interés del 20% mensual. Llevando al pequeño comerciante a la quiebra. 
En 5 años .JORGE cree haber trabajado mucho y arreglar su local para trabajar con mayor tranquilidad y no temer de que sus herramientas puedan ser sustraídas.
texts.en:
Jorge is a dynamic 60 year old man.  He is a mechanic who from a young age has worked in his own workshop.  He is part of the "21 de Junio" group who is currently seeking a loan from FODEMI to improve his business.  Jorge lives with his wife and their five children.  Given the insecurity of the area where his workshop is located, he has had his tools stolen on two occasions.  

This is Jorge's first loan with the institution, and he is hoping to purchase a drill and a compressor.  This will allow him to continue with his daily work.  He says that he is very happy with this loan opportunity because they provide very important support and job opportunities for people of few means.  This support is very generous and does not harm peoples' lives.  In the past, loan sharks (people who lend money with high monthly interest rates) charged them interest rates of 20%, which would force small businessmen into bankruptcy.  In the past five years, Jorge believes he has worked very hard to fix up his shop in order to work more comfortably and not have to worry about his tools being stolen.

loans.use: purchase a drill and a compressor to open his workshop and provide better service to the community.

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is a hardworking woman. She is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kumi in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Ann has been working hard to manage her bar business, which sells local brew. 

To help expand her business, Ann has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase millet, pots, and straws, and will help Ann to generate greater profits and add capital to the business. Ann hopes that in the future she will be able to open a modern bar. 

Ann is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to purchase millet, pots, straws.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a hardworking woman. She is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She has no children. For the past three years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her tailoring business, which sews clothes. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase materials and threads and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and expand the business. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another machine. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life skills training.

loans.use: purchase materials and threads

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an electric fabric-cutting machine.

loans.name: Yesica

texts.es:
Yesica es una joven mujer  de 21 años de edad soltera y sin hijos.
Ella ocupa su tiempo en el trabajo y los estudios. Vive con su familia y con su trabajo solventa sus estudios. El trabajo es un negocio familiar y toda la familia se encarga de la producción de zapatos de cholita, estos zapatos son de mujer de traje tradicional, planos sin taco y son muy populares entre las mujeres de vestir tradicional del lugar donde reside. Yesica pensaba dedicarse a los estudios pero la situación económica de su familia no puede ayudarle  optó por estudiar contabilidad y aportar con sus conocimientos a la economía familiar.
Ella tiene necesidades estudiantiles, no cuenta con una computadora como material básico de estudios y necesita manejar Microsoft Excel para cuantificar planillas de pago y otros ejercicios básicos de su carrera de estudios, ella desea ser profesional con urgencia para ayudar a su familia y mejorar la situación económica en la que se encuentran.
Es por esos motivos que Yesica solicita un préstamo para la compra de una computadora y así concluir su carrera para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yesica is a 21 year old woman.  She is single and does not have children.  She spends her time working and studying.  She lives with her family and with her work she is able to pay for her education.  She works in her family's business, and all of the family works producing cholita shoes.  These are shoes worn by women who dress in traditional outfits.  They are plain, have no heel and are very popular among women who wear the traditional outfits of the region.  Yesica thought about dedicating herself completely to her studies, but her family's financial situation prevented that.  She decided to study accounting in order to use her education to help her family's finances.

She has student needs.  She does not have a computer, a basic school tool, and she needs to use Microsoft Excel to quantify payrolls and perform other basic tasks for her courses.  She urgently wants to be a professional so that she can help her family and improve the financial situation they are currently in.  For these reasons Yesica is seeking a loan to purchase a computer so that she can finish her education so she can improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a more soap, paste, biscuits, and cigarettes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to expand her business.

loans.name: Amistad Group

texts.en:
Totonicapán is a large Quiche-speaking town located in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is well-known throughout the country for the production of intricately woven “ikat” or “jaspe” skirts called “cortes.” These colorful treasures have been proudly worn by indigenous women throughout Guatemala for over a century. Here, 10 women have formed a Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Amistad” or “Friendship.”  

The ladies are requesting a second loan from Kiva investors. They are quite proud that they have been able to successfully conclude their previous loan cycle. The women share that their businesses have grown, and that they are ready to invest more in their work.

Previously, we reported on Gregoria, a married 36-year-old woman with two children. For this loan cycle, she has been elected secretary of the group, a role that she efficiently carries out. Gregoria has a textile business and sells beautiful, typical blouses called “huipiles,” traditional skirts or “cortes,” as well as elaborate belts and aprons. Her husband and children work with her in the business. With the entire family involved, there are enough funds for her two teenage children to attend school.  

Gregoria is requesting a loan to purchase additional textiles that she will sell in three different locales. She is a determined woman and has a firm plan for the growth and expansion of her business.

The women of the “Amistad” Trust Bank have created an atmosphere of trust and support. They share the common desire to progress and support their families. The ladies understand the importance of education, not only for their children but for themselves as well. The majority of them were not able to attend school and so the educational component of their monthly meetings is very valuable for them. A Friendship Bridge Loan Officer presents timely and useful information about effective business practices (accounting, budgeting, customer service, marketing, pricing) as well as health, hygiene, nutrition and the use of medicinal plants. With education, the ladies become empowered and more confident. They learn about women’s rights, violence against women and self-esteem. Friendship Bridge calls the effective combination of the loans and education “Microcredit Plus.”

Gregoria and the women of the “Amistad” Trust Bank appreciate the opportunity to secure a loan and move ahead. We look forward to reporting on their progress in the very near future. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: To diversify her inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Dúo Luisa Alejandra Group

texts.es:
Dúo Luisa Alejandra
Sara es madre soltera tiene 4 hijos ( 19, 17, 10,6) de los cuales los dos mas pequeños asisten a la escuela ubicada cerca de su comunidad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogos y por las tardes trabaja,  para obtener mas ingresos para sostener a su familia ya que es muy difícil ser padre y madre es por ello que se dedica a  su negocio el cual inicio hace 6 años, solicita el crédito ya que en este negocio se debe trabajar con capital propio y sus pedidos han incrementado y ella no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para obtener su mercadería, le gusta mucho atender su negocio ya que se conoce mucha gente y eso le ayuda a que sus clientes incrementen y pueda obtener mas ganancias.
texts.en:
The Luisa Alejandra Duo.

Sara is a single mother who has four children (ages 19, 17, 10, 6), of whom the two youngest attend a school located close to their community.  She works selling cosmetics from a catalog in the afternoons in order to generate more earnings to sustain her family since it is very difficult being the father and the mother.  This is why she has dedicated herself to this business that she started six years ago.

She is seeking a loan since in this business one must work with their own capital.  Her orders have increased and she does not have the money to purchase the merchandise.  She really enjoys running her business since she gets to know a lot of people and this allows her to increase her clientele and generate greater earnings.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase galvanized sheet metal, purlins and nails to repair the roof of her home.

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es: Karla es una comerciante de artesanías, que son adornos para el hogar. Ella los vende y luego los distribuye entre sus clientes. En meses pasados debido a varios temblores ocurridos en Managua, la casa de Karla se vio afectada. Está en la necesidad de solicitar un préstamo para reparar las paredes y portones de su vivienda. Karla espera que con esta reparación su casa no vuelva a sufrir daño, y sobre todo que ella se pueda sentir segura dentro de ella.
texts.en: Karla sells crafts that are decorations for the house. She sells them and distributes them to her clients. In past months, due to several small earthquakes that happened in Managua, Karla's house was damaged. She needs to request a loan to repair the walls and gates of her house. Karla hopes that with these repairs, her house won't be damaged again, and above all, that she can feel safe in it.

loans.use: to repair walls and a gate in her house.

loans.name: La Libertad Group

texts.es: Efraín, tiene 39 años de edad, esta casado, tiene 5 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá.  Desde hace 15 años el tiene su propio cultivo de papas, maíz y frijol. La producción la vende en el mercado local donde saca sus ingresos familiares. ha solicitado varios prestamos a la institución para mantener sus cultivos, actualmente solicita otro que es el sexto ciclo y es por  14,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar abonos e insecticidas para darle asistencia a sus cultivos de papas, y sacar mejor producción. El préstamo es en forma grupal que se llama La Libertad, está integrado por 3 miembros, quienes viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican a la agricultura. El préstamo grupal es por 31,500 Lempiras para comprar abonos e insecticidas para el cultivo de papas. En la foto esta  Juan a la izquierda en medio  Efraín y Jaime a la derecha.
texts.en:
Efrain is 39 years old, married, has 5 children and lives in a village in the municipality of Intibucá. He has grown his own potatoes, corn and beans for 15 years. He sells his product in the local market where he earns his household income. He has requested several loans from the institution to maintain his crops and is currently requesting another. This is the sixth cycle and is for 14,000 Lempiras with which he will buy fertilizers and insecticides to support his potato crops and to improve production.

The loan is with a group called La Libertad [Freedom] made up of 3 members who live in the same community and make a living in agriculture. The group loan is for 31,500 Lempiras to buy fertilizers and insecticides for growing potatoes. Juan is in the photo on the left, Efrain in the middle and Jaime on the right.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Elmer Juan

texts.es:
Elmer es un joven emprendedor, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Guadalupe junto a su familia.
Desde hace 4 años se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte a lo largo de la ciudad en una mototaxi que tiene. Le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, trabajador y amable con los clientes.
Elmer está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá realizar un mantenimiento completo de su vehículo para que no tenga ningún problema al momento de transportar a los pasajeros. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ganancias y seguirá esforzándose para poder apoyar a su familia.
texts.en:
Elmer is a young entrepreneur. He is 38 years old, single, and lives in Guadalupe, along with his family.

For 4 years he has been providing transportation services thoughout the city in a motorcycle taxi that he has. Things are going well for him because he's very responsible, hardworking, and friendly to his clients.

Elmer is grateful to the Kiva lenders because, with the help they have provided, he will be able to do complete maintenance on his vehicle so that he won't have any problems while transporting his passengers. In this way he'll earn better income and will continue working hard to support his family.

loans.use: to have maintenence work done on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air-conditioner and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his son's college tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena is a 61-year-old married woman with 3 children. She runs and operates a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Filomena needs a loan to buy loaves of bread, butter, peanut butter, jam, cans of tuna, mayonnaise, soft drinks, plastic bags, and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with the renovation of her house. Filomena has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread, butter, peanut butter, jam, cans of tuna, mayonnaise, soft drinks, plastic bags, and foam cups

loans.name: Potofou

texts.en:
Potofou is a 23-year-old unwed woman with 1 child. She makes and sells barbeque in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Potofou needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, soya sauce, chinese onions, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, potatoes, and paper plates. 

She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Potofou has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, sausages, soya sauce, chinese onions, tomato sauce, mayonnaise, potatoes, and paper plates

loans.name: Faletolu

texts.en: Faletolu is a 60-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Faletolu needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil, a strainer, yeast and plastic bags. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faletolu has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a frying pan, a barrel of cooking oil, a strainer, yeast and plastic bags

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner and sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and table.

loans.name: Jamila's Group

texts.en:
Jamila's group is composed of hardworking women. Jamila is 21 years old and lives in the town of Siroko in the Mbale region of Uganda. She has two children who are both currently in school. For the past four years, Jamila has been working hard to manage her fish vending business, where she sells fish. 

To help expand her business, Jamila has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fish, and will help Jamila to generate greater profits and educate her children. Jamila hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy plot of land. 

Jamila is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more fish.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an iron and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Repeka

texts.en:
Repeka is a 27-year-old unwed woman with 2 children. She runs a small flea market stall and sells cabbages and tomatoes in her community to earn a living. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Repeka needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, seeds, plastic bags, a watering hose and new gum boots. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Repeka has been a member of SPBD since 2012.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, seeds, plastic bags, a watering hose and new gum boots

loans.name: Anecita

texts.en:
Anecita is 44 years old and has one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. She has been in this business for six years.

In the future Anecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en: Tautala is a 55-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has eight years of experience with this business. Tautala needs a loan to buy a new canoe, a spear, fishing rods, fishing line, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house. Tautala has been a member of SPBD since 2006.

loans.use: to buy a new canoe, a spear, fishing rods, fishing line, hooks, bait, flippers and new goggles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Frisca

texts.en:
Frisca is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and has three children who are in school.

Frisca has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish, ice and plastic bags.

Frisca has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish, ice and plastic bags

loans.name: Marialina

texts.en:
Marialina is 52 years old and married with two children.

Marialina earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs.

Marialina has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Picaflor Group

texts.es:
En Rocafuerte vive JENNY   mujer luchadora, emprendedora de 49 años. Tiene 6 hijos (todos mayores de edad) vive actualmente sola en una casa donada por el gobierno. 
Ella tiene una discapacidad producto de principios de derrame cerebral. 
Su negocio consiste en la venta de bebidas refrescantes y gaseosas en su domicilio. Desea con este nuevo crédito abastecerse de yogurt – avenas- cereales y más productos que contengan valores nutricionales para los niños en edad escolar. Ya que ellos son sus clientes mayoritarios.  
En 3 años desea tener su negocio más amplio y de ser posible contratar alguna persona para que le ayude en las ventas. 
Menciona que estos créditos son la mejor noticia que ha recibido y le ha ayudado a prosperar en sus ideas de negocios. Además menciona haber dejado de ser víctima de quienes prestaban dinero al 20% mensual.
Recibirá $ 400,00 los que invertirá completamente en su negocio. 
Ella conoce muy bien a todos los integrantes de su grupo y esta convencida de continuar trabajando en beneficio de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Rocafuerte is where Jenny lives.  She is a 49 year old woman, enterprising and a fighter.  She has six children (all adults) who now live with her in a house given by the government.   She is disabled due to a stroke.  Jenny's business is the sale of carbonated and soft drinks from her home.  With the new loan she wants to stock yogurt, oats, cereals and other products with nutritional value for school age children, who are her main customers. 

In three years Jenny wants to have a more extensive business and be able to hire someone to help her with sales.  She mentions that these loans are the best news she has heard in a long time and have helped her to thrive with her business ideas.  Jenny also comments that she has stopped being a victim of those who loan money at 20% a month.   She will receive $400 to invest completely in the business.  She knows the members of her group well and is convinced to continue working for the benefit of their community.

loans.use: to supply yogurt oats, cereals and other products with nutritional value for school-age children

loans.name: Benkadi Iii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI III  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  32 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à DJOMBOUGOU, commune de KADIANA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec AFOU ALI 1ère personne debout à droite sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  3 hectares. La production est vendue au niveau du marché  après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 195.000FCFA qui lui  permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkadi III group are married women who, on average, are 32 years old, have four children and all live in polygamous families in Djombougou, Kadiana commune, Kolondieba circle, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their third loan with the institution, having fully paid back their previous loans. The crops cultivated by Afou Ali, the first person standing to the right of the photo, are rice and peanuts. With her loan, she expects to buy fertilizer, soil enriching agents, and seeds and to pay the labor costs for three hectares of land. The products are sold at the market level, after the harvest to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 195,000 francs CFA which will permit her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, soil enriching agents, seeds, and labor costs for the farming season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an over sewing machine and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a table, fabric, and an over sewing machine.

loans.name: Danira

texts.en: Danira, age 26, earns an income by farming taro and bananas on her small plantation. She sells her produce in her community or at the market. She has been engaged in this business for two years. She is the single mother of two small children, and she works hard to support her family. Danira joined SPBD this year to improve her business. She has now requested a loan so that she can buy seedlings, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, new overalls, a crowbar, a spade, and gloves. She will use the increased profits from her sales to cover her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy seedlings, chemicals, fertilizer, a tiller, new overalls, a crowbar, a spade, and gloves

loans.name: María José

texts.es:
María es una joven  esforzada, madre soltera con hijo al que tiene a su cargo, de profesión auxiliar de enfermería, labora en un centro de salud en la  localidad donde vive, desde hace 5 años.
Esta señora tiene la necesidad de mejorar su vivienda atreves de la construcción de un cuarto  por tal razón visito a la oficina de ceprodel para solicitar un financiamiento el que utilizaría en la compra de materiales de construcción  bloques, arena, cemento y pago de mano de obra.  los cuales le ayudarían a realizar dicha obra y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en: Maria is a woman who strives hard, a single mother with a son depending on her.  Her work for the last five years has been that of assistant nurse at a health center in the area where she lives.  Maria needs to improve her home by building a room.  For that reason she visited the Ceprodel office to ask for a loan she will use to buy construction materials, including cement blocks, sand, and cement and to pay for labor.  This will help her carry out this project and have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials including concrete blocks, sand, and cement and to pay for labor to improve her home

loans.name: Laura

texts.en: Laura is a 20-year-old single woman with no children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. Laura needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, a frying pan and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Laura has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, cooking oil, yeast, a frying pan and a new oven

loans.name: Benkadi I Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec ADIARRA  1ère personne accroupie à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau de  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. ADIARRA espère faire un bénéfice de 100.000FCA qui lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The members of the Benkadi I group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old, have three children and all live in polygamous families in N'Gola, Kebila commune, Kolondieba circle, one of the prefectures of the third administrative region of Mali. They are working with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better run their farming businesses during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with the institution, having fully paid back their previous loans. The crops cultivated by Adiarra, the first person crouching to the left of the photo, are rice and peanuts. With her loan, she expects to buy fertilizer, soil enriching agents, and seeds and to pay the labor costs to make use of one hectare of land. The products are sold in Kebila after the harvest to a clientele made up of men and women. She expects to make a profit of 100,000 francs CFA which will permit her to pay back her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, soil enriching agents, seeds, and labor costs for the farming season.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is an 18-year-old student from Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines. He graduated from high school at Saint Vincent Institute of Arts and Sciences. He is now a third-year student in STI College and he's taking a Bachelor of Science degree in Accounting Technology. He expects to graduate in 2016. His favorite subjects are accounting subjects and he is the president of his class. After graduation, he will enroll for one more year, to have his review and then take the exam to become a Certified Public Accountant (CPA). 

With the uncertainty of his parents' income, he decided to get this loan to help sustain his tuition fees for this semester. He wants to be an accountant after graduation, to financially help his family. He wants to say thank you, in advance, to the lenders who will trust him and will play a part in reaching his dreams.

loans.use: to pay for his tuition fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to fix up her food stand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy musical instruments for his business.

loans.name: Rin

texts.en:
Rin, 51 years old, lives in a remote area of Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a hard-working farmer in the rice farm land near her house. Rin has 5 children, 3 of whom are already married. Farming, which is the main source of her income, allows her to make about USD 3 in one day.
 
Rin is living far from a water source, so it is very time and energy consuming for her to get water. To overcome this obstacle, she is borrowing money from HKL to dig a pond just behind her house. Through this loan, she hopes that it will be quite easy for her to reach the water source. She would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to dig a pond

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a married woman with four children. She is 49 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosa has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

Rosa requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more bananas to sell to her customers.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell to her customers

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Jake is 17 years old and is the first child in the family. His mother, Amalia, who is a member of Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF), supports the family through her livestock-raising business in the Philippines. In the picture, the woman wearing pink blouse is Amalia, Jake's mother. 

Jake is studying for a Bachelor of Science degree in Information Technology and is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Amalia, Jake's mother, is borrowing PHP 5,500 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of the school year, 2014-2015.

Jake plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is married with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Narcisa is 46 years old and has one child who is in school.

Narcisa has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 6 years. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy products for selling food, clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita has been operating her own retail store for five years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan used for the business successfully. Her husband worked in their farm and at the same time helped her in her business.

The couple has to work hard with determination of having better income to provide their family a comfortable living. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. 

In the future, Anita hopes to have a better living.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thô 3 Thống Nhất - Quảng Vinh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hải works in agriculture raising poultry and pigs . She requests a loan to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in future.

Hải is 50 years old and she is married with 3 children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her 3 dependents.  Hải has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hải faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is Hải's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Hải is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thô 3 Thống Nhất - Quảng Vinh Group solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. 

In the future, Hải hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry and pigs to raise and sell in future

loans.name: Lorraine May

texts.en: Lorraine May is 23 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Lorraine May has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years, and also earns an income from farming vegetables. Lorraine May aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia works hard to support her family. Lydia is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years now. She requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of fish to sell. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family. As what you have seen in the photo Lydia carrying a basket, inside on it is the pack of fish weigh per kilo and pack with the plastic bag where she sells in the area.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 43 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Julieta works very hard to provide for them.

Julieta runs a business buying and selling recycled materials in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of recycled materials to sell. Julieta has been in this business for 4 years.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Subekti

texts.en:
Subekti is a private employee. He lives in Cirebon, a semi-urban area about seven hours from Jakarta. Subekti is married. 

To increase the family income, Subekti also works as a dealer. He joined Ruma three months ago to increase his income and feels really excited to expand his business in selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments for customers.

Subekti is starting to process electricity bill payments for his customers, which is a much-needed service in the area and will increase his income. To provide this new service, Subekti is required to print out receipts for customers. A Kiva loan will be able to help him purchase this printer and be able to offer the new service.

loans.use: To buy printer which is required for him to process bill payment transaction

loans.name: Gunadei

texts.en:
Gunadei a married lady of 28. She is a resident of a rural village named Badi in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. She belongs to a Schedule caste family. The lady sitting with her hand raised in the photograph is Gunadei. She resides with her husband and two sons who are six and nine years old. Her two children are studying in fourth and third standard in a private school.  Gunadei herself has been running a fancy store with ladies fancy items and cosmetics in her house for the last eight years. Her husband works for a private company. Presently, she and her husband earn a monthly income of 10,000 INR. This is not at all sufficient for her to manage the household expenses, business investments and educational expenses of her children.  

Gunadei has a dream of giving a better education to her children. So she and her husband decided to admit their elder son in a private school. But scarcity of money was a problem for her. When Mahashakti Foundation started the education loans, Gunadei applied and took a loan of 10,000 INR for the educational expenses of her elder son who is there with her in the photograph. With this loan, she will pay the admission fee, tuition fee and arrange study materials like books etc. This will encourage her son as well as Gunadei to take a future course of action. She is very hopeful that she will be able to respectfully stand her children in the society.

loans.use: To pay admission fees and tuition fees and arrange for study materials for her son

loans.name: Grezel

texts.en:
Grezel is 23 years old, a married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Grezel's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her fish vending business and is committed to regain what she lost. Grezel is taking out a PHP 4,664.28 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Grezel has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Grezel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Nely

texts.en:
Nely runs a small stall selling mobile phone airtime credits and mobile accessories. Nely lives in Purwokerto, a semiurban area about 10 hours from Jakarta. Nely is married and living with four people in the family home. In the picture, she is with her child.

Nely began working with Ruma one month ago because she wanted to increase her income. She feels really excited to expand her business selling mobile phone airtime credits and processing bill payments. As the business continues, she hopes to get a Kiva working capital loan in order to do more transactions on weekends.

loans.use: To process more transactions in a week

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for 17 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Pan

texts.en:
Pan, 41, lives in Prey Chhor District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has five children who are enrolled in school right now. To make a living, she works as a farmer in a small rice field which is located just behind her house.  So far, it is nearly 20 years that she has been involved in this farming business which can earn a net profit of USD 5 per day.

Pan wants to promote her family's income by raising baby pigs and selling them to local dealers when they are grown. Now she is borrowing a loan from HKL to use as capital investment for her new business. Pan would like to thank lenders for the financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Miriama

texts.en: Miriama is a 58-year-old married woman with one child. She makes and sells sandwiches, donuts, snacks and soft drinks in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Miriama needs a loan to buy loaves of bread, butter, jam, peanut butter, bags of flour, sugar, twisties and soft drinks. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Miriama has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy loaves of bread, butter, jam, peanut butter, bags of flour, sugar, twisties and soft drinks

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is in the food vending business. She sells frozen foods in their community where she earns Php 5,000 a month. To add to her income, her husband is engaged in the farming business. Though both of them do have a livelihood, their income is not enough cover the everyday expenses of their five children and household expenses as well. 

Teresa is asking for a Php 15,000 loan from KIVA lenders for the tuition fee of her daughter, Mylene, who is a 2nd year student. Teresa and Mylene  hope that the lenders will approve this loan for they believe that it will definitely help Mylene to have a successful career.

loans.use: To pay the tution fee of her daughter

loans.name: Luisa Seiuli

texts.en: Luisa is a 54-year-old divorced woman with five children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Luisa needs a loan to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar, spatula, a large frying pan and a new oven. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Luisa has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy flour, cooking oil, sugar, spatula, a large frying pan and a new oven

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita, a 41-year-old microentrepreneur from Payatas, Quezon City, Philippines, has run her pillow-making business for 10 years and she makes a good income from this. Having a big family requires a lot of effort to provide for everyone’s needs, especially for her children. She and his husband are determined to work hard to provide their children with a better education than they currently have.

She cuts scrap materials from textiles, foam and fibers, puts it in a plain pillowcase and covers it with a better looking pillowcase of various cartoon designs. She makes different kinds and sizes of pillows. Prices range from PHP 35 to PHP 80 per pillow. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She also has clients in the market that regularly orders pillows from her.  She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To improve her service and sales, Mercedita is taking a PHP 25,000 loan to buy supplies needed in her business. She will be using the loan to buy additional foam, fabric, plastic, cotton, rugby and other materials that are necessary to increase her production.

In the future, she hopes to prosper through her business and she dreams for her family to be financially free and be able to provide quality education for her children.

She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials like foam, straw, fabric and cotton needed in her pillow-making business.

loans.name: Generoso

texts.en:
This is Generoso, who is 37 years old and a resident of Bacoor, Cavite in the Philippines. He is married to Christina, a vendor, and they have children. He and his wife manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Generoso is a fish vendor. He buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. He buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer his products since they are assured of its freshness and cleanliness. His store is located in a temporary fish market, and his regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a 40,000 PHP loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy varieties of fish needed in his business. 

Generoso hopes to be successful in business and dreams that his children will finish their studies. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for varieties of fish needed in his business.

loans.name: Las 4 Ríos  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las 4 Ríos está formada por 8 socias y 2 socios quienes viven por la parroquia de Sidcay en Cuenca, en donde la agricultura y ganadería es la rama de ocupación tradicional de sus habitantes; la que es solo para autoabastecerse, razón suficiente para que salgan a la ciudad de Cuenca en busca de otras fuentes de trabajo. Las socias son personas amables y gentiles que tienen un objetivo en común, el mismo que es salir adelante con sus familias y ofrecerles un mejor bienestar.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Digna, es una socia amable y colaborativa que forma parte del grupo de crédito Las 4 Ríos, en este grupo se encuentra desde hace 8 años, tiempo en el que ha estrechado lasos de amistad con todas sus compañeras, y los créditos le han permitido superarse en sus negocios.
La Sra. Digna tiene 52 años de edad y vive en unión libre y a procreando 11 hijos, 6 hijos son casados y viven independientes, sus hijos solteros estudian en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo trabaja como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.
Doña Digna se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y en su tiempo libre realiza guaipe (tela para limpiar), esta actividad la realiza hace tres años, también tiene un su negocio de venta de salchipapas las que vende en su parroquia desde hace 10 años. El dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en el pago de las matriculas del colegio de sus hijos y también para la compra de tela para realizar guaipe. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
La foto pequeña es de una socia y un socio que no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomo la foto
del grupo.
texts.en:
The loan group Las 4 Ríos is made up of eight women and two men who live in the parish of Sidcay in Cuenca, where the branch of traditional work is agriculture and ranching, which is only to be self-sufficient, reason enough for them to leave the city of Cuenca in search of other sources of work. The partners are kind and courteous people that have a common objective, which is to come out ahead with their families and to offer them better wellbeing. 

One of the partners in this group is Señora Digna. She is a kind and collaborative woman that forms part of the loan group Las 4 Ríos. She has been a part of this group for eight years, time in which she has made friendships with all of her companions. The loans have allowed her to better herself in her businesses. 

Sra. Digna is 52 years old and lives in a partnership. She has 11 children, six are married and live independently and her single children study at a high school in the city. Her husband works as a private employee, and she does not have her own home, therefore they live in the home of a relative. Doña Digna is dedicated to the chores of her home and in her free time carries out making cloth for cleaning. She has carried out this activity for three years, she also has a business in selling salchipapas (a fast food dish) which she has sold in her parish for 10 years. 

She is going to invest the money from her new loan in the payment of secondary enrollment for her children and also for the purchase of cloth in order to carry out making cleaning cloths. Her dream is to have her own house. 

The small photo is of two partners who could not be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to pay enrollment and to buy fabric.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
