Ruth works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her fishing business and is now requesting a PHP 9,942.80 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help Ruth will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: March's Group

texts.en:
March is 45 years old and married with five children in a village of the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and sometimes working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn about 35,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs and is able to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

March has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back the past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her rice paddy.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Deolinda

texts.en: Deolinda is taking a loan of $1500 to improve her business. She is running a mini shop that helps her to generate income for her family. She will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store such as shirts, long sleeved and short sleeved, and shorts. She opened her mini shop with her own working capital of $600. Deolinda is a hardworking woman and she hopes to run a bigger business in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, long sleeved and short sleeved, and shorts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy colored fabric, thread, sponge and clasps, etc.

loans.name: Faamati

texts.en: Faamati is a 31-year-old married woman with 4 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Faamati needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, chinese candy, a chest freezer, foam cups and a small cooler. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Faamati has been a member of SPBD since 2009.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, chinese candy, a chest freezer, foam cups and a small cooler

loans.name: Scarlet

texts.en:
Scarlet is 54 years old and married with four children. Scarlet works very hard to provide for them.

Scarlet's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Scarlet has restarted her fishing business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Scarlet has taken a PHP 9485.70 housing loan through NWTF in order to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Scarlet is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in future would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Vivencia

texts.en:
Vivencia is 54 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She buys and sells rice grains in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

Vivencia has borrowed and repaid 33 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Grace Lyn is 19 years old and a daughter of Vilma who is the member of Project Dungganon-NWTF and Grace Lyn is the third of five children in the family. 

Vilma is borrowing 9,500 PHP to pay for tuition fees for the first semester of 2014-2015 of her daughter Grace Lyn.

Grace Lyn is currently in the second year of her four-year Bachelor of Science in Office Management course.

When she graduates, Grace Lyn plans to finish her studies and have stable work to help her family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Nicanora

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Nicanora works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF to buy materials like cloth, threads, buttons, etc. for her tailoring business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Nicanora has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like cloth, threads, and buttons

loans.name: Avelina

texts.en:
Daniel is 16 years old son of Avelina who is the member of Project Dungganon-NWTF. Daniel is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology. He is currently in the first year of this four-year course.

Avelina barrows PHP 9,609 to pay for tuition fees for the first semester in 2014-2015 of her son Daniel.

When he graduates, Daniel plans to finish his studies and help his family.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

Lorna has been in this business for 22 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Romelia

texts.en:
Catherine is the 17 year old daughter of Romelia who is a member of NWTF. Catherine is the fourth of seven children in the family. 

She is enrolling in a Social Work course.

Romelia is borrowing 8,000 PHP to fully pay the tuition fees of her daughter Catherine for the 4 years of skills training.

When she graduates, Catherine plans to to finish her studies and help her family uplift their living.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 31 years old and has four children. She is married and her four children are in school. Marilyn is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed for her pigs.

Marilyn has been in business for 3 years now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain her pig raising business. In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 46 years old and married with four children, two of whom are in school.  She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Alicia has been in this business for 22 years.

In the future, Alicia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Monalie

texts.en:
Monalie is 42 years old and married with six children.  With four children in school, Monalie works very hard to provide for them.

Monalie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Monalie has been in this business for five years, and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Monalie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 36 years old with three children, two of whom are in school.  She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Rosita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Rosita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Rosita would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is 48 years old and married with two children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Shirley has borrowed and paid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years, and also earns an income from a buy and sell charcoal business.

Shirley aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Cresilda

texts.en:
Cresilda is 47 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling dry goods like bags, shirt, notebook, sleepers, etc in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional dry goods to sell.

Cresilda has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business buying and selling dry goods for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Cresilda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dry goods to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda works hard to support her family. Rosalinda is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like meat, chicken, and spices.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Rosalinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, chicken, and spices for her business

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 52 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Elena works very hard to provide for them.

Elena runs a general store in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 6 years. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like shampoo, cereals, creamer, coffee, canned goods, beers, diapers, and eggs to sell.

In the future, Elena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional general store stocks to sell

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 37 years old and married with five children, three children who are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Eva has a general store business in the Philippines. Eva requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Eva has been in this business for 3 years. Eva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

loans.name: Benkadi Ii Group

texts.fr: Les membres du groupe  BENKADI II  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 2 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à N’GOLA, commune de KEBILA, cercle de KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés. La spéculation cultivée est  le riz et l’arachide  avec MAYAMOU  1ère personne debout à gauche sur la photo. Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labours pour exploiter  1 hectare. La production est vendue au niveau de  KEBILA après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.Elle compte avoir un  bénéfice de 100.000FCFA qui lui  permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en: The Benkadi II group is composed of married women averaging 34 years of age, with two children. They all live in polygamous families in N'Gola, township of Kebila, district of Kolondieba, a prefecture in the third administrative district of Mali. They collaborate with the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution in order to better manage their agricultural activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth loan with Soro Yiriwaso, having duly repaid their prior loans. They grow peanuts, which is what Mayamou does, for example. She is the first one standing on the left in the photo. With her loan, she plans to buy agricultural inputs [fertilizers etc] and seeds as well pay the costs of labor to work one ha [2.5 acres] of land. After harvesting, she sells her product in Kebila to a mixed clientele. She plans to earn 100,000 West African francs, which will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to  cover the costs of fertilizers, seeds  and labor for the agricultural season.

loans.name: San Martin Group

texts.es: “SAN MARTIN” es uno grupo conformado por socios entusiastas dedicado al comercio minorista. Lucila tiene 56 años de edad es soltera con un hijo independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de comida en las afueras de su vivienda y en sus tiempos libres vende productos de belleza a través de catálogos. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de utensilios  de cocina. Su mayor deseo es aperturar  su restaurant campestre en su domicilio. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Lucila es  la segunda del lado izquierdo viste polo blanco con chompa marrón.
texts.en: “SAN MARTIN” is a group comprised of enthusiastic members dedicated to retail businesses. Lucila, 56, is single and has 1 dependent child. She sells food in the surrounding areas of her home and in her spare time, sells beauty products by catalog. She'll invest the loan in kitchen utensils. Her biggest dream is to open a country restaurant in her home. The group is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their support. Lucila is the second on the left, wearing a white t-shirt with a brown sweater.

loans.use: buy kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Thida

texts.en:
Thida, who is 24 years old, is a pork seller in a small market in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. Thida has only one lovely son and her husband is a farmer. So far, she has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The average income that she can earn from her business is $5 per day.

Thida is applying for a loan form KIVA, and she will use the loan to buy farm land and grow rice on it. That farm land will be sold by her relatives with a special price for her. She would like to thank Kiva lenders for their financial support via HKL, which provides her with a much lower interest rate than its general loan product.

loans.use: to buy farm land and grow rice on it

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela is 44 years old and married with four children.

Adela is in the agricultural business, raising chickens in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

Adela has been raising chickens for 15 years now, and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her chickens.

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Leonora is 41 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Leonora has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia works hard to support her family. Letecia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Letecia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Letecia has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Letecia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil, and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Gresel

texts.en:
Gresel works hard to support her family. Gresel has a live-in partner and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Gresel requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

Gresel has been in this business for 3 years now.

Gresel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish, rice, palm oil, and seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en: Lucresia is married and works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Lucresia has been in this business for 10 years, and her goal for the future is to save enough money to expand her store.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Juanie

texts.en:
Juanie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of ready to wear clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional shirts, pants and other items to sell.

Juanie has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional shirts, pants and other items to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soap, paste, biscuits, and palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Mercy Diana

texts.es:
La Señora. Mercy desde hace 6 años forma parte del grupo de crédito 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación y clima frió, su población se dedica a la agricultura y cría de animales.
La Señora. Mercy tiene 24 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión ha concebido 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años, su esposo labora en un taller de mecánica, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de sus suegros con quienes comparten los gastos de la casa. 
Doña Mercy labora como auxiliar de pedagogía desde hace 7 meses, en casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes y cerdos. El dinero de su crédito va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en  alimento para sus animales. Su sueño es que sus hijos lleguen a ser buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
For six months Señora Mercy has been a member of the loan group "Fourteenth of August." She lives in the community of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a place that has abundant vegetation and a cold climate. Its population works in agriculture and raises animals.

Señora Mercy is 24 years old. She is married and has two children, ages 6 and 3. Her husband works in a mechanic's shop. They don't have their own house, so they live in the house of her in-laws, with whom they share the household expenses.

Doña Mercy has worked as a teaching assistant for 7 months. At home she raises guinea pigs and pigs. She is going to invest the money from her loan in the purchase of pigs and in food for her animals. Her dream is that her children become good professionals.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is married and works hard to support her family by running a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 18,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food to sell. She has been in this business for the last five years and wiuld like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-selling business

loans.name: María Zoila

texts.es:
La Señora María desde hace dos años forma parte del grupo de crédito 14 de Agosto, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación y es de clima frió, su población se dedica a la agricultura, cría de animales.
La Señora María tiene 61 años, es divorciada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos mayores de edad que están casados, vive en casa de su madre a quien cuida y se hacen compañía. 
Doña María se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa y la crianza de animales, ella tiene ganado, cerdos, cuyes y pollos, la agricultura es para el consumo de su casa. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de cuyes y alimento para sus animales. Su meta es tener más animales.
texts.en:
Señora Maria has been part of the loan group "Fourteenth of August" for two years. She lives in the community of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a place that has abundant vegetation and a cold climate. Its population works in agriculture and raises animals.

Señora Maria is 61 years old. She is divorced and has 7 adult children who are married. She lives in the house of her mother, whom she cares for, and they keep each other company.

Doña Maria does the household chores and raises animals. She has cattle, pigs, guinea pigs, and chickens. The agricultural products are for the consumption of her household. The money from the loan is to purchase guinea pigs and feed for her animals. Her dream is to have more animals.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Antonieta

texts.es: Antonieta no es casada pero tiene dos hijos ella vive en La Paz en una casa de ladrillo y cemento que es de su propiedad Antonieta se dedica a preparar y vender comida en un restaurante  que también es de su propiedad, el local no es grande pero Antonieta tiene muchas esperanzas, por eso solicita credito para comprar mayor cantidad de insumos (refrescos, carne, arroz, papa, fideos y otros) para su restaurante Antonieta no tiene a nadie que pueda apoyarla por eso necesita su ayuda
texts.en:
Antonieta is not married but she has two children. She lives in La Paz, in a house that she owns and it is made out of brick and concrete. Antonieta makes food and sells it in her own restaurant. The place isn’t very big, but Antonieta has hope. 
That’s why she is requesting the loan, to buy more supplies (drinks, meat, rice, potatoes, noodles, and others) for her restaurant. Antonieta doesn’t have anybody who can support her, that’s why she needs your help.

loans.use: to buy more supplies (drinks, meat, rice, potatoes, noodles, and others) for her restaurant.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros is married and works hard to support her family by running a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 14,000 from NWTF to buy ingredients to make more food to sell. Milagros has been in her current line of work for the last 16 years. She has successfully repaid her previous loan and is requesting a new loan to further build her business. Her goal is to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business

loans.name: Racilda

texts.en: Racilda is 49 years old and widowed with three children. With two of them currently in school, she works very hard to provide for her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She is requesting a loan for PHP 12,500 from NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as toothpaste, detergent, cereals, coffee, sugar, and canned goods. Racilda has been in this business for 10 years would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosalinda is 34 years old, and one of her children is currently in school.

Rosalinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Rosalinda requested a 13,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like rice, coconut, sugar, etc., for her food production business.

Rosalinda has been in this business for 13 years. Rosalinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like rice, coconut, sugar, etc., for her food production business

loans.name: Meleseke

texts.en:
Meleseke is a 27-year-old single woman with two children. She runs a small ice-cream stall in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Meleseke needs a loan to buy a new ice-cream-making machine, a scoop, cones, foam cups, plastic spoons, hand tissue and plastic bowls. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Meleseke has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a new ice-cream-making machine, a scoop, cones, foam cups, plastic spoons, hand tissue and plastic bowls

loans.name: Faitau

texts.en:
Faitau is a 32-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small sewing business to earn a living in her community. She has one year with this business. 

Faitau needs a loan to buy a larger sewing machine, needles, thread, fabric, a small table and a pair of scissors. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and help with her children's education. Faitau joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a larger sewing machine, needles, thread, fabric, a small table and a pair of scissors

loans.name: Carmen Narcisa

texts.es:
La Señora. Carmen es socia del grupo de crédito 14 de Agosto, le gusta esta forma de créditos ya que les fomentan la unión entre familias y amistades, vive por la comunidad de Zhidmad en Cuenca, lugar que tiene abundante vegetación y clima frió, su población se dedica a la agricultura y  cría de animales.
La Señora Carmen tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 12, 8 y 2 años, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia.
Doña Carmen desde hace 6 meses se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida en su comunidad, también se dedica a la crianza de animales como cuyes, pollos y cerdos, la actividad agrícola es para consumo de su casa y si existe un sobrante lo vende. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de víveres y en alimento para sus animales.
texts.en:
Señora Carmen is a member of the credit group, “14th of August”. She likes these kinds of loans because they foster togetherness among families and friends. She lives near the community of Zhidmad in Cuenca, a place that has abundant vegetation and a cool climate.  The people here work in agriculture and animal raising.

Señora Carmen is 28 years old, and she is married. She has three children from her marriage, ages 12, 8, and 2.  Her first two children are studying in the community school. Her husband works as a bricklayer, and she lives in her own house. 

Carmen has been preparing and selling food in her community for six months, and she also raises animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs. The agricultural activity is for her household consumption, and if there is a surplus, she sells it.  The money from her loan is for the purchase of supplies and feed for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario works hard to support her family. Rosario is married and has a buying and selling of soft drinks and purified drinking water business in the Philippines.

Rosario requested a 14,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to purchase more cases of soft drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell.

Rosario has been in this business for 13 years now.

Rosario would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more cases of soft drinks and containers of purified drinking water to sell

loans.name: Virgincita

texts.en:
Virgincita is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Virgincita is 45 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Virgincita has a weaving business in the Philippines. Virgincita requested a 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan amount through NWTF to purchase raw materials for her weaving business.

Virgincita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virgincita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
As a way of generating income, Teresita has been engaged in a direct selling business within her community for years now. She is 35 years of age and blessed with three children. Her husband, Arcie, works as an Overseas Filipino Worker and they work hard to provide for their needs.

She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customers order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are earning as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

Due to financial insufficiency, Teresita wants to make her business more profitable in order to earn a higher income. For this reason, she would like a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) to buy additional merchandise like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products that are needed to increase her product inventory. Being a kind and friendly mother, she is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

Teresita hopes to be able to save for her family and she dreams of good health for each and every member. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, undergarments, and cosmetics needed in her business.

loans.name: Los Exitosos Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “LOS EXITOSOS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Celinda ella es casada y tiene 39 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia trabaja  a pedido para todos sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades, familiares, entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas para su negocio.
La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.

 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de productos de belleza y costurera.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "Los Exitosos" (The Successful Ones). This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province and department of Cusco.

One member is Señora Celinda. She is married and is 39 years old. She has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling clothing. She has been working in the business for some time, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She works on order for all the customers who come to her, such as friends and relatives, among others. She wants to be able to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy jackets for her business.

The group member in the added photo asked permission to arrive late for the meeting because of work reasons.

The other members work in handicrafts, a grocery store, selling beauty products, and sewing.

Señora Celinda is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this means, and she promises to make her payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy jackets for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her daughter's college tuition.

loans.name: Tres De Mayo De Ancachuro Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES DE MAYO DE ANCACHURO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Livia, la socia continua dedicándose a la ganadería, la socia lleva años de dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus animales para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia desea poder  seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de un vaca.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de agricultura, negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de venta de ganadería y negocio de crianza de animales.
La socia que sale adjunta a la foto pidio permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
La persona que sale con la cara tapada no pertence al banco comunal.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Tres de Mayo de Ancachuro. This bank is located in the district of Anta which is in the province of Anta and the department of Cusco. The featured member is Livia, she continues making a living as a cattle farmer.  She has been working in this business for years, which is going well thanks to the effort that she puts into her business every day. She raises animals to later sell them to her customers that request them in different fairs that take place throughout the region. She wants to keep working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family. She has requested this loan to buy a cow.

The other members work in agriculture, run a grocery store, sell cattle, and raise animals. The member whose picture has been cropped into the photo asked permission to arrive late to the meeting for work reasons, and the member whose face has been covered does not belong to the community bank. Livia is grateful to the people who form part of her dream in this way and promises to make her repayments according to the agreement.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de textiles, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le v a bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia vende su mercadería  a sus clientes que le solicitan en las diferentes ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar mantas entre otros.
La socia agradece el préstamo y se compromete  a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
This communal bank member continues working in her business of buying and selling textiles. She has been working in this business for years, and it is going well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She sells her merchandise to customers who come to her at the different fairs that take place in the zone. She wants to continue working so that in this way she can continue supporting her family.

She is applying for the loan to buy blankets, among other items.

She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy blankets, among other items.

loans.name: Virgen Purificada Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             
La socia es la Sra. Vilma ,la socia tiene 61 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias alquilando habitaciones para familia o estudiantes,la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio ,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para el arreglo de una de sus habitaciones.
Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de librería, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi.
La socia que aparece en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank, “Virgen Purificada”.  This bank is located in the district of Cusco, which belongs to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco.

The member is Señora Vilma.  She is 61 years old, she has two children, and she is single. She alternates her daily activities, renting rooms for families or students.  She has been engaged in this business for a long time, and it is going well for her, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She is a responsible and diligent person, and she wants to be able to continue working so that she can continue supporting her family.  She is requesting a loan in order to repair one of her rooms. 

The other members are engaged in: a bookstore business, a clothing sales business, a grocery store business, and a taxi service business. The member who appears in the attached photo requested permission to arrive late to the meeting because of work. The member thanks those who are part of this dream in this way, and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: to repair one of her rooms.

loans.name: Tafale

texts.en: Tafale is a 34-year-old unwed mother of three children. She makes and sells donuts, pies and chicken pies in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business. Tafale needs a loan to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a deep pot, a new stove, yeast and a large strainer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tafale has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, cooking oil, a deep pot, a new stove, yeast and a large strainer

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “REYNITA DE BELEN CCORAO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Ccorao, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Teresa; La socia sigue dedicándose a  su negocio  de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz) la socia vende a sus clientes que le solicitan a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a sus negocios de  venta de artesanía y  crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva años dedicándose  a sus negocios los cuales le traen satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de maíz.
 La socia se siente agradecida  por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Teresa belongs to the communal savings bank "REYNITA DE BELEN CCORA". The bank is located in the district of Ccorao, in the province of Cusco and within the Cusco department.

She continues to work inn her business selling chicha (a corn-based drink). She sells to customers that seek her products, while at the same time she continues to sell crafts and small farm animals.

Teresa has devoted years pursuing her businesses which bring her both economic and personal rewards. She wishes to continue working and that way continue supporting her family. 

She is  requesting a loan for the purchase of corn. 

Teresa is grateful for the loan and is committed to satisfy the repayment of her loan.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Leonia

texts.en: Leonia is 60 years old and married with three children. She has a small garden where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 10 years. Leonia needs a loan to buy chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer and new overalls. She has been a member of SPBD since 2004. Leonia will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, fertilizer and new overalls

loans.name: Vironidia

texts.en:
Vironidia is a 44-year-old married woman with seven children,  four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Vironidia has a food and fruit vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 13,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and ingredients for her business.

Vironidia has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Vironidia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Eve

texts.en:
Eve is 31 years old and single, with 2 children.  She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market.  She has been doing this for 2 years. 

Eve needs a loan to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar, gloves, a machete, a spade, and a sprayer.  She has been a member of SPBD since 2014.  Eve will save her profits for the expansion of her business in a few years time.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a new wheelbarrow, a crowbar, gloves, a machete, a spade, and a sprayer.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en:
Romana is 62 years old and married with seven children. Romana is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Romana requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Romana has been in this business for five years now, and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. Romana would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her beauty product sales business.

loans.name: Ruperta

texts.es:
La socia Ruperta se dedica al negocio de venta de plasticos,la socia vende al por mayor,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de plasticos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar plasticos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The group member, Ruperta, sells plastics.  She sells wholesale, starting work at 8:00 am and finishing at 5:00 pm.  She has been in this line of work for several years now and has been very successful.  

Her dream is to expand her business.  

She is asking for a loan to buy more plastics wholesale.

She is happy with the loan system and promises to meet the monthly payments.

loans.use: to buy plastics wholesale.

loans.name: Alvina

texts.es:
Alvina es una mujer de 24 años de edad soltera y madre de un hijo.
Ella vive con su mamá y su hijo de 4 años, su mamá se encarga del cuidado del su niño mientras ella se ocupa del  trabajo, ella inicio un emprendimiento  hace cuatro años y se dedica a la venta de productos farmacéuticos naturales. Alvina tiene una tienda donde expone a la venta sus productos naturales, estos productos tienen gran demanda por lo que el negocio prospera muy bien. Alvina piensa que su negocio es una bendición, porque hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultades, los productos tienen gran rotación y el lugar ya es conocido. Ella sueña con que su negocio siga generando buenos ingresos, para ello piensa que debe hacer una remodelación porque el color de las paredes está desgastado y corroído por la humedad, esto va en contra de la buena imagen de sus ventas.
Es por ese motivo que Alvina solicita un préstamo para el refaccionamiento de su tienda y así generar ingresos para el futuro de su bebé.
texts.en:
Alvina, 24, is a single mother of one four-year-old child.

She lives with her mother, who takes care of her son while she works.  She started her business four years ago and she sells natural medicines. She has a store where she displays these medicines.  Her products are in high demand so she has been very successful. 

She thinks that her business is a blessing, because up until now she has not had any difficulties with it.  The products sell well and the store is well-known. She hopes that her business will continue to generate a good income for her.  

She would like to refurbish the store because the paint on the walls is a bit worn out and is showing signs of damp.  This doesn't reflect the healthy image that her sales give her.  

For this reason, she is asking for a loan to refurbish her store and generate more income for the future of her young child.

loans.use: to improve her store and generate an income to look after her child.

loans.name: Alto Villa Victoria Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ALTO VILLA VICTORIA” iniciará el vigésimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora María es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: servicio de transporte, servicio de limpieza, venta de víveres, venta de chompas, menta de mantas de alpaca, venta de detergentes, venta de cosméticos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora María es integrante, ella indica que  es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una compañera que es clienta de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de  taller de costura de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace tres años atrás, al observar que este producto se comercializaba ampliamente y no te nía fecha de caducidad decide emprender su negocio independientemente. 
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene cinco hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones, el área de salud, los ahorros y el crédito que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alto Villa Victoria" have started their 27th cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II office.  The group is made up of eight members and is run by a board of directors of which Maria is the president. The businesses that the different members run vary, such as: transport service, cleaning service, garden center, sale of sweaters, alpaca wool blankets, sale of detergents, cosmetics sales, food sales.

The loan will benefit the group of small businesses, of which Maria is an integral part.  She tells us that it is her first time in Pro Mujer and that she joined after being invited to by a colleague who is is also a member of the organization. At the moment she has a clothes sewing business.  She started this business three years ago when she saw that this was a product that sold very well and doesn't go out of style.  She decided to set up her own business as an independent worker. 
 
The loan is to increase her capital (by buying clothes wholesale) which she will buy from the wholesale traders in La Paz and then sell them on in her store. This work allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She lives with her husband and she has five children.  

What she most likes about being a member of Pro Mujer is the training, health assistance, savings and loans that they offer.

loans.use: to buy clothes wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish building her home.

loans.name: Jose Benito

texts.es:
Al caer las primeras gotas de lluvia en los terrenos nicaragüenses, los agricultores empiezan su ciclo laboral como toda una tradición. Para José, un agricultor 68 años, esta no es la excepción. Desde hace varios años, este hombre trabajador emprendió en el camino de la agricultura, el cual pensó no lograría debido a que solo había estudiado la primaria por problemas económicos. Padre de tres hijos mayores quienes colaboran con él, para hacer de este trabajo el mejor, y esposo de una hermosa mujer, quien siempre lo ha acompañado en su día a día.   
Hace poco tiempo, José había solicitado un préstamo en MiCrédito-KIVA, para poder cubrir los costos de producción de una manzana para sembrar maiz, pagando mano de obra, fertilizantes y fungicidas. Agradecido por los buenos resultados, ahora que empieza de nuevo la temporada, necesita de un nuevo préstamo para la cosecha de tabaco, con el cual comprará lo necesario de fertilizante, maquinaria para regar y pagar a su equipo de trabajo. Con esto, espera que los buenos rendimientos sigan, que los ingresos continúen creciendo como su esperanza para seguir trabajando, de manera que pueda hacer mejoras en su casa, su finca y pueda darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
As the first drops of rain fall on Nicaraguan land, the farmers start their traditional cycle of work. Jose, a 68-year-old farmer is no exception. Several years ago, this man started to work in agriculture.  He didn't think that he would make it, as he had only ever studied primary education due to financial difficulties when he was young. 

He is the father of three adult children who help him work as well as he can.  He has a beautiful wife who always supports him, day after day.   

A short time ago, Jose asked for a loan from MiCredito-Kiva to cover the costs of sowing a plot of land with corn together with the purchase of labor, fertilizers and fungicides. He is very grateful because he can see the good results.  

Now, as the season starts again, he is asking for a new loan for a tobacco harvest.  For this he needs to buy fertilizer, a watering machine and to pay for labor costs.   

With this loan, he hopes that he will continue to be successful and generate an income which will allow him to make improvements to his home and offer the best quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, watering equipment and labor.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en: Sela is a 36-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small fishing business in her community to earn a living. She has 13 years of experience with this business. Sela needs a loan to buy a new boat motor, new fishing rods, a fishing line, bait, hooks, petrol and new goggles. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sela has been a member of SPBD since 2001.

loans.use: to buy a new boat motor, new fishing rods, a fishing line, bait, hooks, petrol and new goggles

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
As a married parent of one child, Anna Marie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from electronic mobile load retailing. Anna Marie is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of fish to sell to her customers.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Anna Marie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia Hilda continua dedicándose a su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia lleva años de dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez continua dedicándose a la crianza a de animales como para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan en las distintas ferias que se realizan por la zona, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hilda continues to manage a business of selling cereals. She has been in this business for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day into her work. At the same time, she continues to raises animals that she can sell to customers who request them at the various fairs that are held in the area. Hilda wants to continue working in this manner so that she can continue supporting her family.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy guinea pigs. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Haiber Danilo

texts.es: Cansado de trabajar bajo el mandato de otra persona y someterse siempre ha recibir el mismo salario y ordenes que le cortaban las alas para poder volar hacia una mejor vida, Haiber un joven de tan solo 20 años de edad quiere montar un negocio para distribuir comida como alitas picantes, costillas, salchipapas, choripapas, chuzos, jugos naturales y para ello arrendo  un local el cual quiere adecuar, realizarse publicidad y comprarle varios implementos y equipos de cocina para ello solicita un crédito el cual invertirá en surtido, publicidad y un horno industrial para comenzar con su negocio del que tiene grandes expectativas pues será su primer paso al progreso con el que no solo se beneficiara mental, psicológicamente pues demostrara que esta para grandes cosas sino que también puede pagarse sus estudios profesionales que es su gran deseo con este negocio.
texts.en:
After being tired of working for other people, submitting to their demands, and receiving the same amount of pay, sometimes it is best to spread one’s wings and fly in order to have a better life. Haiber, a young man who is only 20 years of age, wants to establish a business where he can sell food such as hot wings, ribs, sausages and potatoes, chorizo and potatoes, kabobs, and natural juices. To accomplish this goal, he wants to acquire a shop that he can remodel, do some advertising, and buy various tools and kitchen equipment. In order to do this, Haiber is requesting a loan so that he can invest in inventory, advertising, and an industrial oven so that he can start his business.

He has grand expectations for this will be the first step he takes toward making progress, as well as a mental and psychological boost, since this will demonstrate that he can accomplish great things. In addition, this will allow him to pay for his professional studies, which is a huge goal that he wants to accomplish along with this business.

loans.use: to buy food and supplies, an industrial oven, and pay for advertising so that he can start his business.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia Veronica se dedica al negocio de venta de gaseosas y cervezas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene varios años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde puede vender las gaseosas y cervezas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar gaseosas y cervezas.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Veronica has a business in which she sells sodas and beer. She works from 8:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. Veronica has been in this business for several years and is doing very well.

She dreams of having a shop where she can sell sodas and beer. Veronica is requesting a loan in order to buy more inventory. She is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy sodas and beer.

loans.name: Luz Iris

texts.es:
Luz es una muy trabajadora y comprometida joven de tan solo 22 años de edad la cual tiene una bella niña de 4 años, se desempeña atendiendo un cibercafé donde prestas servicio de internet, impresión y fax y con lo que puede mantener los gastos de su hogar y lo más importante generar dinero suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su hija. 
Por ser una mujer que apenas está constituyendo su negocio y que quiere crecer, para consolidarse como empresa y como persona. Por esta razón solicita un crédito para surtir su negocio con insumos de papelería y frituras para engrandecer y ampliar sus servicios.
Su sueño es poder crecer para tener recursos suficientes para educar y alimentar a su hija.
texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking and committed young woman who is only 22 years of age. She has a beautiful four-year-old daughter. Luz manages a cybercafé where she provides Internet, printing, and fax services. This business allows her to sustain her household and, most importantly, generate enough money to cover her daughter’s expenses.

For a woman who is just starting her business and wanting it grow, Luz desires to establish herself as an entrepreneur and as a person. For this reason, she is requesting a loan to restock her business with stationery supplies, as well as snack foods, so that she can expand and increase her services.

Her dream is to grow so that she can have sufficient resources to feed her daughter and provide her with an education.

loans.use: to buy stationery supplies and snack foods that she can sell in her cybercafé.

loans.name: Armando Edelmiro

texts.es:
Armando es un hombre trabajador, tiene 22 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Huancavelica con su familia.
Su mayor motivación es su familia, es por ellos que trabaja arduamente para poder brindarles un futuro mejor.
Desde hace más de 3 años trabaja en Construcción Civil como obrero y le va muy bien porque es muy responsable, 
trabajador y con muchos deseos de superación.
Armando está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar una cocina para su casa y una cama, de esta manera mejorará la calidad de vida de su familia y seguirá esforzándose para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Armando is a hardworking man. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his family in Huancavelica. His family is his primary motivation, so he works hard in order to provide a better future for them. For the past three years, he has worked in the construction sector as a laborer. He is doing very well because he is responsible, hardworking, and has the drive to succeed.

Armando is grateful to the Kiva lenders because of the support they have provided. He will be able to buy a stove for his house and a bed. This will improve his family’s quality of life and he continues his efforts to move forward.

loans.use: to buy a stove and a bed.
